loans.name: Djumagul

texts.en:
Djumagul lives with her husband and her three children. She is a tailor who offers her great services to her neighbors. Her earnings are used to help cover her household expenses. Her work and her financial contribution have enhanced her self-esteem and her self-confidence. Djumagul is very proud of her work. This is the third time that Djumagul has requested a loan from IMON International, a Kiva partner. Having said this, Djumagul has an excellent history of on-time repayment. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing fabrics for sewing

loans.name: Gulzhan's Group

texts.en: Married and the mother of five children, Gulzhan is the leader of the group. She has five children: four daughters and one son. Even though one of her daughters is married and her son has gone to Moscow to work, after having reached the age of forty-seven, she still has to look after her other three daughters, the smallest of whom is just four years old. For the sake of that she is engaged in stock-raising. Mainly, Gulzhan purchases calves and feeds and resells them. Her husband helps her after work. She started this business twenty-five years ago with just eight dollars. Now her monthly income is 150 dollars! “Cattle-breeding is not the most profitable business. It is not sitting in a clean office gazing into a monitor, doing accounts. Anyway by raising cattle, we’ve been able to buy a house, furniture, home equipment and even pay for the marriage of our eldest daughter,” says Gulzhan proudly. Currently, Gulzhan needs a loan to increase her livestock population, fatten it up and resell it. In the near future she is going to have a new shed built and a hay-loft, as well as finishing the building of her house, buy her son a car and pay for another daughter’s wedding. Gulzhan has four partners: Nurzada, Baktijar, Dilbar and Dzhanatkul. Dzhanatkul works as a cook at a school lunch room. The rest are occupied with cattle-breeding. All the members need loans mainly to purchase more livestock, so that they can resell it later. Nurzada inherited four sheep and one cow. Now she has ten sheep and two cows. She wants a shed to store fodder, after buying a car to get married. Baktijar started with buying sheep. Then he bought horned cattle. For the moment he has sheep, oxen and a horse. Dilbar and her husband used to save money to buy cattle. Now theу have a cow, a calf and sheep. She wants to buy a car and pay for her son’s marriage. Years ago Dzhanatkul bought a cow which provided seven liters of milk a day. Now she has three cows and gets twenty liters a day. ====================================== --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase cattle and cattle feed

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es: La señora Josefa  Somarraba tiene la edad de 47 años, reside en el barrio  Rene Cisnero en la capital de Managua, casada y con tres hijos que estudian, sus planes es mejorar las condiciones de vida para su familia, su negocio es una pulpería que desde hace quince año logro poner con los ahorros y ayuda de su esposo y con las ganancias de la venta de refrescos y golosinas. Con este préstamo quiere invertir en la compra de granos básicos y eskimo ya que tiene un freezer de venta de eskimo el cual se vende mucho por su rico sabor. Su objetivo es poder crecer en ventas para obtener mejores ganancias. Da las gracias a la institución por el apoyo con el prestamos adquirido ya que podrá fortalecer su negocio y beneficiar a su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Josefa Somarraba is 47 years old and lives in the Rene Cisnero neighborhood of the capital city, Managua. She is married, and has three children who are currently in school. She plans to improve her family's living conditions. Josefa runs a small grocery store, which she was able open 15 years ago thanks to her savings, her husband's help, and the money she earned selling drinks and sweets. She will use this loan to buy basic grains and Eskimo brand ice cream for her freezer. She sells a lot of this ice cream, thanks to its delicious flavor. Her goal is to sell more so that she can earn more in profits. She would like to thank the institution, because previous loans have allowed her to strengthen her business and support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic grains and Eskimo ice cream

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is amember of the itiji West borrower group in Itiji,Mbeya,she is 32 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 4 children.Her children are aged 12,15,18, and 20 years.

Eva started her own shop business selling rice,salts,cooking oil 1 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 200,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Eva first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more shop commodities like rice etc.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan Eva hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more shop commodities

loans.name: Bonifacio

texts.es: Don Bonifacio M. tiene la edad de 54 años en los que desde joven ha estado trabajando en la venta de lotería convencional y con la ayuda de su esposa logro establecer un pequeño negocio de una pulpería en su vivienda. Para esto es importante señalar que Fundación León 2000 ha sido su mano amiga en varias ocasiones concediéndole créditos para llegar a establece este negocio. Para seguir fortaleciendo la pulpería que tiene en su hogar se Bonifacio precisa de un financiamiento y de esta manera invertir en el comprando materia como es aceite, arroz, frijoles, pan, detergentes, jabón, consomé, y otros productos que necesita tener de venta. Es por eso que el solicita a esta institución un financiamiento con el cual ya esta contando para lograr las metas que se propuso para este año.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Jeanne's Group

texts.fr: D. Jeanne est née le 01/01/1958 à Grand-Popo. Jeanne est mariée à SOUKOU Martin, un tailleur. Ce couple a à sa charge six enfants dont quatre sont les leurs. La famille réside depuis vingt deux ans à Fridjrossè, un quartier de Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin. Grâce au revenu de son activité, Jeanne vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille. Jeanne vend de façon ambulante des tissus. Mais, Jeanne vend aussi du SODABI, une boisson alcoolisée produit au Bénin. C’est à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin que Jeanne achète ses produits. Jeanne a déjà dix ans d’expérience dans cette activité. Jeanne a déjà eu deux crédits d’ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés et avec lesquels elle a pu élever le niveau de son activité. Pour continuer à développer son activité, Jeanne demande un troisième crédit pour renforcer son fonds de roulement.
texts.en:
D. Jeanne was born on January 1, 1958 in Grand-Popo. She is married to SOUKOU Martin, a tailor. This couple has six children to support. Four of them are their own. For 22 years, the family has been residing in Fridjrossè, a district in Cotonou, the economic capital of the Republic of Benin. Thanks to the income from her business, Jeanne comes to her husband’s aid in covering family expenses. She sells cloth door-to-door. But she also sells SODABI, an alcoholic drink produced in Benin. Dantokpa, the grand international marketplace of Benin, is where Jeanne buys her products. Jeanne already has ten years of experience in this business. She had two loans with ALIDé that she has repaid. She was able to use the loans to raise her level of business. To continue to develop it, she’s asking for a third loan to bolster her working capital.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cloth and drums of the drink SODABI

loans.name: Klizisto's Group

texts.en: N. Klizisto is the leader of his lending group in Mukono. He is a hard working and responsible man with a wife and 7 children all in school although 3 of them are soon completing and in higher institutions of learning. He also helps to take care of other orphans and dependants belonging to his late siblings. Klizisto is a business man involved in fishing whereby he sells most of the fish that that he catches from Terere landing site as well as selling to his retail customers using his bicycle to move the fish around to his customers. Fishing is his first job ever since he was a teenager and he is happy that it is paying. He has been able to educate his children as well as acquiring tangible property out of it plus with the help of loans. He has his own boats that he uses to fish and as he saves, he needs to buy another boat for expansion. He needs a loan to help buy more fishing materials like fishing nets, hooks, and jecks for improved service.

loans.use: Buying more fishing materials like hooks, fishing nets and jecks for improved services.

loans.name: Sin's Group

texts.en: Mr. Sin S. is a farmer with a 1 acre field in which he grows rice. His fields are now infertile, and he cannot grow any more rice. He is taking out this loan so he will be able to purchase fertilizer to be able to grow rice on his only field. He has a wife who is fifty years and two children, one a monk and one who is in school. His wife sells cakes, candy and other food in the local school where their son attends. They live in the Damnak village in Takeo province.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mrs. Mary L., 49 and her husband, Mr. Mat Sos, 50, live along National Road Number Six, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1985 and have six children: four sons and two daughters. The daughters are married and live in separate homes, two sons are fishermen and two sons are in school. Her husband is a fisherman.

Mary sells fish that her husband catches at the village market. Some of her husband’s fishing nets are broken, so she is requesting a loan of $600 to help purchase new fishing nets, so he will able to continue his business.

loans.use: To purchase new fishing nets for her husband’s fishing business.

loans.name: Esperanza Group

texts.en: This committee was formed in Caaguazú, when Emerita Quiñonez invited a group of women to come together when she learned about the Women’s Entrepreneurship program. She gathered 17 women, all of whom were enthusiastic about working together to take out a loan to improve their businesses. All of the women already had jobs, as venders of clothing, shoes, jewelry, fruits and vegetables. They decided to use their loan to invest further in their businesses, and received between PYG1,200,000 and PYG300,000 each depending on the size of their business. They used their loans to buy sugar, meat, flour, eggs, noodles, cheese, candy, and clothing, including jeans, shirts, skirts, lingerie. They share a common goal to improve their businesses and their lives, for themselves and for their families.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Toyin

texts.en:
Toyin sells frozen foods at retail prices to her customers. She has 2 deep freezers that she uses to store her frozen foods. This is the high season for sales and she hopes to make more profits during this season. She has been in this business for 6 years. The demand for her frozen foods is high. She hopes to own a poultry farm in the future.

Toyin is 44 years old and married with 2 children. She lives in Lagos state, Nigeria. She hopes for a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more frozen food to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Nereyda Yanetza

texts.es:
En el municipio de Nagarote, la señora Nereyda S. posee su propia pulpería la que está surtida con granos básicos, verduras, ropa y productos refrigerados como carne, pollo y embutidos que son vendidos a sus clientes de la cuadra y del barrio donde habita. 

Ella se ha destacado por ser muy trabajadora y a pesar que es madre soltera y con un hijo que mantener, ha logrado brindarle las condiciones necesarias de vida para que este niño se desarrolle. 

El crédito que ella está solicitando es para la compra de los productos para la pulpería, entre los productos que ella comprará se encuentran granos básicos como arroz, azúcar, aceite, jamón, huevos, carne de res y de pollo. Espera ser beneficiada con este crédito para mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
In the city of Nagarote, Mrs. Nereyda Sanchez owns a grocery store supplied with grains, vegetables, clothing and chilled products such as meet, chicken and sausages. She sells these products to clients from her block and neighborhood.

She stood out for being a hard worker. Even though she is a single mother with a son to support, she has managed to provide him with the necessary life conditions he needs to develop.

The loan she is requesting is to buy products for her store, among them basic grains like rice, sugar, olive oil, ham, eggs, pork and chicken meet. She hopes to get this loan to improve her life conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Giovanna Fernandes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for her store

loans.name: Khoem

texts.en: V. is forty-eight years old and a resident of Kampong Chhnang Province, where she has established a small family home and earns a living as a local farmer. She was married, but has divorced her husband, and she has two teenage children. One of her daughters sews clothes in the local garment factory and has provided her little income to feed her family. V. needs a loan to repair the often-broken roof of her old house.

loans.use: To repair the roof of her old house

loans.name: Solange

texts.fr: A. Solange est née en 1968 à Parakou, au Nord du Bénin. Il y a 11 ans environs que Solange s’est installée à Djeffa dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji au Bénin. Mariée à VODOUNNOU Josué, un policier, Solange est mère de cinq enfants, tous scolarisés. Solange vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari à Djeffa. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la maison. Solange n’a jamais fréquenté l’école. Depuis environs sept ans, Solange vend divers produits (farine de manioc, sucre, huile végétale, biscuits, lait, sardine, eau de javel, etc.) à son domicile. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Solange s’approvisionne. Solange a bénéficié antérieurement de trois crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés. Malgré la passion que Solange a pour son activité, elle ne dispose pas d'assez de fonds pour mener à bien son activité et se faire plus de revenus à la hauteur de ses charges. Pour ce fait, Solange sollicite un quatrième crédit pour renforcer son activité afin de faire face d’une part à ses différentes charges, et d’autre part pour se faire une épargne consistante.
texts.en:
A. Solange was born in 1968 in Parakou, in northern Benin. About eleven years ago, she got situated in Djeffa, in the community of Sèmè-Podji in Benin. Married to VODOUNNOU Josué, a police officer, she is the mother of five children who are all in school. She lives together with her children and husband in Djeffa. The couple jointly ensures that house expenses are covered. Solange never attended school. For seven years, she has been selling a variety of goods (cassava flour, sugar, vegetable oil, cookies, milk, sardines, bleach, etc.) out of her home. Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, is where she stocks up. She has benefited from three ALIDé loans before, which she repaid. Despite the passion she has for her work, she doesn't have enough funds for carrying out her work and for earning more revenues from it to meet her responsibilities. To do so, she's requesting a fourth loan for bolstering her business, so as to cope, on the one hand, with her different responsibilities and to built up, on the other hand, substantial savings.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying cookies, vegetable oil, bleach, cassava flour, canned foods

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es: Martha Lorena tiene 46 años, es una persona responsable. Ella se dedica a una pulpería, por lo que tiene más de 10 años de realizar esta labor. Ella realizo muchos sacrificios para mejorar sus ingresos ya comenzó con muy poco capital porque no tenía el apoyo de su familia, algunas veces dejaba a sus hijos solos porque salía al mercado en busca de los diferentes productos. Pero gracias a su duro trabajo logro preparar a sus 2 hijos que laboran de manera independiente. Ella solicita este crédito para la compra de granos básicos, golosinas en general, gaseosas, refrescos naturales entre otros productos. Su deseo es obtener una gran fama en su negocio y que su pulpería sea mucho más grande.
texts.en:
Martha Lorena, 46, is a responsible person. She has had a small grocery store for over 10 years. Her business started thanks to many personal sacrifices because, in order to improve her earnings, she started off with very little capital; she had no help from her family. Sometimes she had to leave her children unattended when she'd go to market in search of various products. However, thanks to all her hard work, she succeeded in raising her two children so that they could work independently. She is asking for funding to buy basic stock items for her store: grains, soft-drinks, fruit juices, etc. Her wish is to be well-known for her work and that her store become much larger.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock inventory for her store.

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en: Jeremiah is 50 years old and married with six children. Five of his children are in school. He has been running a spare-parts shop where he sells spare parts and tires for six years now. He earns extra income from small-scale farming. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to provide the basic needs for his family and pay his children's school fees. Jeremiah, who describes himself as aggressive and very enduring, hopes to open a very big spare-parts shop and garage in the future. He previously had a Faulu loan of 15,000 KES and is now requesting another loan of 30,000 KES to purchase more spare parts and tires.

loans.use: Purchase spare parts and tires.

loans.name: Soeun

texts.en:
Mr. Soeun S. is a villager who lives in Prey Thum village in the Takeo province. He and his wife, Mrs. Khean Kea, are farmers who own a 3-hectare field and cultivate rice to earn a living. In order to support the farming crops, Mr. Soeun S. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide. With the rest of the loan, he wants to repair his plowing machine. 

This couple has five children, two of whom are seamstresses in the garment factory, while two others are farmers who support their parents' farm and the last one is attending the local school. His wife in on the right in the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
To make a living in Ibadan, Oyo state, Rhoda makes lovely hair styles for her customers. She also sells hair materials like cream and hair extensions to boost her business. She loves this business because of the opportunity to interact with her customers. She hopes to grow her business to become bigger and stronger. She is requesting a loan of 60,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more hair materials to sell. 

Rhoda is 36 years old, married with 2 children. Her children are doing well at school and this makes her happy. She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: Beauty salon supplies

loans.name: Francisca Rosalinda

texts.es:
La señora Francisca de 52  años de edad es comerciante, cuenta con una pequeña despensa, ella es casada, su cónyuge es mecánico de una empresa de transporte, tienen tres hijos, todos ya mayores de edad que le ayudan en el negocio. 
La mayoría de los productos  que vende son de consumo masivo de la canasta familiar. Empezó gracias a la ayuda de su cónyuge, actualmente cuenta con una despensa bien surtida y clientela formada.
 
Solicita el préstamo a Fundación Paraguaya para la compra de una nueva congeladora, ya también quiere ofrecer a sus clientes productos lácteos y estos necesariamente deben estar refrigerados, ella esta con mucha esperanza de conseguir el crédito y así fortalecer su negocio.
texts.en:
La señora Francisca is 52 years old. She is a storekeeper, and her store has a small pantry. She is married. Her husband is a mechanic at a transportation business. They have three children, all of whom are grown and help with the business. The majority of the products sold in the store are for daily family consumption. She began her business with the help of her husband. She currently maintains a well-stocked pantry and an established customer base. She is asking for a loan from the Paraguaya Foundation to buy a new refrigerator since she now offers her customers dairy products, which need to be refrigerated. She is full of hope to get a loan in order to build her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of refrigerator

loans.name: Caminantes Group

texts.es:
María Luisa D. es integrante de la Asociación Comunal Caminantes  que a su vez pertenece al Centro Focal Juan Pablo, tiene 48 años y es vecina de la ciudad de El Alto, específicamente vive en la zona Villa Esther, hace 6 meses.
 
Ella se dedica a la venta de alimento seco, como arroz, fideo, trigo, harina, azúcar y otros, desde hace 12 años aproximadamente.

Las demás integrantes de esta  Asociación tienen actividades económicas como confección de vestidos, venta de comida, cosméticos, ropa, api, condimentos, frutas y artesanía.

Todas necesitan el préstamo para invertir y mejorar sus negocios.
texts.en:
Maria Luisa D. is part of the community group Caminantes, which is part of the Juan Pablo Focal Center. Maria is 48 years old. Six months ago she moved to Villa Esther, near the city of El Alto. For about 12 years, she has been selling dry goods including rice, noodles, wheat, flour, sugar, etc. The other members of this group make and sell clothing, food, api (a rice drink), cosmetics, spices, fruits and crafts. They will all use their loan to invest in their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying merchandise

loans.name: Prosperidad Leal Group

texts.es:
La presidenta del grupo Beatriz se dedica a la venta de comida de lunes a viernes, hace varios años con sus pocos ingresos puede costear la educación de sus hijos. El préstamo lo usara para la compra de ingredientes para las preparación de comida que le permita cumplir con sus clientes.

Gladis es la secretaria del grupo ella se dedica a la venta de diferentes productos como son: productos de belleza, zapatos y prendas de vestir. Además tiene una fuente de soda donde exhibe sus productos, tiene 2 hijos por los cuales debe de trabajar.

Carmen es podóloga ella brinda sus servicios a domicilio, desea aperturar un local donde poder atender a sus clientes ya que esta logrando hacer una cartera de clientes fijos.

Todas las socias agradecen los préstamos y desean continuar trabajando con KIVA y EDAPROSPO.
texts.en:
The president of the Beatriz group sells food from Monday through Friday. For several years ahe has been able to pay for her childrens' education with her own income. She will use the loan to purchase ingredients to prepare food which will allow her to serve her customers. Gladis is the secretary of the group. She sells different products, such as: beauty products, shoes and clothing. Inb addition, she has a soda fountain where she displays her products. She has 2 children for who she has to work. Carmen is a podiatrist. She offers her services in home visits. She wants to open a locale where she serve her customers and she is getting a regular client base. All of the members are grateful for the loans and they wish to continue working with KIVA and EDAPROSPO.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase products.

loans.name: So

texts.en: Mrs. So K. is a 46-year-old resident of Kompong Tom province. She has skills for raising pigs and growing rice, and she currently raises a few pigs for a profit. Additionally, she goes with her husband to fish around the river for extra income. In a day, this couple is able to make $4 to control the financial crisis of their family, and they have five children. K. is taking out her first loan to grow rice crops during this farming season.

loans.use: To grow rice crops during this farming season.

loans.name: Laul Group

texts.en:
Najeeba is a member of Laul group. She lives in district 8 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is married with 3 children who are enrolled in school. She is a beautician. She has got a small beauty salon in her house. She has been involved in this business for more than 7 years. In this way she can help her husband support their children as well.

She needs the loan to purchase some new quality cosmetics such as hair rollers, eye shadow, and some chairs and a new table as well. She hopes to have more progress in her business.

loans.use: buying good quality cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Betty

texts.es: Betty tiene 20 años, vive en casa de sus padres. Hace 2 años, posee una granja, donde cría animales, entre ellos cuyes y pollos, negocio que emprendió por recomendación de sus padres, desde entonces se dedica en la alimentación y limpieza de su granja. Durante las mañanas sale a cortar alfalfa, que sirve de forraje para estos animales, después termina el día limpiando los galpones, donde extrae el excremento utilizándolo como abono para sus plantas. Al llegar el fin de semana, sale a vender sus animales, por tanto ha logrado adquirir buenas rentas. La meta que se ha propuesto es ampliar su granja. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Con el crédito que solicita, utilizará en la compra de más animales de raza, así como también en materiales para ampliar su galpón.
texts.en:
Betty is 20 years old. She lives in her parents' house. For 2 years, she has owned a farm where she raises animals, among them guinea pigs and chickens. She began this business on the recommendation of her parents and since then she has worked doing the feeding and cleaning at the farm. During the morning she goes out to cut alfalfa which serves as forrage for the animals. Afterwards, she ends the day by cleaning out the sheds, where she extracts the excrement, using it as fertilizer for her plants. When the weekend comes, she goes out to sell her animals, and in this way she has been able to obtain good profit. The goal that she has proposed is enlarging her farm. This is her second loan with MFP and she is very happy to know that she has a financial support since she has always shown herself to be responsible with her payments. She also likes being part of a community group because all of the members are responsible and very supportive. She will use the laon she is asking for to buy more purebred animals, as well as materials to enlarge her shed.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy purebred animals and materials to enlarge her shed.

loans.name: Sakhy Mohammad Mina Group

texts.en:
Frozan is a member of Sakhy M. Mina Group. She lives in 10th district of Kabul, Afghanistan, and is married with four children who are school students.

Frozan has a small beauty salon where she works to support her four children and cover the expense of their school fees as well. She has requested the loan to purchase cosmetics and some required chairs for her salon.

Frozan desires to continue her career and to expand her business in a better way.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics and chairs for her salon

loans.name: Marisa

texts.en:
Marisa P. is from the village of San Miguel, Gingoog City. She is 47 years old. Marisa is widowed and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Marisa owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Marisa has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Marisa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Marisa is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Marisa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase products to sell

location.town: San Miguel, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Isezerano Choir Group

texts.fr:
S. Jean Paul  est un homme  de 40 ans, marié, née à Rubavu  un des districts de la province de l’Ouest du Rwanda, son niveau d’étude est primaire. Il a cinq enfants, le plus âgée a 16 ans et son cadet a 5 ans. Un de ses enfants est en deuxième année secondaire d’autres a l’école primaire.
Il appartient dans une chorale chrétienne a l’association des églises de pentecôte du Rwanda œuvra à Rubavu appelé ISEZERANO. Client d’ACB depuis décembre 2008, il  a sollicité un prêt qu’il veut très bien remboursé. C’était pour acheter un champ pour y cultiver les pommes de terre. Son ambition et son souhait et que dans l’avenir et d’avoir un grand étendu de culture des pommes de terre afin de commercialiser la récolte et en tirer du profit , une partie pour épargner et l’autre parti améliorera les conditions de vie de la famille en payant les frais de scolarités pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
Jean Paul S. is a 40-year old married man, born in Rubavu, a district in the West Province of Rwanda. He has finished primary level of studies. He has five children, with the oldest being 16 years of age, and the youngest 5. One of his children is in high school while the others are still in primary school. He is a member of the “Isezerano” Christian choir under the auspices of the association of Pentecostal churches of Rwanda active in Rubavu. He has been a client of ACB since December 2008. He is seeking a loan which he plans to repay properly. The loan is for purchasing a land plot in order to cultivate potatoes. His vision and his dream is to have a sizeable potato-growing business in the future, selling his harvest and using the derived profit for savings as well as for improving the life conditions of his family, such as paying the school fees for his children.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing a land plot for cultivating potatoes

loans.name: Yun

texts.en: Mrs. Yun K. has been spending her life cultivating crops, a skill she learned from her grandparents when she was young. She is now married and has five school-aged kids. Her husband (in the photo) works in the farm fields, frequently alongside her, and he also travels to fish around the river for extra income. This coming fishing season, Yun K.’s husband doesn’t have enough tools to fish. Thus, Yun K. decided to seek a loan in the amount of $700 to be used to buy fishing tools for her husband to fish. With any remaining cash from the loan, she will cultivate rice crops.

loans.use: To buy fishing tools for her husband to fish

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
María de 29 años, vive en una zona periurbana con caminos de tierra llamada “Paraíso”. Es vendedora de colchones y camas. 

Inicio su negocio hace 5 años atrás para ayudar con los gastos familiares, al principio como trabajo en un local comercial de muebles se incentivo al ver la magnitud de las ventas. Su esposo se encarga de vender los colchones y ella de administrar el local. El estilo de ventas es dar a crédito para que sus clientes paguen por cuotas los colchones.  

Con el préstamo quiere comprar colchones y camas para tener mas mercadería para vender. En el futuro quiere tener una tienda de muebles y mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
María is 29 years old and lives in a periurban area with unpaved roads called Paraíso. She sells mattresses and beds.

She started her business five years ago to help with the family expenses. At the beginning she worked in a place selling furniture, and she was motivated by seeing the number of sales. Her husband works selling the mattresses and she works managing the place. Their sales style is to sell on credit so that their customers can pay for the mattresses in installments.

With this loan, she wants to purchase mattresses and beds to have more merchandise to sell. In the future she wants to have a furniture store and to make improvements to her house.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Mattresses, beds

loans.name: Edhmie

texts.en:
Edhmie T. She is 23 years old. Edhmie is married and has one infant-aged child. She is from the town of Plaridel, a part of Claveria municipality in Misamis Oriental province on the Mindanao islands. Edhmie raises pigs for sale. She is just starting in this business.

In 2006 Edhmie joined PMPC to gain access to its financial services. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC that was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. Edhmie is requesting a new loan, her sixth from PMPC, of 16,000 PHP that will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Amada Perpetua

texts.es:
Amada de 53 años, tiene una papelería surtida con ventas de ropa, vive con su esposa y tres hijos en el Fortín de Guayaquil( zona periurbana, con caminos de tierra y lomas). 

Hace tres años atrás empezó comprando mercadería para vender a sus conocidos y amigos poco a poco como le fue bien en las ventas decidió tener un local para tener su propio local de ropa pero debido a la demanda de papelería la surtió y compro papeles, cuadernos, plumas etc. En la actualidad trabaja desde las 06h15am hasta las 21h00pm. Vende plumas, papelería, ropa etc. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar blusas, pantalones, papelería para surtir mas su negocio. En el futuro quiere que su negocio este bien surtido y tener una economía estable.
texts.en:
Amada is 53 years old and she has an office supply store from where she also sells clothing. She lives with her husband and their three children El Fortin, in Guayaquil (a mountainous suburban region with unpaved roads). 

Three years ago she started purchasing merchandise to sell to her acquaintances and friends and seeing that sales were good she decided to set up a store. She sells clothing from jer store but given the demand she also started to carry paper, notebooks, pens etc. She works from 6:15am to 9pm. She sells pens, paper, clothing, etc.

She will use this loan to purchase blouses, slacks, and office supplies to stock her business. In the future she wants to have a well-stocked business and to stabilize her finances.

loans.use: To purchase clothing and office supplies.

loans.name: Yenis  Enilce

texts.es:
Yenis C. de 48 años vive en el municipio de Soledad, muy cerca de Barranquilla, con su familia conformada por su cónyuge y sus tres hijos en las edades de 23 a 27 años.  Allí en este municipio tiene una miscelánea que ha aprovechado para ofrecer servicios telefónicos a sus clientes y que esta actividad  a su vez,  le ayuda para obtener nuevos compradores. 
Yenis es madre comunitaria al mismo tiempo que tiene su negocio:  es decir el estado nacional le  suministra alimentación a 13 niños que están bajo su cuidado, en su propio hogar,    logrando que estos estén en mejores condiciones nutricionales, mientras  sus madres trabajan, o no pueden sostenerlos,  agregándole   así a estos infantes  bienestar, para lo cual Yenis ha sido capacitada durante muchas sesiones y obtiene un subsidio que es un ingreso adicional , que contribuye  al sostenimiento de su hogar.
 Este es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, pero tiene 3 años de ser comerciante y de tener negocio; primero se dedicó a la preparación de pasteles,  ( alimentos a base de arroz, cerdo, pollo, carne y verduras, envueltos en hojas de bijao) ,  y también vendía lo que le encargaban, como ropa y cosméticos;  cuando gradualmente crecieron sus ventas y con ello sus utilidades Yenis compró una vitrina para tener más orden y exhibir mejor sus productos y en la actualidad tiene tres, muy bien surtidas de ganchos y adornos para el cabello, ropa sandalias accesorios femeninos,  y también vende hasta dulces. Ella  como aprovecha muy bien su principal mercado potencial,  que es el de las madres y familiares de los niños que atiende, últimamente puso un negocio de servicios de telefonía celular, que le representa un ingreso más y además un estímulo para que la gente se detenga y observe lo que ella tiene en sus vitrinas. Su sueño es lograr un nivel más alto de superación y desempeño personal, que sus hijos se conviertan en personas exitosas y sobre todo ampliar su negocio preparándolo  para que este se convierta en una gran empresa familiar.
 Su Credikiva lo invertirá en la compra de ropa infantil, para damas, preparándose para responder a su clientela este fin de año, y también para la compra de artículos de papelería, aprovechando que no es la temporada escolar y que consigue precios más económicos,   para en el mes de Enero,  época en la que repuntan sus ventas de papelería y es temporada escolar, lograr  alcanzar por lo menos un 30% más en el aumento de sus ventas y así empezar fortaleciendo su sueño.
texts.en:
Yenis C. is 48 and lives in the Soledad municipality, very close to Barranquilla, with her family consisting of her spouse and their 3 children aged 23 to 27.  There in this municipality she has a general store which has made the most of offering telephone services to her customers and this business in turn, helps her to get more customers. 
Yenis is a foster mother as well as having her business:  this means the national state provides her food for 13 children who are under her care, in her own home, keeping them in better nutritional condition, while their mothers work, or cannot support them,  adding to the wellbeing of these children, for which Yenis has qualified for over many sessions and gets a subsidy which is an additional income , which contributes to supporting her home.
 This is her first financing with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, but she has been a storekeeper and had her business for 3 years; first she made pies,  ( food with a base of rice, pork, chicken, meat and vegetables, wrapped in bijao leaves) ,  and also selling on commission, items such as clothes and cosmetics;  when her sales gradually increased and with it her profits Yenis bought a display cabinet to have more order and show her products better and currently she has three, very well supplied with hangers and decorated for hair, clothes, sandals, and female accessories,  and she also sells sweets. She makes the most of her potential market,  who are mothers and families of children who she looks after, recently she has had a mobile phone business, which gives her more income and is also a stimulus so that people stop and see what she has in her displays. Her dream is to achieve a better level of living and personal performance, that her children are successful and above all grow her business so that it becomes a great family company.
 Her Credikiva will be used to buy clothes for children, women, preparing her to get ready for her customers for year end, and also to buy stationery, making the most of it not being the school season and that her prices are more economical. In the month of January,  a time where she improves her stationery sales and it is the school season, she achieves at least 30% more in the increase of her sales and then she will begin to realise her dream.

loans.use: Purchase clothes for children, for women, preparing her to get ready for her customers for year end, and also to buy stationery, making the most of it not being the school season and that her prices are more economical

loans.name: Naitaiyuang Enole

texts.en:
Naitaiyuang Enole P. is 28 years old and married to Tonou P.. She is the mother of six school-going children. Naitaiyuang is a maize farmer in the Narok area and she has been doing farming for profit for the last 12 years.

She learned about KADET from other women in a group already registered with KADET in her area of residence. This will be her second loan. She is planning to spend 30,000 Kenyan shillings (Kshs) to prepare the land for maize planting and Kshs 10,000 to buy seeds and fertilizers. She hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand her farming activity from small-scale to commercial farming.

Naitaiyuang's dream is do large-scale farming and attain financial independence. She is a hardworking woman who is determined to achieve her set goals.

loans.use: Preparing land for maize planting and buying seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Silah Kiprono

texts.en:
Silah Kiprono K. is a 38-year-old businessman who buys cows and sells them to customers at a profit. He is married to Lydia Chebii and they have four children ages three, eight, 12 and 18. Silah has been running his business in Chepkosum Eldoret, Kenya for the past two years. 

Silah was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend and he has no other history with other microfinance institutions. He is applying for a first loan of 50,000 KES to purchase more cows to sell and improve his customer service. 

In the future, Silah hopes to expand his business to other towns around Eldoret.

loans.use: to purchase cows

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
Lita J. is from the village of Malinao, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 61 years old. Lita is widowed and has eight adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a bakeshop, baking and selling a variety of staple products including bread in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately $100 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Lita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional cooking ingredients. 

Lita is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional baking ingredients like flour and eggs. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional cooking ingredients like flour and eggs

loans.name: Violeta

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “INTI QUILLA”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Violeta; La socia tiene 35 años de edad, es conviviente, y tiene 1 hijo, la socia se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa, ella trae de la ciudad de Lima, también viaja a Bolivia y trae ropa de todo tipo y de diferentes tallas para mujeres y varones, la socia ya tiene aquí sus clientes fijos y cada vez que ella tien mercadería nueva ella los visita y reparte sus prendas después de unas semanas pasa para cobrar la primera parte del dinero y en las siguientes dos semanas el total de las prendas. La socia trabaja con instituciones grandes de este modo ella tiene un mercado seguro. La socia desea el préstamo para poder viajar a traer nueva mercadería aprovechando que en la ciudad de Lima comenzó el verano y muchas fábricas están liquidando las prendas de invierno.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the "Inti Quilla" communal bank, which is located in the district of Huanchac, in the province and department of Cusco.

This borrower is Ms. Violeta.  She is 35 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has one son.  Violeta buys and sells clothing.  She brings clothing from the city of Lima and also travels to Bolivia.  She brings back all types of clothing, in different sizes for both men and women.  She has regular customers  and each time that she has new merchandise, she visits them and offers her garments for sale.  After a few weeks, she goes back to collect the first part of their payment, and in the following two weeks, she collects the total price for each garment.  Violeta works with large establishments, so she has a reliable market.  She is requesting this loan in order to be able to travel to bring back new merchandise.  She would like to take advantage of the fact that in the city of Lima, the summer is beginning and many factories are liquidating their winter garments.

Violeta is happy to receive this loan and she promises to comply with her established repayment schedule.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Bugongi United Savings And Credit Group C-Kihihi

texts.en:
Robert B., 31, a happily married father with three children, is best described as a hard-worker by nature. At least he has lived up to that description the last 10 years operating a commercial agricultural business in Kito-Kihihi. 

That hard work ethic has enabled him to make significant strides in a business that was once regarded as Uganda's economic backbone. That statement must be put into perspective because there has been a gradual shift away from commercial agriculture as a means of subsistence through the course of the last 30 years in Uganda. 

Robert, for the most part, sells bananas. Bananas are a staple food in most parts of western Uganda. Before he obtained a firm footing in this business, Robert was selling mostly coffee, which is also a cash crop of high financial value. 

With this loan, Robert says he is going to buy pesticides to get rid of the bugs that have been playing havoc with his banana plantations. Robert says that, in the future, he is looking to expand his banana plantations by buying more acres of land.

Robert belongs to Bugongi United Savings and Credit group-Kihihi.

loans.use: To purchase pesticides

loans.name: Raúl Alberto

texts.es:
En el Municipio de Granada, del Departamento de Granada, labora desde muy temprano el señor Raúl Alberto C. B. como Operador de Pozo desde hace once años en una empresa que se encuentra ubicada en esa misma localidad. Con este ingreso que posee este señor es que costea los gastos de su esposa y su hijo.

El anhelo que tiene este señor que el de mejorar su casa de habitación y por tal razón visita las oficinas de CEPRODEL para solicitar un crédito y realizar Mejoramiento de vivienda, y de esta forma contribuir al bienestar de su familia.

Este señor se está anticipando a la época de invierno y quiere que su familia tenga todas las condiciones para que no se enfermen en esta temporada.
texts.en:
Sr. Raúl Alberto C. B. has worked for a company in the town of Granada, Department of Granada, for the past eleven years as a well operator. The income he earns is used to cover the expenses of his wife and children.

Sr. Raúl wants to repair his home, so he has visited the offices of CEPRODEL to request a loan in order to make these improvements and provide for the welfare of his family.

Sr. Raúl is anticipating the winter season and wants his family to live in conditions that will prevent them from getting sick.

loans.use: Home improvements

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her business of selling clothes. She will utilize the loan money by buying clothes of different varieties that will allow her to offer more choice to her clients and to earn more profits. 

She lives in Faisalabad, which is famous for its textile industry. She lives there in a two-room brick house in the area of Barkatpura. She moved here 15 years ago with her family. 

Her husband is a mason by profession. Naseem has three sons. She couldn’t educate them due to financial constraints. Her eldest son follows the same profession of his father. He supports his father in his business. The son next to him is a car mechanic while the youngest one works as a salesman for a low income. 

Naseem is also a very good mother and a housewife. She takes care of her family very well and does her household responsibilities. She has two years of experience in her business and she is hopeful that a loan investment will prove beneficial for her business' further growth. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. In her previous loan year, she established good credit behavior and never missed a meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with her hand raised is Naseem.

loans.use: To buy clothes for a clothes selling business

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is a married lady with two school-aged children.  She has been operating a green grocery for over 10 years.  She also does dairy farming for extra income.  She joined Faulu Kenya so that she could easily access financial resources.  With her previous loan from Faulu Kenya, she has improved her business. Hence, she improved her standard of living.  She hopes to expand her business in the future.  She has requested 50,000 Kes to buy two dairy cows.

loans.use: To buy two dairy cows

loans.name: Saren

texts.en:
Mr. Saren S. (pictured here) and his wife, Mrs. Chariyas El, live along National Road Six about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1999 and have two sons. 

Saren runs a business repairing and cleaning motorcycles from his shop in front of his house. His wife just finished her tailoring skills and she wants to operate her own business. Therefore, Saren is asking for a loan of 500 USD to purchase a sewing machine for his wife.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine for his wife

loans.name: Afila

texts.ru: Afila K. rodilas v 1956 qodu. Ona yavlyayetsya IDP personom i pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Ona zamujem i imeyet 3 detey. Afila uje 10 let kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom, ona razvodit korov. Seychas Afila nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi dlya razvitiya svoyeqo biznessa.
texts.en: Afila K. was born in 1956.  She is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  She is a refugee from Fuzuli city who now lives in the Fuzuli region with her family.  She is married with three children.  Afila has been working as a herdsman, raising cattle, for ten years.  Now Afila needs 2000 AZN to buy cows to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Kurusumu

texts.en: Kurusumu is a 37-year-old mother with five children. She comes from the district of Kyenjojo, Uganda. Kurusumu wants a loan to buy two hairdryers, cosmetics and hair extensions for the beauty salon that she has run for three years. She started her salon from the profit she got from selling a cow that she inherited from her grandmother. She dreams of setting up an animal farm and educating her children.

loans.use: to buy two hairdryers, cosmetics and hair extensions for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Raquel Barbarita

texts.es:
Raquel de 38 años, es una mujer trabajadora que empezó con un pequeña papelería que con el tiempo la estuvo surtiendo .

Ella labora sola de 8H00 am a 10H00 pm en su negocio vendiéndole a su clientes como cuadernos artículos y papelería. Con la ayuda del préstamo quiere comprar materiales para adecuar su vivienda como piedras, arena, cemento. Lo que mas anhela es poner su local y mejorar su vivienda y para tener una mejor vida con su familia.
texts.en:
Raquel is 38 years old and he is a hardworking woman who started with a small office supply store. With time she has increased the variety of products.

She works alone from 8am to 10pm on her business, selling to her clients items such as notebooks, office supplies, and paper products. With the help of this loan she will purchase materials to renovate her home, such as construction rocks, sand, and cement. Her greatest goal is to establish her store and to improve her house to have a better life with her family.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for her house, such as sand and cement.

loans.name: Nestor

texts.en:
Nestor is from the city of Guingona Ozamiz City. He is 49 years old and married with three adult children. To make a living, he offers transportation services. Nestor has been engaged in his business for over a year and earns approximately 15000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Nestor joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nestor is requesting a loan of 30000 PHP to purchase an additional motorcycle and to repair his existing vehicle for better service. This will be the first loan taken out by Nestor from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchased an additional motorcycle and to repair his current vehicle for better service

loans.name: Nemia

texts.en:
Nemia, 34, is a married woman with two kids. The oldest is 7 years old, while the youngest is only 2. Nemia is engaged in farming. She grows rice crops to sell. Nemia works hard to help provide for the needs in her household. She also wants to be able to support her oldest child's education.

Nemia requested a loan and plans to use it to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes for her business to prosper.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 35-year-old married woman from Lebanon. She lives with her husband and five young children who are still attending school. 

She has owned a toy shop since 2007. She sells wide range of toys such as dolls, model cars, etc. Her products are designed for both genders. She has obtained her first Kiva loan and has been a very good client with payments on time. 

Today, she is requesting a loan of $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to increase her store's inventory of new toys. In the future, she hopes to further expand her merchandise selection to be able to better satisfy her customer's demands.

loans.use: to increase her store’s inventory of new toys collection

loans.name: Isabel Catalina

texts.es: Isabel  nació en la ciudad de Cusco (Perú) y tiene 65 años de edad. Actualmente, Isabel vive en la misma ciudad donde nació. Isabel es cesante de la biblioteca de la municipalidad del Cusco. Isabel también se dedica a la venta de ropa. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Isabel requiere el préstamo para comprar mas mercaderia como por ejemplo pantalones y otras cosas mas. La socia es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal la “Chaska Ñawi” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en:
Isabel was born in the city of Cusco (Peru) and is 65 years old.  She currently lives in the city in which she was born.  Isabel used to work in a library in Cusco.  She also sells clothes.  Isabel has been in this business for several years and it is going very well thanks to the effort that she puts into her work.

On this occasion, Isabel needs a loan to buy more merchandise such as pants, etc.  She is a responsible and hard-working person and, because of these personal qualities, her friends invited her to join Asociación Arariwa's “Chaska Ñawi” community bank.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise such as pants, etc.

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Josie has a shop that sells several kinds of dried fish. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 6,000 to buy additional dried fish to sell.

Josie has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Josie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional dried fish to sell

loans.name: Caren

texts.en:
Caren is 34 years old, and she is married to Walter. They have one child, who is in kindergarten.

For the past 13 years, she has been running and operating a small cafeteria. She is applying for her fourth loan from KADET Ltd to enable her to buy chairs, sugar, salad, and flour that would expand her inventory. In the future, she hopes to be able to open up a big food stall.

loans.use: To increase her inventory by purchasing chairs, sugar, salad, and flour.

loans.name: Mwinyi

texts.en:
Mwinyi is a married man with three children. Two of his children attend school and one is still too young for school. He owns a house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past three years, he has operated a video library show business. His potential customers are neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. He dreams of becoming a main supplier of video tapes in the future.

With the KSHS 80,000, he wants to purchase a printer and a duplicator. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase a printer and a duplicator.

loans.name: Farman

texts.en: Farman lives in Agsu. He is 32 years old, married and has one son. He is a hardworking man who has been running his trading business for 10 years. Farman has a general store located behind his home. He wants to expand his business and improve his living conditions. Farman requested the loan from AqroInvest and Kiva to increase inventory with new products. This is his first loan and he hopes that this loan of 1,000 AZN will help him to make a good profit. Farman is very grateful for the support.

loans.use: to purchase new products to increase his inventory

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina tiene 52 años de edad, es comerciante, tiene dos hijas y 5 hijos, es casada, y reside en la Aldea de La Concepcion en el municipio de Juticalpa. 

Alejandrina tiene mas de 15 años de dedicarse a la elaboracion y venta de rosquillas y quesadillas. Ella aprendió de este oficio porque trabajó con una vecina que se dedicaba a lo mismo y tambien aprendió gracias a algunos cursos de panaderia que recibió en el Instituto Nacional de Formacion Profesional (INFOP). Su negocio esta instalado en su casa de habitacion y aun no tiene nombre, su horario laboral inicia a las 4:00 am y trabaja con sus dos hijas, ellas le ayudan a preparar la masa y luego estan pendiente de llevar el tiempo de que debe permanecer el producto en el horno. Luego de que sale el producto lo acomoda en una paila de plastico y sale a venderlo de casa en casa y de negocio en negocio. Ella considera que su mayor ventaja consiste en que sus productos tienen un sabor especial y que ademas es una persona amigable que simpatiza con otras personas y eso le ayuda a vender. Su sueño es tener un local en el Centro, aunque sea pequeño, para ya no andar vendiendo ambulantemente y asi llevar una vida mas tranquila ya que tiene Diabetes y aunque esta en tratamiento medico en cada vez que llega a su casa luego de haber terminado su jornada laboral diaria se siente resentida de salud. 

El prestamo que Alejandrina solicita lo necesita para comprar maiz, queso, azucar, manteca, entre otros productos, para la elaboracion de las rosquillas y quesadillas. Con el apoyo de este financiamiento ella podra obtener ganacias y cubrir sus gastos medicos y tambien ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de su hogar, ya que él se dedica a la agricultura y sus ingresos son pocos. Tambien desea hacerle una mejoras a su casa.

Alejandrina tiene varios años de recibir el apoyo de FAMA a traves del otorgamiento de prestamos que ha cancelado puntualmente y que le han ayudado a mantener su negocio activo y ha mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is 52 years old, and has a business.  She has two daughters and five sons, and is married.  She lives in La Aldea de La Concepcion, in the municipality of Juticalpa. 

Alejandrina has been making and selling doughnuts and quesadillas for more than 15 years.  She learned this trade because she worked with a neighbor making the same products, and also learned thanks to several bakery courses she took at the Instituto Nacional de Formacion Profesional (INFOP). 

Her business is located in her home, and still has no name. Her work schedule starts at 4:00 am, and she works with her two daughters.  They help her to prepare the dough, and then spend the time it takes for the products to be in the oven.  Once she takes the product out of the oven, she places it in a plastic container, and takes it to sell door-to-door to homes and businesses.  She thinks that her major advantage is that her products have a special flavor, and that additionally she is a friendly person who gets on well with other people and this helps her to make sales.

Her dream is to have premises in the town center, even if they are small, so that she no longer has to sell by foot and so can have an easier life, as she has diabetes and is still undergoing medical treatment.  Every time she returns to her home after finishing her daily work, she feels resentful of her health.

The loan that Alejandrina is requesting is needed by her to buy corn, cheese, sugar, butter and other ingredients to make doughnuts and quesadillas.  With the help of this loan, she will be able to generate earnings and cover her medical costs.  She will also help her husband with the financial upkeep of the household, as he works in agriculture and has little income.  She also would like to make improvements to her home.

Alejandrina has had several years receiving support through FAMA through the provision of loans, which she has punctually paid back and which have helped her to keep her active business going and to improve her home.

loans.use: to buy corn, cheese, sugar, butter, etc.

loans.name: Las Heroínas De Labranza Group

texts.es:
Éste Banco comunal se llama “Las Heroínas de Labranza”, lo conforman 17 emprendedoras que se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran picadura de leña, fruterías, verdulerías, venta de ropa, venta de miel, ensaladas preparadas, venta de huevos y confección de ropa. Todas ellas pertenecientes a la ciudad de Temuco. 
Carolina tesorera del grupo del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra al medio, vistiendo una chaqueta color blanco, un pañuelo color verde y que además usa su cabello tomado.
Se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 10 años, comenzó vendiendo ropa usada y desde hace 6 meses vende ropa nueva. Comenta que le ha ido excelente en sus ventas y que el número de clientes se ha incrementado con el tiempo.  Sus ventas se realizan puerta a puerta. Su mercadería la compra en el barrio Meiggs de la ciudad de Santiago. 
Con el crédito comprará ropa nueva.
Sus metas en su negocio son instalarse con un local establecido, para ofrecer y vender su mercadería. 
Carolina vive junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos de 11, 7 y 3 años de edad, ella se siente tranquila  y feliz, por lo que comenta no tener sueños pendientes que realizar. 
Carolina está muy contenta y agradecida de los servicios entregados por Fondo esperanza, también disfruta de los talleres que se imparten en las reuniones del Banco comunal. El grupo conformado es muy unido, solidario, ya que además se conocen desde hace dos años. 
Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile). En sus alrededores se ubican una serie de balnearios lacustres (Pucón, Villarrica) y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas, concentrada en parques naturales cercanos. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Las Heroínas de Labranza” and has 17 members who carry out a variety of different lines of work.  Among them are: firewood chopping, fruit stands, vegetable stands, clothing sales, honey sales, sale of prepared salads, egg sales and clothes making.  All of them are from the city of Temuco.

Carolina is the communal bank’s group Treasurer.  In the photo she’s in the center, wearing a white jacket and green scarf; in addition, her hair is gathered up.

She has been selling clothes for the last ten years.  She started out selling used clothes but has been selling new clothes for the last six months.  She comments that she’s done excellently well with sales and that the number of customers has increased over time.  She sells door to door and buys her merchandise in the city of Santiago’s Meiggs neighborhood.  She will use the loan to buy new clothes.  Her business goal is to set herself up in an established locale to display and sell her merchandise.

Carolina lives with her husband and three children who are 11, 7 and 3 years old.  She feels tranquil and happy and comments that she has no unfulfilled dreams.

Carolina is very happy and grateful for the services she’s gotten from Fondo Esperanza.  She also enjoys the workshops that take place during the communal bank meetings.  The group is very united, mutually supportive and the members have known each other for the last two years.

Temuco is the capital of the Araucanía region.  The city is located 670 kilometers south of Santiago (Capital of Chile).  There is a series of lakefront resorts in its surroundings (Pucón, Villarrica) and it has very eye-catching flora and fauna concentrated in nearby natural parks.  It’s worth pointing out that this region is home to 50% of the Mapuche, our country’s indigenous people.

loans.use: to buy new clothes.

loans.name: Abdullo

texts.ru: Абдулло житель города Куляб. Возраст, 39 лет. Женат. Имеет троих детей. Он занимается торговлей на рынке. В основном он занимается торговлей однотонных тканей и материалов. Этим видом деятельности Абдулло занимается десять лет. Кредит берет для закупа байковых и других видов материалов.
texts.en: Abdullo lives in the town of Kulob.  He is 39 years old, married and has three children.  He is involved in sales at the market.  He primarily sells single-tone fabrics and materials.  Abdullo has been involved in this business for ten years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of flannel and other types of materials.

loans.use: to buy flannel and other types of materials

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is married to Knight and they have seven children who are all in school.  They live in Kakamega.

David has a livestock business that he has been doing for over 20 years now. He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD to enable him buy more cattle to add to his stock.

He hopes to be the leading cattle trader in his town.

loans.use: to buy more cattle to add to his stock.

loans.name: Mandahtuya

texts.en: Mandahtuya is a 49-year-old widow who lives with her children in Hovd province of Mongolia. Her oldest son works in a mining company, while she earns a living by selling groceries. She started her business in 1989 by renting a counter in local market, and now runs a retail business in the same area. She is doing well and is very experienced in her field. She would like to begin selling goods that she gets from China and believes that she can do this because she is a strong and diligent woman whose children are now grown and independent. She is applying for a loan for 2,000,000 MNT to buy more products to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Fredrick Osore

texts.en: Fredrick is a 25-year-old single man. He describes himself to be a visionary. He operates a clothing sales business where he sells clothes to the local people. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in a shopping centre. He describes his biggest business challenges to be poor road networks, inflation, and seasonality. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to increase his stock of clothes. His business goal is to grow it into wholesale within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will grow the business and buy a van to facilitate the running of the business.

loans.use: To increase his stock of clothes

loans.name: Andresa

texts.en:
Andresa is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. Andresa has a shop that sells homemade ice candies and fruit salad candy bars. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy raw ingredients for making ice candy.
Andresa has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Andresa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making ice candy

loans.name: June Rose

texts.en:
June Rose is 38 years old and is a married woman with seven children. The oldest child is 20 years old.
June Rose has been raising hogs for three years. She plans to use her loan to purchase piglets, feed and vitamins. Each month, June Rose earns 10000 PHP in the hog raising business.
In the future, June Rose would like to expand her piggery and make improvements to their house.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, feed and vitamins

loans.name: Las 5 Rosas Group

texts.es:
La señora Silveria  vive en  un lugar muy bonito ella vive en unión libre con el señor José Luis y con quien procreo tres hijos que  aun están  a su responsabilidad.

 Ella solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra y venta de pollos de granja para luego venderlo destazado  por pedido de casa en casa , en donde lleva trabajando hace  tres meses  en la  que comenta que la ve bien ya que a logrado mejorar un poco mas sus ingresos para su hogar  y familia.

 Que la inspiro en esta actividad fue su  suegra quien  le propusieron este tipo de  actividad pero ella como se dedica  a la elaboración de panes y la venta de plásticos  no puede  envidar de casa en casa y mejor se lo dios a doña Silveria ya que ella tiñe hijos que la ayudan  a vender y ve que si le está dando resultado.
  Lo que más desea es que con esta pequeña actividad ella pueda seguir trabajando para  así  también trabajar en la elaboración  de panes y apoyar a sus hijos en su educación.

 Quienes integran en el grupo son la señora: Angelina  quien se dedica a  la venta de plásticos y la elaboración de panes, así también se integra  Everfein quien se dedica a la compra  y venta de ganados (becerros).
texts.en:
Silveria lives in a beautiful locale with her husband Jose Luis and their three dependent children.

She asks for a loan to buy chickens that she will later sell in parts, going door to door. She has been doing this for 3 months and says that it's going well and that her household income has increased a little bit.

She started the business after her mother-in-law proposed it; she already has a business making bread and selling plastic goods, so she couldn't go from house to house. She gave the chickens to Silveria because she had children who could help her with the sales, and they are getting good results.

What she wants most is to continue in this business and also making bread so that she can support her children in their education. 

The other members of the group are: Angelina, who sells plastics and makes bread; and Everfein who buys and cells calves.

loans.use: to buy chickens and sell them in pieces.

loans.name: Flavia

texts.en:
Flavia is a thirty-five-year-old, married lady with five children living in Kasese, Uganda.  Her personal goals are to educate her children, build a permanent home and buy a car.  

She has been a farmer for fifteen years and also runs a retail shop.  She has started by using joint savings with her husband and bought four acre plot of land.  Her major hardships are price fluctuation and inflation, theft and seasonal weather.  Her business goals are diversifying her farm, hiring employees to help expand her farm and buying land to grow crops.  The purpose of the loan is to buy banana suckers for planting.

loans.use: to buy banana suckers for planting.

loans.name: Adnan

texts.en:
Adnan has been baking flatbread for 12 years, stretching out the dough on a special pillow used for throwing the thin bread on the inside wall of the hot, cave-like stone oven. The simple, delicious bread is purchased by families every day, carrying away piles of 10-12 freshly baked goods.

Adnan has been supporting his family, his wife and one child, from this business, but the bakery was recently destroyed and burned down.
 
To be able to quickly return to his business, Adnan took a loan from Relief International-Iraq in the amount of $3,000 USD to help him renovate the flourishing bakery.

loans.use: to pay for the repair of his bakery

loans.name: Rhodesia

texts.en:
Rhodesia 40 years old. She is married and has four children ranging from fifteen to twenty four. She describes herself as social and friendly woman. 

She has been selling goats for the last five years. Her primary customers are butcher shops and passers-by. Her business challenge is inadequate funds to improve her business. 

She will be using the KES 15,000 loan to buy more goats. In the next five years, Rhodesia hopes to run a butcher shop.

loans.use: To buy more goats.

loans.name: James Ngesa

texts.en:
James was born in Kaya village, Siaya County. He is married with children and is engaged in retail small scale business. James wants to make a difference in his community and town of Siaya by engaging community health outreach programme run by a Community Based Organization CBO in the district.  

He has also committed to spend most of his free time with the CHW counseling the youth on avoiding anti social practices, drug abuse and AIDs/HIV prevention. James is happy to own his own motorcycle and is ready to give back to the community the free tranport services to CHW.

James will also use the income generated from his motorcycle business to support his family he plans to buy another motorcycle and support more CHWs in future

loans.use: To Pay for Motorcycle for Community Health Work and Livelihoods

loans.name: Oumè Agnès

texts.fr: Oumè Agnès âgée de 34 ans, est mariée à un coiffeur du nom de Pierre. Oumè Agnès n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et  à leur charge. Oumè Agnès vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la maison sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Oumè Agnès vend depuis dix ans, des bijoux et des chaussures.
