Cette activité lui génère des revenus l'aidant à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Oumè Agnès achète ses produits dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Oumè Agnès sollicite pour une quatrième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des bijoux et des chaussures.

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es:
En Junín se elabora el más puro aguardiente de caña, famoso por el alto contenido de alcohol y por ser una bebida "sólo para hombres" como se la conoce. En la gastronomía se destaca el tradicional hornado de cabeza de chancho, plato muy apetecido por propios y visitantes.
En este lugar vive señor Juan Pablo,  tiene 28  años de edad, es soltero y no tiene hijos. Vive con su padre.
Juan Pablo es quien se ha hecho cargo de su padre y quien se encarga de la dura tarea del hogar, él todos los días se levanta temprano,  hace el desayuno para los dos, luego sale al campo ya que es comerciante de frutas de temporada como naranjas, mandarinas, papayas, cocos y plátanos. Trabaja dos veces en la semana de 05h00 hasta las 14h00, él se desplaza desde la madrugada hasta las fincas a comprar directamente para luego llevarlos al mercado mayorista. A pesar de que el trabajo es sacrificado tiene que hacerlo por el bienestar de su familia. También es chofer de taxi en el sector aprovechando que su tía le alquila el carro por día y así tiene más ingresos.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar  frutas y verduras, (naranjas, mandarinas, bananos, entre otras frutas del sector). Este es su tercer crédito y está agradecido a la fundación, le gustan los créditos porque son fáciles de acceder y con intereses bajos.
 Su sueño es tener una finca muy grande con muchos árboles frutales y seguir adelante en su negocio, también mejorar su vivienda.

loans.use: comprar  frutas y verduras.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Margaret would like to purchase an upgraded dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Dorah would like to buy a high breed dairy cow

loans.name: Komla

texts.fr:
Born in 1981, Mr D. Komla is a woodworker by trade. He practices his craft with courage and manages to support his two brothers, who he is responsible for. Young, dynamic and efficient in the execution of his craft, he has managed his two first loans, which he has paid back without incident. To better equip his workshop and maintain his clientel, he is asking for a loan of $750, which will allow him to buy wooden planks and cranes that will in turn allow him to increase his sales and better provide for his family.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Né en 1981, Monsieur D. Komla est menuisier de profession. Il exerce ce métier avec courage et arrive à assurer les besoins de ses deux frères qui sont à sa charge. Jeune dynamique et efficace dans l’exécution de son métier, il a su gérer les deux premiers crédits qu’il a remboursé sans incidence. Pour mieux équiper son atelier et maintenir sa clientèle, il sollicite un crédit de $750 qui servira à acheter les planches et les grues qui lui permettront d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaires afin de mieux s’occuper de sa famille.

loans.use: Buy wooden planks and other materials

loans.name: Mawuli Ferdinand

texts.fr:
Mawuli Ferdinand D. was born on May 28, 1965 in Aného. He is married and has six dependents, including three children from his deceased brother. A merchant by profession, he has a few fueling depots in the prefecture. Facing an ever-growing demand, he would like to increase the number of these retail outlets in order to meet his customer expectations. This is why he is requesting a loan of $1200, which will allow him to attain a higher profit margin and to improve living conditions for his family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur D. Mawuli Ferdinand est né le 28 mai 1965 à Aného. Il est marié et a à sa charge six (6) enfants dont trois enfants de son frère décédé. Commerçant de profession, il dispose de quelques dépôts de carburant dans la préfecture. Face à une demande de plus en plus croissante il désire multiplier ses points de vente pour satisfaire ses clients. C’est pour cela qu’il sollicite ce crédit de $1200 qui lui permettra d’atteindre une marge bénéficiaire plus élevée et d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Developing more outlets for selling fuel for vehicles

loans.name: Rafiga

texts.en: Rafiga and her husband have been running a chicken farming business for three years.  She is 43 years old and lives in Khachmaz town and has one child.  They raise chicken and then sell them. They are requesting a loan of $825 to buy chickens for their business.

loans.use: To buy chicken for their poultry farming business

loans.name: Ngo Thi

texts.vi:
Ms Ngô Thị C., 54 years old, lives in Trung Giã village. She is a member of branch 2 in Sóc Sơn since 1995. Her first loan was only 30 USD. In later rounds she was able to secure bigger loans which was invested in a farm supplies business. The revenue from this business is about 150 USD a month. Since she is single, she does not invest her money in a house nor spend it on expensive things. She saves all her money for her retirement. This time she requests a loan of 1200 USD to stock up her farm supplies.

Translaled from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Ngô Thị C., 54 tuổi, sống tại xã Trung Giã là thành viên của chi nhánh 2 Sóc Sơn từ năm 1995. Bắt đầu với mức vốn đầu tiên là 30USD đến các vòng vốn sau chị đều vay mức vốn tối đa để sử dụng vào mục đích buôn bán các mặt hàng nông sản như lạc, vừng, đỗ… Công việc kinh doanh này mang lại cho chị mức thu nhập là: 150USD/tháng. Là một phụ nữ độc thân nên chị không đầu tư vào kiến thiết nhà cửa, mua các vật dụng có giá trị trong gia đình mà chị chỉ tích luỹ tiền để tiết kiệm cho tuổi già. Ở vòng vốn này chị xin vay 1200USD để kinh doanh hàng nông sản.

loans.use: Buy agricultural product

loans.name: Otila

texts.en: Otila is a young married mother of twenty five years of age residing at Lotofaga village. She is a strong woman that happily provides support to her husband for their plantation. She was employed by one of the company's in town but she resigned because she earns more money from selling taro. She sells 3-4 bags of taro to the market and she makes $200.00-$300.00 WST ($80-120 USD) each trip.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her plantation

loans.name: Keyla

texts.es:
Señora Keila is a member of the communal bank called 'New Eden' located in the district of Yarina Cocha in Ucayali. She's 28 years old and a mother of 2 young children. She's married and her husband sells all types of wood. With the first loan she obtained from Manuela Ramos, she decided to open up her own business by buying and selling wood planks.

She currently sells different types of forest wood planks. Some of the types of wood she buys to sell are: shihuahuaco, quinilla, quillobordon, capirona, etc. She gets up about 5 in the morning to go to the Port of Manatay, where all the wood sellers get together, and she buys the type of wood she likes to later cut it in planks and then sell it.

With this loan, wich she will repay within 5 months, she will buy different types of wood, pay for the cutting services and pay for the transportation, etc.

Keyla feels good because she doesn't depend on anybody and thanks to Manuela Ramos she was able to start her own business which is very streneous but she loves it anyways!

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Keila pertenece al banco comunal Nuevo Edén, ubicado en el AA. HH. Nuevo Edén Mz. D Lt. 1, distrito de Yarina Cocha, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 28 años, es madre de 2 hijos menores de edad que aún depende de ella, es casada y su esposo se dedica a la venta de madera. Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300 que recibió de Manuela Ramos decide invertir en la compra y venta de madera en tablones. En la actualidad cuenta con tablones de diversas especies forestales para la venta. Entre las especies que compra para luego venderlas son: shihuahuaco, quinilla, quillobordon, capirona, etc. Normalmente se levanta a las 5.00 a.m. para ir al puerto de manantay a buscar vendedores de madera de las especies con las que trabaja para luego mandarlas cortar en tablones y así poder venderlas. Con el préstamo de S/. 2,000, el cual pagará en 5 meses, invertirá en la compra de madera de diversas especies, en el pago por el servicio de corte para transformar su materia prima en tablones, en el pagó por el transporte de la madera, etc. Keyla se siente muy bien porque no depende económicamente de nadie y gracias a Manuela Ramos pudo emprender su propio negocio, el cual reconoce que es muy pesado pero que no deja de esmerarse a diario y con ello la hace sentir muy contenta.

loans.use: To purchase different types of wood

loans.name: Murod

texts.ru:
Murod H. lives in Rudaki. He is married with four children. Murod is 36 years old and has a secondary education. He makes a living buying and selling cattle. He buys cattle from his neighbors in his village and sells them at a regional market. This business gives him a source to make money since he can sell cattle at a higher price at the market, while his neighbors are saving money on their transportation expenses. Murod is applying for a loan because he wants to increase his turnover. He is planning to repay his loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Jamilya & Keith Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

Хабибов Мурод житель района Рудаки.Женат имеет 4 детей. Возраст 36 лет. Образование среднее.Зарабатывает на жизнь путем куплепродажи крупно рогатого скота.Скупает животных у соседей в своем кишлаке . а потом продает на рынке в районе.Этот бизнес дает возможность населению сэкономить деньги соседям ,т.к. они не тратят деньги на дорогу до рынка . чтобы продать бычка или корову,а так же клиенту покупая бычка у соседей он может продать товар подороже на рынке. Это даст возможность неплохо заработать. Хочет получить кредит , чтобы увеличить оборотную сумму.Погасить кредит планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase a bull

loans.name: Victoria Guadalupe

texts.es:
Victoria is a young woman who has enjoyed sales since she was a girl. She has met many people through her business, traveling to the interior of the state and visiting other churches to practice her religion. This is how she started her small business selling religious goods she brought to each place. Now she is a distributor and her business has improved, since she supplies other retailers in the interior of the Yucatan. As a result, she needs a place to display her products and to sell to the general public. Since she does not have sufficient capital to rent a place, her mother is supporting her by allowing her to set up a presence in her own home but she needs to make adaptations to the front of the house for this purpose.

She needs a loan of US $950 over the course of 6 months in order to realize her dream of having a place where she can sell her products to the general public. Through this business she will be able to help her mother with the common household expenses. With your contribution, Vicky will be able to realize her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Katrina H, Kiva volunteer.

Victoria, es una mujer joven que desde niña le ha gustado las ventas, y ha logrado conocer mucha gente a través de ellas, desde la religión que profesa viaja al interior del estado y visita otras iglesias, fue así como inicio hace 2 años su pequeño negocio vendiendo material religioso llevando a cada lugar sus productos. Ahora ha es distribuidora y sus ventas han mejorado, ya que surte hacia el interior de Yucatán a otros vendedores, por esto requiere de un local amplio para exhibir su material y que sea para venta al publico en general, como no cuenta con el capital suficiente para rentar uno, su madre la esta apoyando permitiéndole instalarse en su propia casa para ello necesita realizar adecuaciones al frente de la misma.

Ella necesita un crédito de US $950 que pagara en 6 meses para ver logrado su sueño de tener un local donde vender sus productos al público en general y así poder ayudar a su mama con los gastos familiares. Con tus contribuciones Vicky podrá realizar sus metas.

loans.use:
Remodel premises

remodelar local

loans.name: Mardon

texts.ru:
Mardon O. and his family live in the city of Yavan. Mardon is married and has 6 children. He has a plot of land on which he raises cattle. He purchases young animals, raises them for a bout 1 month, and then resells them. Mardon would like to increase turnover of the business in order to increase his family's income. The loan will also help further advance the development of businesses in the area. Mardon plans to repay the loan within a 15 months period.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Одинаев Мардон житель города Яван. Живет со своей семьей. Он женат и имеет 6 детей. Имеет дехканское хозяйство. Кроме того занимается животноводством. Скупает мелко-рогатый скот. После откормки , которая длится около 1 месяца продает. Опыт работы в данной сфере уже 30 лет. Сейчас Мардон хочет увеличить товарооборот , который поможет увеличить доходы его семьи. Кроме того развитие его бизнеса в частности сможет помочь развитию всего сектора. Для этого Мардон планируент получить кредит, который сможет погасить в течении 15 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase cattle

loans.name: Afaiva

texts.en: Afaiva S., 33, is married with 5 children.  She has 2 year(s) of experience in the vegetable business.She will use part of her loan to buy equipment to improve her business.   She sells to the villagers/public 1 days per week. She has 1 previous loan(s) with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~125 USD).  SPBD loans are Afaiva’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase tomatoes, cucumbers, pumpkin and round cabbages seeds

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Doña Maria Isabel has its small business of selling spare parts and lubricants for cars. She is responsible for managing and attending to her business. She is 36 years old and a mother of three children. She is eager to expand and equip her work space in order to improve the economica situation of her beloved family. For this reason, she is requesting a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Maria Isabel, tiene su pequeño negocio de venta de repuestos y lubricantes para autos, ella es la encargada de administrar y atender su negocio. Tiene 36 años de edad y es madre de tres hijos. Tiene muchos deseos de ampliar e implementar su espacio de labor para obtener mayores beneficios económicos para su amada familia y a esa razón atiende su petición de un préstamo.

loans.use: To expand and equip her daily work space.

loans.name: Pierrette

texts.fr:
Born on January 19, 1954 in AGOHOE BALIME, in the neighboring country of Bénin, Ms. Pierrette became settled in Lomé in 1995 and married Mr. ADOKOU, who is a retiree. Her work is in selling basic provisions in the Adidogomé district in Lomé. She is requesting this initial loan to buy 50 yam tubers, 4 sacks of corn, and 1 sack of charcoal.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Née le 19 janvier 1953 à AGOHOE BALIME dans le pays voisin au Bénin?, dame Pierrette s’est installée à Lomé depuis 1995 et s’est mariée à monsieur ADOKOU qui est un retraité. Elle a pour a pour activité la vente des produits de premières nécessités dans le quartier d’Adidogomé à Lomé. Elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter 50 tubercules d’ignames, 4 sacs de maïs et 1 sacs de charbon.

loans.use: To buy tubers, grains, and charcoal

loans.name: Coura

texts.fr:
Mrs. Coura G. has been a restaurant owner for about ten years. She has a good reputation thanks to the quality of her meals.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

Mme coura G. est restauratrice depuis une dizaine d'annee. Elle a une bonne reputation grace a la qualite de ses repas.

loans.use: Catering

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es: Las aspiraciones de Silvia, desde que formó su familia, fueron de brindarles amor, bienestar y tranquilidad a sus 2 hijos, esta joven madre, desde hace 6 años está dedicada a la comercialización de golosinas en forma ambulatoria, al ver que sus ganancias y los  ingresos que su esposo obtenía con su trabajo  de mototaxista  no cubrían todos los gastos familiares, decidió buscar la manera de generar ingresos  extras, por ello, actualmente  se  dedica  a la venta de productos cosméticos y utensilios de cocina, con estas actividades y el esfuerzo de su esposo, están supliendo las necesidades de su hogar.Pero, para seguir creciendo y poder ofrecerles a sus hijos una mejor educación, solicita este préstamo, para incrementar sus productos y así aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Silvia's aspirations, since she began her family, were to bring love, well-being and tranquility to her two children. She is a young mother. For six years, she has been engaged in travelling snack sales. Upon seeing that her earnings and her husband's income as a taxi driver were not covering all of their regular expenses, she decided to seek a means of earning extra income. In this way, she began selling cosmetic products and kitchen utensils. With these activities and her husband's efforts, they are meeting their household needs. However, she is requesting a loan to keep growing her business and to be able to offer a better education to her children. The loan will be used to increase her product inventory and thereby increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase product inventory.

loans.name: Rahimjon

texts.en:
T. Rahimjon applied for his first loan from MicroInvest in 2008. His business stability helped him to repay the previous loan on time and to take the next loan step. 

Mr. T. Rahimjon lives in the Spitamen region and he is the loving father of 4 children. Mr. T. Rahimjon is the toastmaster for many wedding parties and receptions. He is very educated and is an interesting guest at the parties. He knows many good toasts and jokes. People enjoys his company. 

Mr. T. Rahimjon is applying to KIVA for a business development loan of 4000 TJS ($1200 USD) for 5 months to open a specialized toastmaster's office and to provide toastmaster services. In addition to this business, he raises livestock to supplement the family income. Mr. T. Rahimjon thanks KIVA for its support.

loans.use: To open a specialized toastmaster's office

loans.name: Nazirjon

texts.en: Nazirjon A.  is 50 years old, married and the loving father of 5 children. For 10 years, Nazirjon has been raising cattle and growing wheat on his land. He is requesting a loan to purchase mineral fertilizer as well as fuels and lubricants used  to process the  land. He and his daughter (pictured) also care for cows, sheep and goats and part of the loan would be spent remaking a cattle-shed. Nazirjon is asking for a loan of 1000 Somoni ($300 USD) for the term of 12 months. He deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving him.

loans.use: Purchase of fuels and lubricants and also for remaking a cattle-shed.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane M. is a Tanzania small business woman. She runs a kiosk at Vituka Dar es Salaam just a few kilometers from Kariakoo city business center. She sells varieties of items including soft drinks. She manages to meet her family's daily demands from the business income.

Jane requests a loan of TZS 600,000 (USD$500) to increase her stocks to meet the customers' demand.

loans.use: To expand her kiosk inventory.

loans.name: Israel Alejandro

texts.es:
Israel  tiene una pensión donde vende por las noches cenas y refrescos, trabaja de lunes a domingo con su madre y por el día como guardia de seguridad
Vive en la zona de Obrajes de la ciudad de La Paz es soltero y su negocio le permite solventar las gastos de su mare.
El crédito será destinado para la compra de insumos ( arroz, fideo, papa, verduras, aceite y otros).
Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su historial lo califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su crédito.
texts.en:
Israel has a cafe where in the evenings he sells dinner and refreshments. He works with his mother from Monday through Sunday and is a security guard during the day. He lives in the Obrajes zone of the city of La Paz. He is single and his business allows him to cover his and his mother's expenses. The loan will be used in the purchase of supplies ( rice, noodles, potatoes, vegetables, oil and others). This is the second time that he request a loan from Impro. His credit record classifies him as a #1 client, meaning that he has a good repayment history.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for the buisness.

loans.name: Katende Nulu‘S Group

texts.en:
Nulu is the leader of a four member group. She is 30 years old and married with four children. All her children, who are between the ages 4 and 12, go to school. She also takes care of her old parents. She resides in a rented two-roomed house in which eight people stay. They don’t have electricity or piped water at home. The family gets two meals a day.

Nulu works in a semi-urban area on the outskirts of Kampala. She sells charcoal at her home in Mengo Mackay, which is one of the city suburbs. She works seven days a week and has no transport costs. She sells to an average of 30 customers a day and to all categories of people. She is faced with the challenge of the rainy season and defaulting on her would-be customers.

Nulu has been in this business for the last seven years and has been in MCDT for four years. She is servicing her second loan, working all along with the same groupmates. Nulu‘s monthly expenses include rent and feeding the family. She wants to use this loan to buy a more sacks of charcoal.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Tuyatsetseg

texts.en:
Tuyatsetseg G. is a 33-year-old woman who lives with her husband and son in a "ger" in Mongolia (a ger is the traditional, nomadic form of housing in Mongolia; a ger district is where many people have settled in these homes, forming a sort of ad hoc suburb).

The family owns the land where their ger is located. Her son is 13; he goes to elementary school. She, Tuyatsetseg, runs a clothing stall with her husband at Narantuul, Mongolia's biggest outdoor market, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city. During the fall, winter, and spring they sell gloves. In summer, they sell sunglasses. They own, rather than rent, their stall. They would like a loan to buy another stall in the clothing section of the Narantuul market. Together with her husband, Tuyatsetseg is planning to renovate her house this coming spring. She has a hard-working and humble personality.

loans.use: To buy gloves to increase business inventory

loans.name: Soeng

texts.en:
Soeng P. is 38 years old and the mother of four children who are teenagers and attend school. She currently makes a daily income by growing various kinds of vegetables on her own farmland in the village. As another revenue source, she sells porridge in front of her house for the neighbors.

She is married to Sokhon, 35, who is a local building worker. He sometimes helps his wife selling porridge. Since Soeng P.'s business growing vegetables is the main source of income for the family, she would like to seek a loan in order to purchase a cow and more seeds for her business operation.

Soeng P. lives in the Pursat Province in Cambodia.

loans.use: To purchase a cow and more seeds

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Yanahuapa Group

texts.en:
The Santa Rosa de Yanahuapa Village Bank is a newly formed group, and is just beginning its first loan cycle with Asociacion Arariwa. The group members are all neighbors from Yanahuapa, a small town about fifteen minutes outside of the city of Urubamba, in the Sacred Valley. Though this is Santa Rosa de Yanahuapa's first loan from Arariwa, many of the group members have previously participated in group loans, either through Arariwa or through other local financial institutions. 

At the group's inauguration on March 26th, there was a warm, friendly atmosphere. After singing Peru's national anthem, the group members ate a celebratory inaugural meal of chicken, baked potatoes, corn and cheese in a spicy cilantro sauce, joking and laughing together all the while. The group's loan officer, Alfredo López, told the group that the seed capital they are receiving now may seem like very little, but soon their investments will bear fruit, and that single seed will produce 200, 500, or even 1000 seeds. 

The group members are involved in a variety of businesses: they work as artisans, raising livestock or small animals like guinea pigs, growing grains, vegetables and flowers, as grocery store owners, and making and selling chicha, a traditional Andean alcoholic drink made from fermented corn. 

The group's president, Juan Gualberto A. G., teaches at the local school and also buys and sells cattle as an extra source of income. He currently has three Brown Swiss cows, and is feeding them so that he can sell them for a higher price. He plans to use his loan to buy seed to plant more grass for his cattle. This is Gualberto's first group loan, and he hopes to lead the group well in order to help its members get ahead in life and expand their businesses. "This organization depends on all of us working well," he told the group. He reminded them that everyone must attend all of the group's meetings, make payments on time, be punctual and responsible, and show solidarity with the other group members. 

The Santa Rosa de Yanahuapa group has agreed to work according to these principles and to repay their Kiva loan in full and on time. 

Note: Three people in the photo are not group members. The group's loan officer, Alfredo, is pictured sitting on the floor in front of the group. Emperatriz, one of Arariwa's Village Bank Supervisors, is pictured on the far left of the front row. The wife of the group's Secretary is pictured in the back row, third from right.

loans.use: Various, including seed to grow grass for cattle

loans.name: Myra

texts.en:
Myra owns and manages a small sari-sari store (community based store) in their village. She has operated the business for almost seven years. However, due to lack of capital, her store did not improve.

She is now hoping to borrow from the lenders an amount of PHP 10,000 for the growth of her business and hopefully be able to save some of her income for the education of her children. She aims to become successful in her business someday and prays that God will continue to bless them despite their difficulties in life.

Myra is 28 years old and married to Alfredo, a farmer. They have three children: Aliyah - 6 years old; Kristine Joy - 4 years old and the youngest, Katherine - 2 years old.

loans.use: To expand her sari-sari store

loans.name: Kwamina

texts.en: Kwamina A.. married with two children, received an education through Primary School. Since 2006, he has worked as a driver and trader selling second hand shoes at Elmina market, using his income to pay for his children’s school fees and his family’s bills. His wife also works as a trader.  Kwamina is requesting a loan to purchase more shoes to sell, and with the new profits from his expanded business he plans to save for and further his children's education.

loans.use: Kwamina will use the loan to purchase more shoes for selling.

loans.name: Agnès

texts.fr:
D. Agnès est originaire du Département de l'Ouémé dans la Commune d'Adjarra au Sud du Bénin. Agnès est mariée à OWOLABI François mécanicien de profession. Agnès est mère de quatre enfants: deux de ces enfants sont scolarisés; les deux autres n’ont pas encore l’âge d’être scolarisés. Agnès collecte des bouteilles vides auprès des ménages et les revend aux artisans et coopératives pour d’autres usages. Agnès a eu déjà deux crédits à ALIDé pour renforcer son fonds de roulement, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursé. Mais toujours est-il que Agnès n’arrive pas encore à satisfaire toutes les commandes qu’elle reçoit par manque de moyens financiers. Alors Agnès sollicite un troisième crédit de ALIDé pour y arriver. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
D. Agnès comes from the Ouémé Department from the township of Adjarra in the south of Bénin. Agnès is married to Owolabi François, who is a trained mechanic. Agnès is the mother of 4 children; two of them are enrolled in school and the other two are not yet old enough to go to school.

Agnès collects empty bottles from households and re-sells them to artisans and cooperatives for other uses. She has already had 2 loans from ALIDé to bolster her working capital, and she reimbursed them in a timely manner. However, Agnès still doesn't manage to fill all the orders she receives because she lacks financial means. For this reason, she is requesting a third loan from ALIDé. The signification of ALIDé in the local language of Benin, Fon, is "a pathway always exists for the poorest of the poor". Benin is a little country in West Africa next to Nigeria, and its annual per capita income stands at US$1,500.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of empty bottles and cans

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 41 years old and is married to Emiliano S.. They live in Purok (District) 2 of Barangay San Manuel in Naguilian, Isabela.

They are blessed with seven children: their eldest, Michael, is 23 years old and studying for a degree in accounting; second is Ferdinand, who is a 22-year-old college student taking an electrical engineering track; third is Emiliano S. Jr., who is a 21-year-old high school graduate and is presently working abroad; fourth is Jomel, who is 20 years old, and has stopped studying due to financial difficulties experience by his family but will pursue his studies this year according to Jocelyn; fifth is Cathleen, who is a 15-year-old secondary student; sixth is Mica Venus, who is 5 years old and a daycare pupil; and the youngest is Michael James who is 2 years old. 

Jocelyn sells RTW (ready-to-wear) clothing products, which she purchases from Divisoria in Manila. She sells pants, blouses, T-shirts for men and women and kids clothing as well.

Jocelyn is requesting a loan of PHP 6,000 to be able to sustain her business and save for the education of her children. She has been in business for three years and she hopes now to expand it. Another dream of her is to improve their home, which is just made from bamboo. She also wants her children to finish their studies thus she is doing her best to work and become productive in her business. She also shared that “if you do your best, God will do the rest”.

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: Makhsud

texts.en:
A. Makhsud, aged 36, is married with 4 children. He earns his living through farming, specifically planting potatoes, carrots, and onions. Makhsud seeks room for expanding the business and creating an opportunity for his market, especially during the times he is waiting to harvest. He needs an alternative that can help him save for his children's higher education. Makhsud requests a loan of 2000 Somoni that he will spend for purchasing seeds and fertilizer for his crop.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Bola

texts.en: Bola has a business center where she provides computer services. Bola hopes for a loan of N140, 000 to purchase a computer and a printer. She says "thanks" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a computer and a printer

loans.name: Heyling Carolina

texts.es: La joven Heyling Carolina López, tiene la edad de 24 años, habita en el barrio San Ignacio, junto a su esposa la cual trabaja y le apoya con las actividades del hogar , ella tiene un hijo de cinco años de edad , actualmente estudia su preescolar , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , desde hace 5 años , la joven Heyling trabaja como agricultora , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta son las plagas , ella inicio esta actividad con apoyo de su padres , los planes hacia su cultivo es poder diversificarlo . Con el préstamo va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos, para mejorar la producción y poder vender a buen precio en el mercado.
texts.en:
Heyling Carolina López is 24 years old and lives in the San Ignacio neighborhood with her spouse, who works and helps her with the household activities. She has a 5 years old son, who is currently in pre-school. She plans to improve her family living conditions.

Heyling has been working as a farmer for 5 years. The biggest challenge she faces is the pests. She started this activity with the support of her parents and she plans to diversify her crops.

With the loan she will buy fertilizers and supplies in order to improve her production and sell it at better prices in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Giovanna Fernandes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies and fertilizers to improve crops

loans.name: Caritas

texts.en:
Greetings from Kigali-Rwanda,

Caritas M. is a widow of 41 years old, has 5 children and she has been in business of shopping for the past 5 years.

Caritas is requesting her third loan of 500,000 RWF from Vision Finance Company. With her two previous loans,she was able to expand her business through purchasing beers for sales and she is proud of that. Now with this loan, she hopes to create 4 jobs and with the more profits she will getting, she plans to help her husband to have a strong family.

Through accessing this loan, Caritas has hope for the future of her family.

loans.use: more products

loans.name: Tinuke

texts.en: Tinuke is 42, married and has 4 chidlren. She has been selling sraongs for some time now. She hopes a loan of N60, 000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thanks to all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase sarongs to sell

loans.name: Armando

texts.en:
Mr. Armando C. is a 36-year-old married man. He is from Candida, Bi-ao, Binalbagan, Negros Occidental. He and his wife started a small sari-sari (general) store with capital of PHP 3,000 from his first loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Now after a year, the couple has ventured into the food business by putting up a cafeteria inside the public market. The cafeteria is managed by his wife while Mr. Armado C. drives a passenger tricycle (motorcycle with a side car) which he uses to shuttle passengers around the town, very much like a taxi. Armando is borrowing PHP 20,000 for his 10th loan cycle to buy spare parts for the repair and maintenance of his tricycle, so that he can continue earning a good income from his transport venture.

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: For repair and maintenance of his motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: acheter des marchandises pour sa boutique

loans.name: Mèhou Florence

texts.fr: H. Mèhou Florence est née le 16/03/1980 à Cotonou, Capitale économique du Bénin. Florence est mariée à DOSSOU Rogatien, un commerçant. Florence et Rogatien ont trois enfants tous scolarisés et encore à leur charge. La famille vit à Cocotomey, non loin de Cotonou. Florence et Rogatien assurent ensemble les charges de la famille. Florence a fait seulement le cours primaire. C'est plutôt la coiffure que Florence a fini par apprendre. Florence à son salon de coiffure à Godomey toujours non loin de Cotonou. En plus de la coiffure que Florence fait, elle vend également des produits de cheveux et de beauté. C'est à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin que Florence s'approvisionne en ces différents produits. Florence veut pouvoir mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, c'est pourquoi Florence sollicite un prêt de ALIDé pour renforcer son fonds de roulement.
texts.en:
H. Mèhou Florence was born on March 16, 1980 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is married to DOSSOU Rogatien, a merchant. She and Rogatien have three children who are all in school and still in their care. The family lives in Cocotomey, not far from Cotonou. Florence and Rogatien jointly ensure that family expenses are covered. Florence has attended only primary school. She sooner ended up learning about hairdressing. She has a hair salon in Godomey, which is also not far from Cotonou. In addition to working at hairdressing, she also sells hair products and beauty products. Dantokpa, the grand international marketplace of Benin, is where she stocks up on these different products. Florence wants to be able to respond better to the demands of her customers. This is why she’s requesting an ALIDé loan for bolstering her working capital.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a dozen boxes of beautyproducts and ten dozen hair extensions

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Mr. Touch S. is 36 years old and a resident of Kompong Tom Province, where he earns a living raising ducks and pigs in a cage behind his house. He raises ducks for their eggs and sells the eggs to people who come to buy in bulk at his house. He is married with three children, one of whom is married and starting a family; the other two attend school. His wife stays at home and works with him in the business.

Touch S. has applied for an $800 loan from Kiva’s partner HKL in order to purchase additional feed and ducklings to raise.

loans.use: To purchase additional feed and ducklings to raise

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John O. is 40 years old and married with 4 children.

He sells bags of maize at wholesale prices to earn a living. He has a stall where he sells daily from 7 AM to 7 PM. He sells for long hours to enable him meet the basic needs of his family. He has been in this business for a long time.

John hopes to purchase a van in the future to enable him distribute his bags of maize.

John is requesting a loan amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more bags of maize to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of maize to sell.

loans.name: Nely

texts.es:
La señora Nely es socia del Banco Comunal “3 de Mayo” desde hace 16 meses, del distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno.
Tiene 27 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos. Ella estudiò hasta primaria completa; se dedica a llamadas múltiples de celulares.

Nely nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar su capital.

Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 700.00 con el cual podrá comprar más mercadería(celulares).

Su sueño para el futuro es tener su casa en Ilave.

Lo que mas le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los ahorros.
texts.en:
Señora Nely has been a member of the communal bank "3 de Mayo" for 16 months. It is located in the Llave district in El Collao province in the Puno region. She is 27 years old, married, and has 3 children. She completed her primary studies; she has a cellular telephone call center where she sells phone calls. Nely tells us that with the first loan she obtained through the Manuela Ramos organization of 500 nuevos soles, she was able to increase her capital. She now requests a loan of 700 nuevos soles which will be used to buy more merchandise (cellular phones.) Her dream is to have her own house in Llave. She enjoys accumulating savings in her communal bank.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy cellular phone equipment

loans.name: Mana Group

texts.es:
Ude  Mana el nombre del grupo surge por que la mayoría de las integrantes que creen que dios proveerá  más a los necesitados de la misma manera que dio el pan de vida. Ellos se reúnen  quincenalmente para realizar sus pagos.  Este grupo está ubicado en la colonia infonavit ferrocarrilero de la ciudad de  Tierra Blanca Veracruz.  El grupo está conformado por 10 integrantes de los cuales solo ocho salen en la foto.  

La representante del grupo se llama Marylu Pérez E. tiene 48 año de edad, tiene  4 hijo de los cuales todos son  varones.  Ella se dedica a la venta de topper  y necesita el préstamo para invertir  en su actividad y volver a poner el negocio de venta de elotes y esquites.  El sueño de doña Marylu es poner una verdulería ya que cuenta con un local el cual no lo utiliza por motivo de que no cuenta con el recurso necesario para surtirse.

Los integrantes son: Maria Guadalupe M. R. ella vende ropa, Maria Leticia A. Vásquez ella tiene una estética, Juana Guadalupe Jiménez Jiménez ella vende colcha, Gisela P. P. vende topper, Nelly P. R. ella empezara actividad, Luis Yovany M. G. el vende comida, Ofelia P. C. vende tarjetas telcel, Maria Concepción R. Guzmán ella vende ropa, Marylu Pérez E. ella vende topeer.
texts.en:
Ude Mana is the name the group came up with because most of the members believe that God will provide more to those in need the same way He gave us our daily bread. They meet biweekly to make their payments. This group is located in the Infonavit Ferrocrrrilero neighborhood in the city of Tierra Blanca Veracruz. The group is comprised of ten members, but only eight are in the photo. Marylu Pérez represents the group. She is 48 and has four sons. She sells Tupperware, and she needs the loan to invest in her activity and return to set up her business of selling corn and “esquites”. To see definition,click here. Marylu’s dream is to set up a fruit and vegetable store. She has a place, but she does not use it because she does not have the resources to stock it. The members are: Maria Guadalupe M. R.- Sells Clothes Maria Leticia A. Vásquez – Beauty Salon Juana Guadalupe Jiménez Jiménez – Sells Bedspreads Gisela P. P. – Sells Tupperware Nelly P. R. – Will be starting an activity Luis Yovany M. G. – Sells food Ofelia P. C. – Sells Telcel (Cell phone) Cards Maria Concepción R. Guzmán – Sells Clothes Marylu Pérez E. – Sells Tupperware

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy Tupperware and expand their businesses

loans.name: Mrs. Lon Mea Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lon M. is a village bank president in Prey Pnhi village in Takeo province. This village bank consists of 11 people.  Mrs. Lon M. is a silk weaver and her husband, Mr. Ney N., is a construction laborer in the local village. He also catches a little fish to sell to support his family. In order to expand his fishing business, Mrs. Lon M. decided to ask for a loan to buy bamboo to make fishing tools to catch more fish to sell for more income. 
Mrs. Lon M. is 31 years old and the mother of three children who are all too young to study or work.

loans.use: To buy bamboos to make fishing tools

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This entrepreneur is 33 years old and married, and has one child. He is an educated person and a good bread-winner. He sells women's clothing.

When he received the first loan, he was able to build his own shop and purchase a lot of materials for his shop. As a result of his honesty and good  reputation, he was able to attract more customers, because all of his customers are women. He has an employee who helps him, and he intends to add more employees if his income increases. He bought a lot of women’s garments and gained a lot of customers. He is a good and dependable man to his customers and makes all of his loan payments in the proper manner.

loans.use: To buy clothing and materials

loans.name: Divina Luz 1,2 Group

texts.en:
Yocasta is the coordinator of her group, Divina Luz (Divine Light), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti). Her group is located in Los Alcarrizos, a dusty industrial town where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her longterm partner and their three children.

Yocasta is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza and she is excited about the opportunity to continue growing her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling empanadas (stuffed bread or pastry) by purchasing the necessary ingredients including cooking oil, meats, cheeses and flour.

Yocasta will use the profits to invest in the education of her children and in her business. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for making more empanadas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more fruits for her business

loans.name: Sitan

texts.fr:
Sitan Diamouténé est une femme mariée de 41 ans et mère de quatre  enfants qui vit avec son époux et leurs enfants à Sanoubougou I, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso.
Sitan Diamouténé s’est vite intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment l’achat et la  vente du bois de chauffe et des poissons fumés depuis maintenant 10  ans. Elle réjouit d’une forte réputation dans cette activité et reçoit beaucoup de commandes surtout en hivernage.
Afin de  satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus nombreuses et exigeantes, elle a fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso. Après cinq prêts individuels tous correctement remboursés, elle est à son sixième prêt individuel qui sera utilisé pour acheter, 5 chargements de charrettes en bois de chauffe dans les localités environnantes de la ville de Sikasso  et 4 cartons de poissons fumés à Gao (7ème région administrative du Mali).
Elle vend les bois de chauffe à domicile et les poissons fumés au marché, en détail au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle diverse et variée.  
Avec ce prêt, elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 115 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour  réaliser subvenir aux dépenses personnelles, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Sitan Diamouténé is 41 years old, married and mother of four children, and lives with her husband and children in Sanoubougou I, one of the neighborhoods in Sikasso. Ten years ago she became interested in revenue-generating activities, in particular the retailing of firewood and smoked fish. She enjoys a solid reputation in what she does and receives many orders, mostly in winter. To satisfy a demanding and ever-increasing customer base, she called upon Soro Yiriwaso. After five individual loans, all correctly reimbursed, she is now requesting her sixth loan, which will be used to buy five cartloads of firewood from villages in the vicinity of Sikasso, and five boxes of smoked fish from Gao (seventh administrative region of the Republic of Mali). She sells the firewood from her home and retails the smoked fish at the market, for cash or credit to a diversified range of customers. She hopes the loan will help her achieve monthly earnings of 115,000 FCFA, which will serve to cover personal and some family expenses, and pay off the loan. The remainder will be reinvested in the business.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy firewood and smoked fish

loans.name: Mabatini Group

texts.en:
Abdul M., age 32, is married with three children, ages 10, 8 and 5. He has had a clothing shop at a place called Tandika for five years now. He works from 8:30 am to 8:30 pm and he is able to make a monthly profit of about $415.

This will be Abdul’s second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loan to start selling DVDs, radios and antennas, and he has paid back the loan successfully. He hopes for a loan to increase his DVD, Radio and antenna business.

Abdul will share this loan with subgroup B, of Mabatini Group, which totals six members. These members sell food, fruit, DVD players, radios and clothing. The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back the loan. 

In the picture, Abdul is the only man.

loans.use: To increase  DVD, radio and antenna stock

loans.name: Buenaventura

texts.es:
Buenaventura trabaja como comerciante en la venta de verduras, su esposo es transportista y pertenece al sindicato transportes Achocalla, es su principal fuente de ingreso con lo que cubre la manutención de su familia, tiene 3 hijos con la edades de 12, 7 y 5 años. Su domicilio esta ubicado en la Comunidad de Achocalla. 

El préstamo lo destinará para la compra de material para la construcción de su casa (cemento, arena, estuco, fierro).
 
Es tercer crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago le permite solicitar otro préstamo.
texts.en:
Buenaventura operates a business selling vegetables. Her husband is a driver and belongs to the Achocalla tranportation union. Their income supports the family which includes 3 children, 12, 7 and 5 years old. Their house is the Achocalla neighborhood. The loan will be used to buy material for building a house (cement, sand, stucco, iron bar). This is Buenaventura's third IMPRO loan. Her past payment record makes her a good candidate for soliciting new loans.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials for building a house.

loans.name: Djiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Djiguiya, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 35  ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Glofia, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage et font le commerce de lait, de poissons, d’articles divers de boutique et d’arachide.                                                                    
Ces femmes du groupe Djiguiya sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire et Bafou Traoré  est un des membres du groupe qui excelle dans l’achat vente de poissons sous plusieurs formes. 
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des poissons frais. Elle s’approvisionne en poisson sur place avec les pêcheurs du village  et effectue sa vente sur place aux revendeurs venus de Dioïla et dans les villages environnants, au comptant, en détail et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.                                                   
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20000FCFA qui sera utilisé dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités de commerce.
texts.en:
The women of the Djiguiya group, all married, are on average 35 years old with 5 children and live in traditional extended families in the town of Glofia, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know each other through familial and neighbourhood relations, and sell milk, fish, peanuts, and various shop items. These women are on their second solidarity (group) loan, and Bafou Traoré is one of the group members who excels in the buying and resale of various types of fish. She intends to use her part of this loan to buy fresh fish. She gets her supplies of fish on-the-spot from the town fishermen and makes her sales locally to the retailers who come from Dioïla, and also in the neighbouring towns, in cash, at retail, and on credit, to a clientele composed of men and women. She intends to realize an average monthly profit of 20,000 FCFA, a portion of which will be used to pay for the family's daily expenses, and the rest reinvested in her business.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fresh fish

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: LA SRA. SONIA ESTA CASADA, VIVE EN LA LOCALIDAD DE EL TORNO DISTANTE A 40 KM DE LA CIUDAD DE SANTA CRUZ, TIENE 3 HIJOS, SU ESPOSO SE DEDICA AL SERVICIO DE TAXI( TRANSPORTE DE PERSONAS), SU ACTIVIDAD PRINCIPAL ES LA VENTA DE ROPA EN EL MERCADO DE EL TORNO, SE DEDICA A ESTA ACTIVIDAD HACE VARIOS AÑOS, LA SRA. SONIA TIENE CASA PROPIA, MOTIVO POR EL CUAL SU ESPOSO Y ELLA TUVIERON  QUE TRABAJAR MUCHO YA QUE  LO ADQUIRIO MEDIANTE FINANCIAMIENTO, EL DESTINO DEL CAPITAL SOLICITADO ES PARA LA COMPRA DE ROPA DE INVIERNO YA QUE SE ESTA APROXIMANDO LA TEMPORADA, Y ELLA QUIERE COMPRAR CHAMARRAS Y CHOMPAS DE LANA; ES MUY TRABAJADORA SIEMPRE PENSANDO EN EL BIENESTAR DE SU FAMILIA, SU DESEO DE LA SRA. ES EL DE VER A SUS HIJAS PROFESIONALES Y EL PODER AMPLIAR SU CASITA, SE SIENTE AGRADECIDA CON LA INSTITUCION YA QUE LE HA BRINDADO EL APOYO FINANCIERO.
texts.en:
Sonia lives in the town of El Torno, about 40 km from the city of Santa Cruz. She is married and has 3 sons. Her husband is a taxi cab driver. Sonia's main activity is to sell clothes in the central market in El Torno. She has her own home, for which she had to work very hard since she acquired it through financing. She will use the sought after loan to buy winter clothes since the seasons are about to change. She is grateful for the opportunity offered her by this institution as it has offered her financial support without too much paperwork. She is a very hard-worker and is always thinking about the well-being of her family. She is very grateful to Emprender and to Kiva for the confidence they have placed in her in granting her this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Tania Mazumdar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying clothing merchandise to sell

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en: Leonida D. C. is a 58-year-old married woman who lives on 5th Street, Barangay Progreso, Binalbagan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living with her general store business. Leonida’s husband, Romeo, is a company guard and they have two children who are between 33 and 35 years old, both employed. Leonida joined NWTF-Project Dungganon (NWTF-PD) in 2002 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in her general store business. Now she earns an average monthly income of P9,000 from her business activities. Leonida is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of P18,000 was used to fund operations of her general store and it had a positive impact on both the business and on the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing P8,000 for her 13th loan which she intends to use for her general store. Leonida is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her general store

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en:
Ruben D. is from the village of Binuangan, Misamis Oriental. He is 45 years old and single.  Ruben owns a sari-sari (variety) retail shop which primarily sells both food and daily use products as well as fire wood in the local community. Ruben has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2002, Ruben joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ruben has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Ruben is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 9th loan taken out by Ruben from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: María

texts.es: María de  43 años, vive con sus 2 hijos en su casa que es propia.Desde su niñez borda creativos diseños  sobre  faldas típicas de la  región donde vive.  Su labor  la realiza diariamente en su casa, y durante los fines de semana comercializa sus bordados en el  mercado local de su zona, sus principales clientes son los comerciantes de trajes típicos, es por eso que cada día tiene que  avanzar regularmente para producir sus bordados en mayor cantidad. Para ella es clave tener siempre disponible sus materiales, porque así puede avanzar sin problemas. Paralelamente a esta actividad  también se dedica a la crianza de cerdos que engorda y después de 3 meses vende en el mercado de su zona. Afirma que le gusta trabajar más en los bordados, porque no requiere de mucho esfuerzo físico, pero si de mucha creatividad además considera  que su trabajo no tiene pierde, porque los bordados no son perecibles, como los alimentos. Ahora aprovechara la época de  festividades de su zona, pues tiene mayor cantidad de pedidos.Es la oportunidad numero 11 que tiene un crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias, además agradece  a todas las  personas que hicieron posible el  préstamo solicitado ya que  le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio.María invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de cantidad de  materiales como hilos y telas, de diferentes colores y variedades, que necesita para sus bordados, ya que sabe que debe aprovechar estas épocas, pues obtendrá mayores pedidos.
texts.en:
María, 43, lives in her own home with her two children. Since her childhood she has embroidered creative designs on skirts that are typical of the area where she lives. She works daily at home and on the weekends she sells her works of embroidery at the local markets in her area. Her main customers are merchants who sell typical costumes and this is why she must advance daily with her production in order to produce higher quantities of items. For her, having supplies on hand is key because then she can advance problem free. Alongside this activity, she also raises pigs which she sells in her area markets after three months of fattening. She states that she enjoys the embroidery work more because it doesn’t require much physical exertion. In addition, she feels that this work doesn’t have any loss because the items aren’t perishable like food. She is taking advantage of the festive season in her area because orders are increased. This is her 11th opportunity with MFP. She is happy to know that she can count on financial help because she has always been responsible with her repayments. Additionally, she enjoys being part of a communal bank because all the members are responsible and support each other. Also, she is grateful to all the people that made the loan possible because it will be very useful for her business’s progress. María will use the funds to buy raw materials like thread and fabric in assorted colors and varieties that she needs for her embroidery because she is aware that she must capitalize on this season when orders increase.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily M. is from the village of Minante 2, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 43 years old. Emily is married and has two infant-aged children. To make a living, Emily owns & operates a business selling personal use and home use products in the local community. She has also been selling processed foods for two months now. Emily has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Emily joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emily is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Emily from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta V. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 25 years old. Vicenta is married and has 2 infant child. To make a living, Vicenta owns & operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting rice for sale. Like other entrepreneurs, Vicenta hopes for her business to prosper.

Vicenta joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Vicenta has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Vicenta is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure and other farm inputs. This will be the second loan taken out by Vicenta from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Habibahon's Group

texts.en:
Habibahon A. is the leader of the group. She is 44 and divorced. She has raised two sons and three daughters. The sons work in construction, two older daughters are married and live separately with their families, and the youngest daughter works in Russia. Habibahon is engaged in livestock breeding, and she started this activity in 1995. When the collective farms broke up, she got a half hectare of land and began to cultivate cotton.  With money received from the loan she wants to purchase sheep in order to increase the number of livestock. In the future, she plans to purchase a piece of land and start building a house for her son.

Abdimumin T., 59, is a widow.  He has raised three sons, and all of them work in construction in Russia. He uses the money which his sons send to him for building a house. Abdimumin himself works as a taxi driver and earns 5000 soms per month. With money received from the loan he plans to finish building the house. In the future he wants to see his sons get married, purchase a piece of land, and breed cattle.

Feruza S., 28, is married. She has a son and two daughters. The first daughter and the son are at school and the second daughter is not yet, as she is preschool age (under 7). Ten years ago, with the initial investment of 8000 soms, Feruza started to breed livestock. Reselling cattle after fattening, she makes 4000 soms per month. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase sheep in order to resell them after fattening at the higher price.

Kamolathon A. is 21, and she lives with her parents. Her father is an engineer and her mom is engaged in farming. Kamolathon is engaged in cattle breeding, and she sells milk to make money. In this way, she makes 1250 soms per month. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase hay for cattle to feed them during the winter season.  

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase sheep.

loans.name: Nguyễn

texts.en: M. Nguyễn Thị (20201030021) is a 37-year-old female living in the town of Huyện Yên Phong, tỉnh Bắc Ninh. She is married and has two school-aged children. M. owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling internet connection and services in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over ten years and earns approximately 4,600,000 VND a month. In 2007, M. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,392,000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. M. is now requesting a new loan of 9,632,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. The loan will be her 5th from SEDA. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide micro-finance services to the low-income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ***************************************************** M. Nguyễn Thị (20201030021) là 37 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh. Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 2 trẻ ở độ tuổi đi học. Để kiếm sống, M. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh. Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng. Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các dịch vụ kết nối internet trong cộng đồng địa phương. M. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, M. kiếm được khoảng 4.600.000 VND một tháng. Vào 2007, M. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. M. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 9.632.000 VND. Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua thêm hàng hóa tồn kho & vốn lưu động. Khoản vay sẽ là 5th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. M. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es: Ramiro G. C. es padre de familia de 2 pequeños a los cuales quiere ofrecer una mejora calidad de vida, es por ello que quiere ir formando un mejor patrimonio para ellos. El señor desea un préstamo para terminar de construir su vivienda ya que necesita poner vitropiso y levantar una barda al frente de su casa.
texts.en:
Ramiro G. C. is the father of 2 children, for whom he wants to offer a better quality of life. This is why he wants to form more wealth for them. He wishes to have the loan to finish building his house because he still needs to install ceramic flooring and make the wall outside the front of his house higher.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ceramic flooring and to raise the wall outside of his house.

loans.name: Emma Yolanda

texts.es: Emma Yolanda B. D. A. D. 53 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. Ahuachapán, en donD. vive junto a su esposo y tres hijas menores D. edad, quienes estudian y en sus tiempos libres le ayudan a Emma a atender el negocio. Ella posee una venta D. ropa para hombres, mujeres y niños, la cual esta ubicada es su casa D. habitación, lugar en el cual durante más D. 5 años ha tratado D. seguir adelante con su negocio, ya que es este el que le permite solventar todos los gastos del hogar junto a su esposo. Emma solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. ropa, sobre todo ropa para jóvenes la cual esta muy D. moda, lo que le permita ser más fácil D. vender. Esto es vital para Emma ya que la estabilidad D. su hogar depenD. en gran manera D. las ganancias obtenidas por ella. Para Emma el bienestar D. su familia es primero, razón por la cual trabaja muy duro para salir adelante.
texts.en: Emma Yolanda B. D. A. is 53 years old, she resides in the Ahuachapán department, where she lives with her husband and three young daughters, who are studying and in their free time they help Emma in her business. She owns a business selling clothing for men, women and children, which is located at her home, where for more than 5 years she has tried to get ahead with her business, as it is this which allows her to settle all the household expenses with her husband. Emma is requesting a loan so that she can buy a greater quantity of clothing, above all clothing for young people that is very fashionable, as this will make it very easy to sell. This is vital for Emma as the stability of her home depends greatly on the profits she makes. For Emma the well-being of her family comes first, it is the reason why she works very hard to get ahead.

loans.use: Purchase clothes to sell.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es: Irma tiene 54 años, vive con sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 33 años vende comida, por lo que de un inicio lo hizo de manera ambulante, pero hace 15 años comenzó a tener su propio puesto de ventas, desde entonces atiende diariamente, en la única que prepara sus platillos, mientras que sus hijos la ayudan en la compra de ingredientes en el mercado, además que tiene buena demanda debida a la buena sazón que tiene. Su negocio le ha resultado rentable a lo largo de estos años, pese a que se encuentra ubicada en un sitio menso concurrido pero mantiene a sus clientes por la atención y por la buena preparación de sus comidas. Por tal razón continuara  trabajando, proponiéndose como meta  en mejorar su negocio. Este es su crédito número 13 con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, puesto que este aporte le  será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Por otro lado agradece a todas las personas que  serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita, asimismo le gusta ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra al por mayor de algunos ingredientes no perecibles para la preparación de sus alimentos.
texts.en: Irma is 54 years old and lives with her 3 children in her own home. She has been selling food for 33 years.  Initially she sold food in an itinerant manner but 15 years ago she got her own food stall and she has worked there every day since then.  She prepares her dishes while her children help her purchase ingredients in the market.  Her food is in great demand because she is a great cook.  Her business has been profitable all these years in spite of the fact that her stall is located in a less crowded place.  Irma manages to keep her customers because of her attentiveness and the good preparation of her meals.  For this reason she is still working and intends to improve her business.  This is her 13th loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support because this contribution will be very useful for her business' progress.  She would like to thank everybody who helps to fund the loan which she is requesting.  She likes being part of her community bank because all its members are responsible and very supportive people.  She will use her loan to purchase some non-perishable ingredients wholesale which she will use in preparing her food.

loans.use: To purchase non-perishable ingredients

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 54 Años, es separada y vive sola en su casa propia. Desde hace 15 años decidió generar sus propias fuentes de ingreso, mediante la agricultura y la crianza de animales, asimismo posee una tienda, en donde vende variedad de productos de primera necesidad, y en la que su hija es la encargada de dicho negocio. De esta manera su actividad diaria es que cada mañana sale al campo a cuidar sus cultivos, mientras su vaca y ovejas se alimentan de pastizales, en tanto lo que cosecha lo lleva a vender a otras ciudades y una parte lo comercializa en la tienda. Durante todo ese tiempo de trabajo ha visto frutos  beneficiosos en las rentas que ha recibido por lo que esta  viendo mas adelante incrementar su producción e intensificar mas la venta de animales. Es su crédito numero 9 que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que conocen de su persona que es responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias, agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo utilizará en la compra de sacos de abono, para la siguiente siembra de maíz.
texts.en:
Rosa is 54 years old.  She is separated and lives alone in her own home.  15 years ago she decided to generate her own source of income by farming and raising animals.  She also has a store in which she sells a variety of basic goods.  Her daughter is in charge of that business.  Each morning she goes out into the fields to tend to her crops while her cow and her sheep graze on pasture.  She takes some of the crops she harvests to sell in other towns and sells some in her store.  During all the time she has been working, she has seen the fruit of her labor in the profits that she has made.  For this reason she is looking ahead to increase her production and intensify the sale of her animals.

This is the 9th loan which she has had from MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support from MFP because they know she is a person who is responsible in making her repayments.  She likes being a member of her community bank because all the members are people who she knows.  They are all responsible and very supportive of each other.  She thanks all those who will help fund her loan since it will be very useful for her in making progress with her business.  She will use the loan to buy sacks of fertilizer for sowing her next lot of corn.

loans.use: To buy sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
