Joseph K. M. is a 23 year old single man. He has been in the mali mali / barter trade business in Kongowea for the last two years. He normally exchanges items like wash basins, utensil holders and kitchen wares for newspapers, old clothes and shoes, which he later sells or repairs to sell at a profit.

This is his second loan with KADET, which he plans to use to purchase more stock of the items for exchange with his clients. 

He in future he wants to start another business, and his dream is to live happily and get a family that he can be able to provide for as well.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory for sale and trade in his bartering business

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en: Zainab M. is a 21 year old married lady who has one child. She operates a retail shop in Maweni area, Malindi. She was introduced to KADET LTD by an existing client and this will be her second loan. Zainab is requesting a loan of 80,000 KES to expand her business by buying stock and repairing her business premises. Zainab hopes that, by doing this, her business will grow, and she will be able to use her profits to help support her family. In the future, Zainab hopes to own a flourishing supermarket.

loans.use: to buy stock and undertake repairs

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy V. is from the village of Banga, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 41 years old. Juvy is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Juvy owns & operates a mini-restaurant. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from serving a variety of different meals like "batchoy" to customers  in the local community. Juvy has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 7500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Juvy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juvy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase food & drinks for the restaurant. Juvy is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase food & drinks for the restaurant. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Juvy from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase food & drinks for the restaurant

loans.name: Otgontuya

texts.en: Otgontuya B., age 26, lives with her parents in the SonginoHairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia's capital city. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian housing tent, on a small plot of land which they own. Since 2002,  Otgontuya has been operating a clothing repair business in her home and now her mother helps her with the business. After many years of operation, she has gained significant experience as a tailor. For the future, she plans to expand her business and improve her equipment and tools. Otgontuya is a hardworking, modest and generous woman. She is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to purchase materials and supplies for her sewing and clothing repair business.

loans.use: to purchase materials and supplies

loans.name: Arceli

texts.en:
Arceli L. is from the village of San Luis, Gingoog City. She is 67 years old. Arceli is separated from her spouse and has six adult children. 

To make a living, Arceli owns and operates a tailoring business, providing general alteration and tailoring services as well as curtains, pillowcases, bedsheets, sofa covers, dresses and pants to local community members. Arceli has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Arceli joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Arceli has successfully repaid a previous loan of 16,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional tailoring equipment such as needles and threads. 

Arceli is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Arceli from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fabrics and materials

location.town: San Luis, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Gerelee

texts.en: Gerelee, 35, is married and lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. His wife works as a nurse at a hospital and his two children attend a local secondary school. They are fortunate to own a home and land as well as maintain a decent standard of living. In 2010 Gerelee opened a grocery store near his home. He purchases food from wholesale stores and sells it at his grocery store which is located on the outskirts of the city. He wants to expand his shop and sell a wider variety of food. Gerelee is an honest and modest person who says "I would like to enlarge my shop and make more money in order to save for my children's future education." He is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase more food to sell at his shop so that he can increase his working capital.

loans.use: To purchase food to resell in his shop.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en: Christopher is 36 years old and married with four children living in his own house in Hioma, Uganda. For 11 years, he has been running a business of fresh foods with which he has been able to provide basics to the family. He faces a challenge of seasonal variations where sometimes there is scarcity of fresh foods and in the future, he hopes to own a big retail shop selling all kinds of fresh foods. Christopher needs the loan to buy cabbages & watermelon to sell.

loans.use: To buy cabbage and watermelons to sell

loans.name: Pasile

texts.en: Pasile is 52 years old, married and a father of five.  For five years, he has been selling belts, key holders and handbags to earn a living.  He is also a dairy farmer.  Through farming, he is able to earn extra income for his family.  Currently, he does not have a permanent business premise.  Hence, he is looking forward to owning a business premise.  He has requested 20,000 Kes to buy belts, key holders and handbags.

loans.use: To buy belts, key holders and handbags

loans.name: Chanthoeurn

texts.en:
Ms. Chanthoeurn N. (pictured above), 24, is single. She lives with her sister, brother and parents on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Chanthoeurn is a weaver. She is applying for her first loan of 1,000 USD to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Fermin Alberto

texts.es: EL SEÑOR FERMIN LABORA COMO ANALISTA PRESUPUESTARIOS, ES CASADO, TIENE DOS  PERSONA A SU CARGO, ES EL PRIMER CREDITO QUE CEPRODEL LE OTORGA, LOS NECESITA PARA  MEJORA DE SU VIVIENDA, EN REPARACION  DEL TECHO, COMPRA DE CINZ, PERLINE, EL PAGO DE LA MANO DE OBRA, AGRADECE EL APOYO QUE  ESTA INSTITUCION LE BRINDA.
texts.en: Sr. Fermin works as a budget analyst.  He is married and has two dependents.  This is the first loan he has received from CEPRODEL.  He needs the funds for a home improvement, specifically the repair of his roof.  Fermin will buy zinc, crossbeams, and pay for labor.  He is grateful for the support CEPRODEL has provided.

loans.use: To pay for materials and labor needed to repair his roof.

loans.name: Katty

texts.en:
This is 44-year-old Katty K..  She is a widow and has one child aged 17. In 2007, Katty established her plastic slippers and sandals business. She began her business because she realised that it was necessary that she also become productive in her marital home. Her business is open 6 days a week and 10 hours a day.

Katty would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Katty requires a loan in order to purchase a large quantity of plastic slippers and sandals for her business. "Now that I have lost my husband and I do not have anyone to help me support my child, my business is the only solution to my problems," said Katty. "I wish to see my child through her education."  

Katty thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more plastic slippers and sandals.

loans.name: Jose Santos

texts.es:
José, reside en San Rafael Oriente, departamento de San Miguel, vive con su esposa y una hija, él se dedica a la venta de ropa y medicinas, inicio por un familiar, quien influyo para que tomara la decisión, no tiene un horario fijo.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa y medicamentos por ejemplo: ropa interior para niños y adultos, blusas, faldas y vestidos, en los medicamentos pues una amplia gama de pastillas, frascos e inyecciones, a través de este préstamo espera fortalecer el negocio y ofrecer a los clientes una mayor cantidad de productos.
Su objetivo es desarrollarse con el negocio, tener un local fijo para la venta y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en: José lives in San Rafael Oriente, department of San Miguel, with his wife and daughter. He makes a living selling clothing and medicine, a business that he started after a relative encouraged him. He doesn't have a fixed schedule. He is requesting the loan to purchase clothings and medicine, for example: undergarments for children and adults, blouses, skirts and dresses; and for medicines, a wide range of pills, bottles and injections. With this loan, he hopes to strengthen his business and offer his customers a larger amount of products. His goal is to develop his business, to have a fixed storefront to make his sales, and to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase clothing such as undergarments, blouses, skirts and dresses.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Ulambayar

texts.en: Mr.Ulambayar is 26 years old, lives with his wife and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He lives in the extension of his parent's house which he built two years ago. His wife looks after her baby at the moment. Ulambayar runs a taxi business using his family car. The car, which he bought two years ago, has gotten old and needs replacing. The taxi business is the family’s only source of income. Ulambayar is asking for a loan to replace his old family car which he uses in his taxi business. He is going to sell the old car and to buy better second hand car.

loans.use: To replace his old family car which he uses in his taxi business.

loans.name: Azad

texts.en:
Azad is a 30-year-old married man. He is blessed with two daughters, who go to a local secondary school. Azad and his family live in a small settlement built for refugee families, in Bilasuvar district. He fled to Bilasuvar from Nagorno-Karabakh in the beginning of the 1990s.

The family's budget depends mainly on the income from the cattle-breeding business that Azad started in 2003. Nowadays he earns about 350 AZN a month through selling dairy and meat products in the local bazaar. With the help of this first loan in the amount of 1200 AZN, Azad purchased three cows. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase three cows

loans.name: Gold Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GOLD est composé de trois personnes qui habitent le même quartier. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé,afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Odile est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Odile est née 18 janvier 1964 au Bénin et est mariée à Emile un agent du port autonome du Bénin. Le couple à trois enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Odile vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assurées par le couple. Pour y parvenir, Odile mène comme activité depuis trois ans la vente de divers produits (sucre, lait, savon etc.). Odile s’approvisionne dans le plus grand marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Odile sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe Gold, un troisième crédit. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
GOLD is a group composed of three persons who live in the same district. This is the third time that this group has requested financial aid from ALIDé for raising their level of business. The group’s representative, by the name of Odile, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. 

Odile was born on January 19, 1964 in Benin and is married to Emile, an agent at the autonomous port of Benin. The couple has three children, who are all in school and in their care. She lives together with her husband and children. The various household expenses are ensured by the couple. To do so, Odile has been running a business for three years selling a variety of goods (sugar, milk, soap, etc.). She is supplied from the biggest market in Benin. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers and to increase her turnover and her revenues, Odile, along with the other members of the group GOLD, is requesting a third loan. The loans received in the past have indeed been repaid.

loans.use: to buy boxes of sugar, soap, and milk

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN PURIFICADA - ANGOSTURA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Nelly; ella tiene 31 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales como pollos y cuyes, la socia los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en los diferentes mercados y también tiene una combi que hace servicio publico en la ciudad de Cusco, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de crianza de animales y transporte. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar animales como pollos y cuyes y también para mantenimiento de su carro.
                                                        
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Nelly is a member of the "Virgen Purificada - Angostura" community bank which is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province and department.

Nelly is 31 years old, lives with her partner, and has one child.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business raising animals such as chickens and guinea pigs.  She fattens the animals and then sells them in different markets.  In addition, Nelly has a small minibus that provides a public service in the city of Cusco.  Through these businesses, she gets her son ahead in life.  Nelly would like to expand and improve both her animal business and her transport business.  She is requesting this loan to buy animals such as chickens and guinea pigs and also to have maintenance work carried out on her vehicle.

Nelly is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy animals such as chickens and guinea pigs and also to have maintenance work done on her vehicle

loans.name: Ghazi

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 46 years old, married and has six children.

Ghazi has a store selling household items, gifts and artificial flowers. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs, a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $2,400 loan to rebuild the ceiling of his store and to make showcases. He is aiming to gain more profits to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To rebuild the ceiling of his store and to make showcases.

loans.name: Janviere

texts.en:
Janviere is a 31-year-old Rwandan entrepreneur with three children between the ages of 2 and 11. The eldest two are in school and she runs a general store with her husband.

For the past three years, she has been running the store, which sells maize flour, salt, sugar, and other goods.  The success from this business has enabled her to feed her family.  

She will use this loan to purchase more goods that she will sell in the store.  This will allow her to continue to earn profits that will provide for the well-being of her family and accumulate savings.

loans.use: to buy items for her shop such as maize flour, salt, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Olimjon

texts.ru:
Олимчон добрый и целеустремленный отец.   Он женат и любящий отец 6 детей. Олимчон преподает в среднем школе № 5 в местном городе. Олимчон старается зарабатывать много  денег, потому что у него очень большая семья и ему не хватает зарплата, которую он получает в школе.  И так он решил заниматься выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур с целью получение прибыли. Он выращивает фрукты, и овощи затем продает их в своем магазине. Кроме этого он имеет еще один доход.  Он занимается скотоводством. Олимчон хотел бы получит кредит в размере 1000$ США для покупки горюче смазочные материалы и крупного рогатого скота.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en:
Olimjon is a good and dedicated father. He is married and the loving father of six children. Olimjon teaches at middle school number 5 in his town. Olimjon is trying to make a lot of money because he has a very big family, and does not make enough money teaching at school.  So he decided to start farming to make a profit. He grows fruit and vegetables and then sells them in his shop. He also has another source of income. He breeds cattle. Olimjon would like to receive a loan of $1000 to buy fuel, lubricants, and cattle.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy fuel, lubricants, and cattle.

loans.name: Tecoporave Rekavo Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Asunción, 13 amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad se unen, de lo que surge el comité denominado Tecoporave Rekavo, el cual se encuentra en el cuarto ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya. Ellas se unieron con el propósito de generar ingresos para sus familias, además de eso ven en esto una oportunidad de crecimiento, no solo en el sentido económico, sino también en lo personas.
La señora Maria se dedica a la venta de comestibles, según comentarios de la misma tiene muy buena clientela, lo cual le genera muy buenos ingresos. Dice que muchas personas gustan de las comidas que ella prepara, ya que tiene muy rica sazón. Uno de sus sueños es tener un comedor, donde pueda deleitar a más personas con los alimentos que prepara.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de carne, condimentos, lácteos, panificados y otros insumos necesarios para la elaboración de los alimentos que prepara.
texts.en:
In the city of Asunción, 13 friends and neighbours from the city join forces, from which is born the communal bank called Tecoporave Rekavo. Tecoporave Rekavo is currently in its 4th cycle of the program run by Fundación Paraguaya for enterprising women. They joined forces for the purpose of generating income for their families. In addition, they also see it as an opportunity for growth, not only in the economic sense but also at the personal level.

Mrs Maria sells food. She herself says that she has a very good client base which generates a very good income. She says that a lot of people like the food she prepares, as it is very tasty. One of her dreams is to own a diner where more people can enjoy the food she prepares.

She is asking for a loan to buy meat, seasonings, dairy products, bakery items and other such necessary items to produce the food she makes.

loans.use: to buy meat, dairy products and bakery items used to prepare the food she make.

loans.name: Jose Oswaldo

texts.es:
José, es agricultor, vive con su madre y tres hermanos, él trabaja cultivando maíz y frijol, junto a su madre realizan los cultivos, cuenta con experiencia en la actividad. Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para comprarse semilla y abono para sembrar maíz, con esto podrá realizar el cultivo y esperar que la producción sea abundante.
El objetivo de José es apoyarse de préstamos para mejorar los cultivos y contribuir de las ganancias a los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
José is a farmer, who lives with his mother and three brothers.  He works growing corn and beans.  He farms with his mother, and has experience in this area.

Currently, he is requesting a loan to buy seeds and manure for planting corn.  With this, he will be able to plant his crop and hope that his harvest is abundant.

José's objective is to use the help provided by the loans to improve his crops and contribute his earnings to the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy seeds and manure to grow corn.

loans.name: Yanet

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “MADRES TRABAJADORAS”; El banco pertenece al distrito de Tica Tica, Provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Yanett; la socia tiene 31 años de edad, ella es casada, la socia tiene 1 hijo; la socia se dedica a la artesanía, ella compra y vende artesanía hace un año atrás está  exportando artesanía al extranjero pero en un mínimo porcentaje, la socia desearía poder incrementar sus ganancias si solo pudiera exportar a futuro cercano un mayor número de arte para el extranjero,  la socia dice que esto se debe a que muchos turistas no la encuentran en la página principal en internet y por ello le es mas difícil competir, la socia desea invertir el crédito en la compra de arte al por mayor y de materiales  para la realización de trabajos propios, la socia desearía exportar al mayoreo, lo que quiere decir crecer en ventas. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de un grupo de arte para decorar los diferentes espacios familiares.
La socia se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Madres Trabajadoras communal bank, located in the Tica Tica district in the province of Cusco, department of Cusco.

Yanet, 31, is married and has one child.  She works in crafts, buying and selling crafts.  For a year she has been exporting crafts abroad, but only a very small percentage.  She would like to be able to increase her profits in the near future, if only she could export a greater number of pieces.  She says this is because many tourists don't find her on the home page on the internet, and this is why it's more difficult for her to compete.

She wants to use the loan to buy art wholesale and supplies for her own work.  She would like to export wholesale, which means to increase her sales.  She is requesting the loan to buy a set of artworks for decorating different parts of the home.

Yanet is satisfied and grateful for the support that this loan will offer her, and she is committed to repaying her debt by the established deadline.

loans.use: to buy a set of artworks for decorating different parts of the home.

loans.name: Liny

texts.en:
Liny is 44 years old and lives in Sinonoc, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Liny owns and operates a motorcycle transport business to earn a living. It is personally run by her husband. The vehicle has existed for over three years and allows the family to receive a monthly income of 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP). She has requested a loan from GDMPC worth PHP 10,000, which will be used to renew the motorcycle and driving licenses to continue the business. 

Liny has been a member of GDMPC since 2009. In the future, Liny hopes to buy one more vehicle for additional means of income and to be used in some other business deals if necessary. She expects to take another loan from the cooperative in the future to further improve her business engagement.

loans.use: To renew the motorcycle and driving licenses.

loans.name: Diego Boanerge

texts.es: Diego Boanerge tiene 56 años, su actividad es la compra y venta de chatarra. Desde hace más de 6 años que tiene este negocio, él trabaja en la alcaldía municipal su esposa se dedica a la compra y venta de cerdos juntos lograron comprar una camioneta para hacer más fácil sus compras luego Diego se enfermó por lo que tuvo que renunciar a su centro de trabajo y empezó a trabajar junto con su esposa e hijos. Por eso solicita el financiamiento para la compra de hierro, acero entre otros productos.
texts.en: Diego Boanerge is 56 years old. He works buying and selling scrap metal. For the more than six years he's had this business, he's worked at city hall. His wife buys and cells pigs. Together they were able to buy a pickup truck to make their buying trips easier. Then Diego got sick and had to quit his job and start working with his wife and children. That's why he's requesting a loan to buy iron and steel, among other products.

loans.use: to buy iron, steel, and other products.

loans.name: Sulficia

texts.en:
Sulficia works hard to support her family. Sulficia is a widow and she has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Sulficia requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase a motor for her fishing boat.

Sulficia has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Sulficia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase a motor for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Wangeci

texts.en: Wangeci is a 52 year old married woman. She has three children between the ages of 22 and 31 years old. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a local restaurant. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a shopping centre. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. She will use the Kes 60,000 loan to purchase more seats and tables for her restaurant. Her business goal is to grow it into a big restaurant that will be serving more customers within five years.

loans.use: to purchase seats and tables

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a 31-year-old married lady who has three children.  She has been selling clothes for two years. Through Faulu Kenya, she has been trained in financial management and this has helped her to save her money and to invest in her business.  She has managed to grow her business because of her hard work, and hopes to expand into wholesale in five years.  With her loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings, she will buy clothes.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
Emelyn is 32 years-old and lives in the Philippines. She is unmarried.

Emelyn has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages . She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 in order to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Emelyn has been a member of Kiva partner HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Emelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Teogenes

texts.es: Teogenes, de 51 años de edad, es un hombre emprendedor y trabajador, además de muy jovial y sociable, es conviviente con Margarita quien es ama de casa, vive en compañía de su hija de 25 años de edad y su nieto de 3 años de edad a quien quiere mucho. La actividad que realiza Teogenes es la siembra de palma aceitera para eso tiene un terreno propio de 50 hectáreas de terreno, pero solo tiene ocupada 13 hectáreas, las cuales están en producción. Tiene 13 años realizando esta actividad, y desde entonces cuenta con el apoyo técnico de una empresa privada, a la que vende toda su producción, llegando a contratar hasta 10 peones para la actividad de cosecha con un pago diario a cada uno. Lo que le gusta de actividad es que cuenta con un oficio al cual dedicarse, así como también le gusta el trabajo de campo y los ingresos económicos que le genera con la venta de su producción, que le sirve para solventar los gastos de su hogar. Al contrario, lo que no le gusta son las plagas de afectan las plantaciones, por eso tiene que estar pendiente y alerta de cualquier brote. Además tiene planes de seguir creciendo y comprarse un vehiculo de carga pesada para el transporte de su producto. Este será el préstamo número 20 con la institución MFP, Por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Además dice sentirse bien con su banco comunal, pues los conoce desde mucho tiempo a sus integrantes a los que considera ser personas responsables y solidarias. Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de abono, para el mantenimiento de sus siembras.
texts.en:
Teogenes, 51, is an enterprising, hardworking man besides being very jovial and sociable.  He lives with Margarita who is a housewife and with his daughter, 25, and his 3-year-old grandson who he loves very much.

Teogenes is a palm oil farmer; he has a 50 hectare plot of land he uses for that but he currently has only 13 hectares in production.  He’s been in business 13 years and has had technical assistance from a private firm all this time; he sells all of his production to it.   He has hired up to 10 laborers for the harvest paying each of them a daily wage.  What he likes about this activity is that he has an occupation to dedicate himself to.   In addition, he likes working in the fields and the income he earns when he sells his crops which allows him to cover household expenses.  What he doesn’t like, on the other hand, is the infestations that affect his crops; he must always be on the lookout for them and alert to any outbreak of them.  He plans to continue growing and to buy a heavy capacity vehicle to transport his product.

This will be MFP loan #20 and he hopes for your cooperation so that he can make his plans come about.  He says that feels good in his communal bank because he’s known the members for a long time and he considers them to be responsible, mutually supportive people.  He will use the requested 1500 new soles to buy manure for crop maintenance.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
This father of three has 20 years' experience in the farming business. Kyenjojo is where Jackson is based and he mostly grows groundnuts and fruit. He anticipates expanding his farm in the near future. Monthly this business generates income totaling UGX, 400,000.

His reckoning is that his income will surge once he expands his farm and purchases more groundnuts and fruit seeds to grow. He plans to use his loan to purchase more groundnuts and fruit seeds to grow.

loans.use: to purchase more groundnuts and fruit seeds to grow.

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru:
Замире 48 лет, имеет одну дочь. Замира работает швеей в  швейном цехе. Девять лет назад, в поисках дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, Замира начала свой бизнес в птицеводстве и животноводстве. Благодаря упорному труду Замиры, начатый с 5,000 сом (KGS) бизнес на сегодняшний день приносит около 8,000 сом в месяц от продажи мясных продуктов. Доходы от бизнес-деятельности позволили Замире оплатить контракт на высшее образование для своей дочери.   
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Замира обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков. Доходы Замира планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота.
texts.en: Zamira is 48 years old and has one daughter.  She works as a seamstress at a sewing factory.  In search of an additional source of income for her family, Zamira started her own poultry and animal husbandry business nine years ago.  Thanks to her persistent work, her business, started with 5,000 som (KGS), yields about 8,000 som per month today from sales of meat products.  The earnings from the business allowed Zamira to pay for her daughter's higher education contract.  In order to further grow her business, Zamira requested a loan in the sum of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to purchase bulls.  She plans to invest the profits into a further increase of livestock headcount.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Bourama

texts.fr:
Monsieur   BOURAMA  est âgé de 37 ans, marié  et père  de 4  enfants. Il  vit dans une famille traditionnelle  avec d’autres ménages à Ségou.
N’ayant pas fréquenté l’école pour des raisons sociales, il commença tôt à faire l’apprenti couturier auprès d’un oncle. Après plusieurs années passées à ses côtés, il finit par ouvrir son atelier. Il mène cette activité depuis 15 ans. Sa force de vente est due à son génie de création, connu de tout Ségou, sa différence avec les autres est liée à son sens de créativité. 
Il jouit d’une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
 Dans le dessein d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire, il  sollicite ce nouveau prêt. Il  est en relation avec Soro Yiriwaso depuis 12 mois, après 1  prêt individuel bien remboursé. Il  est à son 2ème prêt individuel qu’il compte utiliser pour acheter 1  machine à coudre  gros fil. Il  s’approvisionne sur place.
Monsieur   BOURAMA   fait ses prestations  au comptant et des fois à crédit. Avec ce prêt il envisage de réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de rembourser ses échéances avec Soro Yiriwaso et de régler ses charges de fonctionnement. Son ambition est d’agrandir son activité et d’embrasser d’autres activités.
texts.en:
Mr. Bourama is thirty-seven years old, married, and father of four children. He lives in a traditional family with other households in Ségou. 
Not having attended school for social reasons, he began his sewing training early with an uncle. After several years spent at his sides, he finished by opening his studio. He has run this business for fifteen years. The strength of his sales is due to the genius of his products, known by all in Ségou. The difference between him and others is linked to his sense of creativity.
He enjoys a clientele composed of women and men.
In the intent of increasing his turnover, he is asking for this new loan. He has been in relation with Soro Yiriwaso for twelve months, after one individual loan correctly repaid. He is at his second individual loan, which he intends to use to purchase one sewing machine for thick wire. He stocks up in the area. Monsieur Bourama does his transactions in cash and sometimes on credit. With this loan he imagines making a monthly profit of 100,000FCFA. This profit will allow him to make his repayments to Soro Yiriwaso and to settle his operating expenses. His ambition is to increase his business activities and to take up some other activities.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Ramon Enrrique

texts.es:
Don Ramón vive en la ciudad de San Lorenzo  que esta ubicada al sur de Honduras el  cuenta con una edad de 33 años de edad el cual su trabajo es prestar el servicio de taxi en su ciudad, el trabaja de manera responsable en su propio vehículo.
Don Ramón se a dedicado ya hace varios años a este tipo de trabajo y esta solicitando 20,000.00 lempiras para poder comprar repuesto para su vehículo ya que necesita hacerle algunas reparaciones y  cambiarles algunas piezas, el cree que con el apoyo de este crédito su automóvil estará en muy buenas condiciones siendo esta la herramienta mas importante en sus ingresos, el sueño de Don Ramón es comprarse otro vehículo para ponerlo a trabajar y así lograr tener mas ganancia para mejorar su vida y poder tener un hogar mas digno.   



San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Marzo 2012
texts.en:
Don Ramón lives in the city of San Lorenzo, located in the south of Honduras. He is 33 and drives a taxi in his city. He is a responsible worker and owns his own vehicle.
Ramón has been in this line of work for several years. He is requesting a loan of 25,000 Lempiras for the purchase of spare parts for his vehicle; he needs to make some repairs and switch out some pieces. He believes that this loan will allow him to ensure that his vehicle is in very good condition. His vehicle is his most important tool for making an income. Ramón's dream is to buy another vehicle so that he can make more income in order to improve his life and get a better home.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  March 2012

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his vehicle; he needs to make some repairs.

loans.name: Hesbon Okoth

texts.en:
Hesbon has been renting a motorcycle for taxi work for two years. He is married with two children and lives in Siaya County. Hesbon understand motorcycle business quite well and is ready to take up his own motorcycle.Hesbon  has committed to   provide transport to CHWs targeting rural families affected by HIV/AIDs and ARV usage monitoring. He is happy to own the Yamaha crux bike which will go along way in improving his business and supporting his community.

The motorcycle will enable Hesbon provide for his family and support the community and health service deliverance in his County. A small but useful contribution to society. Hesbon belongs to a motorcycle taxi association and hopes to encourage many more members to join in supporting the CHW work in Siaya county. His family is very happy too.

loans.use: To pay  for Motorcycle for Community Health Work and Livelihoods

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 39 years old and married with two children.

She is in agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Catherine is borrowing PHP 17000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Catherine has been in this business for 5 years and also earns additional income from general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Siddaling

texts.en:
Mr.Siddaling P. is a handicapped 19 year old bachelor living with 5 family members.  He was illiterate but has been attending night school and is now able to read and write.  He lives in a small village called Marapur in the Mudhol taluka of Bagalkot district in Karnataka, India.  He now does tailoring work in the village for Rs.50/- day.  He would like to shift to the dairy business by purchase of one she-buffalo.  By rearing this buffalo he will be able to get about 12-15 liters milk per day and he'll be able to earn an amount of Rs.125/- to Rs.150/- per day with a net profit of Rs.75/- to Rs.100/- per day.  


To purchase the buffalo he requires a loan amount of Rs.15000/-. 





*Due to Indian Government Regulations, your loan will be used to guarantee a low interest risk free loan from a local Indian source of funds to Somaiya.  Your loan to Siddaling will be used as "catalytic" debt, and local banks in India will loan Somaiya up to 10 times the amount raised on Kiva, greatly increasing Somaiya's capacity to loan to other entrepreneurs.  If Siddaling does not fully repay your loan, the funds will be converted to a grant and sent to Somaiya to cover the loss.



*As of January 2007 the exchange rate is 44.25 rupees to the US Dollar

loans.use: Siddaling would like to purchase one she-buffalo for 15,000 rupees to start his dairy

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Jane would like to buy in bulk, flour, salt, match boxes, laundry detergents and cereals in bulk for her retail shop

loans.name: Eya

texts.fr:
Mrs. Eya S. was born in 1945 in Fongbé. She has been a widow for 20 years. To provide for her needs and those of the children of which she takes care, in addition to farming, she sells smoked fish. An honest and dynamic woman, despite her age, she has already borrowed and reimbursed two loans. She is an exemplary and dependable woman and deserves to be supported to grow her business and increase her income for the well being of her family. She is asking for a $700 credit, which will serve to build her smoked fish commerce and to store corn and red oil. As a result, she will be able to benefit from increased profits and gain a financial autonomy.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame S. Eya est née en 1945 à Fongbé. Elle est veuve depuis 20 ans. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et ceux des enfants dont elle à la charge, en plus de l’agriculture, elle s’est lancée dans la vente des poissons fumés. Honnête et dynamique malgré son âge, elle a déjà bénéficié et remboursé deux fois de crédit. C’est une femme exemplaire et digne de confiance et mérite d’être soutenue pour accroître ses activités et augmenter ses revenus pour le bien être de la famille. Elle sollicite un crédit de $700 qui va servir à renforcer son commerce de poissons fumés et à faire du stockage de maïs et d’huile rouge. Elle pourra dégager une marge bénéficiaire importante et avoir une autonomie financière.

loans.use: Buying and selling smoked fish, corn and red oil

loans.name: Alphonse

texts.fr:
Mr. Alphonse D. is 35 years old and lives in the village of Avégloédjigan in the prefecture of Vo. With two people to support, he draws his income essentially from providing a service. What he does is go from village to village grating cassava for the local growers. But the mill does not belong to him and he has to make a tally at the end of each day and make do with what is left over. With his experience in this matter, it has become clear that this could be a very profitable activity if the machine belonged to him. He therefore aspires to buying a mill for grating cassava, with which he will improve his income and his quality of life. To do this, he is asking for a loan of $1,200.

Monsieur D. Alphonse est âgé de 35 ans et vit dans le village d’Avégloédjigan dans la préfecture de Vo. Ayant deux (2) personnes en charge, il tire ses revenus essentiellement de ses prestations de services. En effet, il circule de village en village pour râper le manioc aux populations productrices. Mais le moulin ne l’appartient pas et il doit faire le compte à chaque fin de journée et se contente du surplus. Avec son expérience en la matière, il s’est rendu à l’évidence que c’est une activité très rentable si la machine lui appartenait. Ainsi, il aspire à l’achat d’un moulin râpeuse de manioc avec lequel il aura à améliorer son revenu et sa qualité de vie. Pour ce faire, il demande un crédit de $1200.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: To buy a mill for grating cassava

loans.name: Khadijatou

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by the four women of the Mankko group, led by Ms. Khadijiatou D.. In their loan application, the group describe their business as follows:

“Our business is located in the outskirts of Dakar, in the Parcelles Assainies neighborhood. It is composed of an association of women who have been engaged in petty trading for a long time. Our goal is to improve the living conditions of our members, contribute to the well-being of our families, and help the parents in our group to educate their daughters. The business will consist of buying different types of cloth and reselling them in the other towns and regions of Senegal.”

Original French business description:

«Contexte: Le projet se situ dans la banlieue de Dakar plus précisément aux parcelles Assainies. Il regroupe une association de femmes qui s’exercent dans le commerce depuis un bon bout de temps.

Objectifs: Améliorer les conditions de vies des populations composantes le dit groupement; Contribuer à la gestion et à l’entretien des problèmes familiaux; Aider les parents sur la scolarisation des jeunes filles.

Activités: Il s’agit d’acheter des tissus et aller les revendre dans les autres villes et régions du Sénégal.»

Background:

Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, known as tontines. Commonly organized by groups of twenty to thirty housewives who live in the same village, the tontines provide poor women throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these associations are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional tontines from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. The SEM Fund works to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance. Visit our website at www.sem-fund.org to learn more!

loans.use: Purchase of cloth for resale in markets

loans.name: Iqbal's Group

texts.en:
My name is Iqbal B. and I'm from Kot Radha Kishan, a small town in Pakistan. I am married with seven children. I embroider clothes on order and my husband is a farmer. He owns a piece of land where he grows seasonal vegetables. He also owns three cows and sells their milk for additional income. He would like to buy another cow and increase milk production. With the increase in profits, I will collect a dowry for my daughter, who is getting married next year. 
There are other women like me in my neighborhood, who need loans to expand their enterprises. My group members are: Shahnaz B., whose  husband is a cloth merchant; Bashiran B. and her husband, who raise cows and sell their milk to make a living; Sakina B. and her husband, who also sell milk; and Sughran B. whose husband runs a small restaurant where he sells tea and breakfast. We have all taken loans before and repaid them because we are all hardworking people who invest the money back into the business. We are associates who accept the responsibility for each other’s loans.

loans.use: To buy a cow and increase the milk production of the business

loans.name: Malae

texts.en: Malae is a mother of four. She is 45 years old from the village very far from town and married to a man from Ulumasinave. Her business is sewing and painting clothes and lavalava. Her last loan was used to buy a second-hand sewing machine. To improve her business was the reason she applied for another loan.

loans.use: To buy sewing supplies

loans.name: Khafiz

texts.en:
Khafiz S. is 47 years old and married with 5 children. Two of the older children are already married and the other three are still living with their parents.

Khafiz is the only one person supporting this large family as his wife is the housekeeper. He runs a small private café where he cooks and sells kebabs. Khafiz started out fifteen years ago as a kitchen assistant cooking kebabs. Gradually he became so experienced that he decided to open his own small café which has been in business for 10 years already.

Khafiz is planning to expand his café. Thus, he shall need to increase his inventory, by purchasing more plates, dishes and plastic tables and chairs to accommodate his growing number of clients. For all this, Khafiz requests 1800.00 Somoni (US$525) for a term of 12 months. This is Khafiz's first loan. However, since he has a stable business, he would like to assure all that he will be able to pay in time, and to thank everyone for their support.

loans.use: Expanding of business and purchasing of inventory like plates, dishes, plastic tables and chairs

loans.name: Kirangira East B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Shamim K.. She is currently in the business of charcoal selling and is requesting a loan to boost business. Shamim is 27 years old and is married. Her husband is a driver. She has 5 children ranging from age 3 to 11 and her children go to school. Each week, Shamim makes approximately UGX 10000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build better business premises. Shamim has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to add to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Shamim is joined in her small group by Sarah N., Teopista N., Florence B., and Maiza B.. Sarah N. has a business in poultry farming and wants to purchase more chicks and feed. Teopista N. is currently operating a business rearing cows and wants a loan to buy more cows. Florence B. operates a poultry farming business and wants to add more capital. Maiza B. is currently in the business of sugarcane growing and is requesting a loan to purchase more farm supplies to increase output.

loans.use: To increase the quantity of charcoal sold

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana I. H. has a successful business raising and selling chickens in a rural suburb of Pucallpa, Ucayali. Chicken is the most popular food in this tropical region of Peru. Juana has no problem selling her poultry and is always thinking for ways to increase production.

Juana is 42 years old, has 4 children, and is happily married. She loves her business because she can work from home and earn an income. Previously, she did not have much to do and had low self-confidence. She is now more independent and loves building relationships with customers.

A member of the community bank Las Lumbreras, Juana is requesting a loan of s/1500 (US$ 550) to repay over six months. She will use the loan to buy baby chickens and necessary antibiotics.

loans.use: To expand her flock of chickens

loans.name: Euniles's Nyota Njema Group

texts.en:
Eunile is 29 years old and is a married woman with 3 children, ages 8, 6 and 4 years old. Eunile owns a small stock of animals, which she started in 2007. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales.

Eunile now hopes for a loan to buy more animals to increase her stock. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in clothing sales, a beauty salon, a general shop and used clothes sales.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more animals to increase her stock.

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Le Thi S., 43 years old, lives with her husband and their 4 children in Quang Xuong, Thanh Hoa (Vietnam). All of their children are still going to school. Since they live near the sea, Mrs. S.'s husband ís a fisherman, and she is selling the fish at the market. This is the main way to earn income for their family. This job, however, requires not only time and efforts but also money to buy the nets and other fishing equipment. Since Mrs. S. joined TYM Fund (Kiva Partner in Vietnam), she has more money to buy new equipment, and they are able to catch more fish. She uses the profit from her business to buy furniture for their house and pay for her children to go to school. Mrs. S.'s family income is about 200 USD per month. This time she wants to borrow 375 USD to buy nets, preparing fr the coming seaS..

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Lê Thị Sơn, 43 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và 4 người con tại Quảng Xương, Thanh Hóa. Cả 4 người con chị đều đang đi học. Gia đình ở gần biển, anh đi biển, chị bán cá, đây cũng là nguồn thu chính của gia đình. Công việc này ngoài thời gian, công sức còn cần vốn để mua lưới, dụng cụ đánh bắt. Từ khi tham gia Quỹ, chị Sơn có thêm tiền sắm được nhiều đồ nghề mới, việc đánh bắt thuận tiện hơn. Lợi nhuận từ mỗi vòng vốn chị đề dành mua sắm tiện nghi trong gia đình và chi phí cho các con ăn học. Thu nhập bình quân hiện nay của gia đình khoảng 200USD/tháng. Vòng vốn này chị Sơn xin vay 375USD để mua lưới, chuẩn bị cho mùa đánh bắt sứa sắp tới.

loans.use: Buy fishing-net

loans.name: Kuchkor

texts.en:
Kuchkor T. is 45 years old, and is married with 4 children. He loves his children very much and is doing his best to make them happy and give them a good education. Kuchkor runs a farm, and has worked in agriculture for twenty-seven years. In that time he has gained a lot of experience and a love for the land. Kuchkor is a strong physical and spiritual man and each day he works diligently to make sure that he takes good care of his crop. His wife and daughter help him with the business.

Kuchkor sows potatoes, cucumbers, carrots, and tomatoes, which he then sells at the local market. The business is stable and generates the main source of income for the family. However, this business also requires lots of effort. Now that the business is stable, Abduvahob believes that it will be the main income for him in the future as his dearest children are growing up and the expenses are rising. Thus, Kuchkor needs to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer, and he is requesting a loan of US$500. Kuchkor thanks all for supporting him and he promises to be accurate when repaying the loan.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Fuente De Esperanza (Source Of Hope) Group 4

texts.en:
Delfina is the president of the ¨Fuente de Esperanza¨ Bank of Hope and definitely holds sway in her community. She lives in a very poor community surrounded by sugar cane in a rural area outside of El Seibo. Delfina is 77 years old and lives with her husband. She has six children and six grandchildren who now live in the neighboring towns of Higuey and La Romana.

Delfina sells clothing, mainly shirts, to the people in her community. She has successfully repaid two loans to Esperanza International and is now requesting a third. With the loan money, she hopes to open a small ¨colmado¨ (mini grocery-store) at the side of her house.

Note: This is a group loan for 5 people.

loans.use: To open a mini grocery-store at the side of her house.

loans.name: Fidelia Paola

texts.es:
Fidelia Paola is a grocery store clerk at the San Antonio Super. She is 34 years old, married with a 2 1/2 years old girl. She works from 8:00 a.m. until 8:00 p.m. Her niece takes care of her daughter and her only free day during the week is Tuesdays. She has been working for this business for 10 years. She is asking for her 6th loan to repair the floors of her sister's house where she lives and to repair the windows. In the future, she will build her home. She already has purchased the lot with the previous loans. Her husband helps her a little. Fidelia's wish is to be able to apply for a bigger loan in the future to start the construction of her house. She is a very responsible woman. Her previous five loans have been paid properly and on time. She is very satisfied for the courtesy and attention that the personnel of AFODENIC has given her

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

Fidelia Paola trabajadora del Súper San Antonio, con 34 años de edad, casada, con una niña de 2½ años, ella trabaja de 8:00 am a 8:00 pm, su hija se la cuida una sobrina, el único día libre es el martes de cada semana, tiene 10 años de laborar para este lugar. Está solicitando su 6to crédito el que utilizará para embaldozar el piso de la casa de su hermana que es donde ella habita y componer las ventanas, en el futuro construirá su casa pues ya compró el terreno con los créditos anteriores; su esposo le ayuda un poco y su mayor ilusión es en el futuro solicitar un crédito mayor para iniciar la construcción de su vivienda. Es una joven muy responsable, sus 5 créditos los ha cancelado en tiempo y forma, se siente satisfecha por la atención con que ha sido atendida por el personal de AFODENIC.

loans.use: Floor repairs and restoring the windows.

loans.name: Valeria

texts.es: Ordenando su mercadería, encontramos a Valeria, de 55 años, madre preocupa, responsable y trabajadora, desde hace 25 años está dedicada a la venta de prendas de vestir tales como: calcetines,  escarpines, pantalones para niños, caballeros y damas, mercadería que ofrece los días de feria en los distintos pueblitos aledaños a su ciudad natal, Juliaca.Mientras Valeria se dedica a esta actividad, su esposo trata de sacar adelante su carpintería, entre ambos buscan mejorar su calidad de vida, pero el ingreso que obtienen aun no suple completamente  sus gastos familiares, por ello, Valeria desea aumentar y ampliar su negocio, considera que haciendo estas modificaciones podría obtener mayores beneficios económicos, con ese fin solicita este préstamo, dinero que se compromete en retornarlo en un lapso de 6 meses.
texts.en:
Straightening up her inventory, we find Valeria, a 55-year-old responsible, hard-working and concerned mother. For the last 25 years she's made a living selling clothes such as socks, slippers and pants for all ages and sexes, merchandise she offers on markets days in the distinctive towns surrounding her native city, Juliaca. While Valeria dedicates herself to this endeavor, her husband tries to make headway with his carpentry business. Together they work to improve their quality of life, but the money they make sill doesn't cover household expenses. Valeria wants to grow and expand her business, which would help her increase her earnings. With this goal, she's requesting a loan, which she plans to repay within six months.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand business and increase inventory

loans.name: Rindy

texts.en: Mrs. Rindy M., 40, is a widow with six children; two sons and four daughters. Two of her daughters have full time employment and the other four children study in the local school. The family lives along National Road Number Six about twenty Kilometers from Phnom Penh Rindy has been farming since she was young. She grows many types of vegetables in her farmland not so far from home. The main income for her family is from her farm's business and her two daughters' jobs. She is requesting a loan of $700 to build a new staircase, pillars, and repair other parts of her house.

loans.use: Rindy would like to build a new staircase, pillars, and repair other parts of her house.

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
Muhammad A. is 63 years old and married with six children. He lives in Khewa Nangarhar province and is an educated man. He lives in his village and works in agriculture processing, but he doesn't have animals for his land. He is also a regent of Parliament in Khewa. Mr. A. lives in a village and has a big house because he has a very big family.

He says, "I have grassland, but I am buying 50AF ($1 US) of milk every morning." Because of this, he wants to buy his own animals.

"Everyone who lives in the village should have animals for milk and yogurt," he says. For this, he needs 50000AF ($1100US) in individual loans for 27 months.

"We are poor people, but we should pay this money back in a short time. Thanks Kiva and thanks so much to the lenders."

loans.use: To buy livestock for milk and yogurt production.

loans.name: Cinthya

texts.es: Cinthya, de 26 años de edad, es madre de una pequeña de 2 añitos, vive junto a su conviviente, quien siempre le da la mano en sus objetivos. Ella es propietaria de un motocarro, el mismo que es manejado por su pareja, quien se dedica al transporte de pasajeros desde hace 2 años. Esta actividad es de gran beneficio para sus gastos diarios familiares. Le es rentable, ya que ella es la encargada de administrar las ganancias diarias que recibe. Por la gran proliferación de estos vehículos en la selva, tiene que poner mayor esfuerzo para vencer a la competencia. Es la 4ta vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP, demostrando ser puntual con sus créditos anteriores. Cinthya quiere mandar a construir un pequeño garaje para guardar su motocarro, para una mayor seguridad, además mandarlo a reparar para que esté en óptimas  condiciones.
texts.en:
Cinthya is 26 years old and is the mother of a 2 year old little girl. She lives with her partner who always helps her in her objectives. She is the owner of a 3 wheel vehicle, driven by her partner, which they have been using to transport people for the past two years. This activity is of great benefit to their daily household expenses. It is profitable and she is responsible for managing the money they receive daily. Because of the proliferation of this type of business, she has to put in more effort to beat the competition. This is her 4th loan with MFP, and she has shown that she is punctual in making her payments. Cinthya wants to build a small garage for the vehicle for greater security and to perform maintenance on it so that it will be in optimal condition.

Translated from Spanish by Jeanette Chase, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a garage to protect her motorcycle.

loans.name: José

texts.es:
El señor José, tiene 58 años, está casado y tiene 4 hijos, posee una despensa en su domicilio, el negocio lo habilitó hace más de 25 años y es muy conocida su despensa en el barrio, ya que gracias a los préstamos que le otorgó la Fundación Paraguaya pudo surtir  bien su negocio. 
Tiene pensado para este verano ampliar su despensa ya que nó está pudiendo exhibir todas las mercaderías que tiene en stock, por el espacio muy reducido con  que cuenta actualmente dentro de la despensa.  
Don José, dice que es un luchador por lo sacrificado que es éste rubro porque uno trabaja de Lunes a Lunes y no se tiene fin de semana, a parte la atención se inicia desde las 05:00 hs. de la mañana, pero se siente muy contento porque maneja su propio negocio y con esto mantiene los gastos de su familia y también le  permite dar una buena  educación  a sus hijos.
Sus principales clientes son las personas que trabajan en oficinas de  la zona, como así también los chiperos y obreros de la fábrica de cerámicas del barrio a quiénes también les provee de los servicio de comidas y desayunos.
texts.en:
José is 58, married, and has 4 children. He owns a grocery store, which he runs from his home. He opened the business 25 years ago and his store is very well known in the neighbourhood, as he has been able to keep his store well stocked thanks to loans from Fundación Paraguaya. He plans to expand his store this summer as he is not able to display all the merchandise he has in stock, given the limited space in the store as it is now. José tells us he is a fighter who has sacrificed much working 7 days a week and never having a weekend off. He opens at 5 A.M. but he has very happy to be working for himself and thanks to his business he is able to pay the household expenses as well as give his children a good education. His customers are mostly people who work in local offices, as well as chiperos (street vendors who sell a typical cheese bun) and factory workers from the local ceramics factory to whom he provides meals and breakfast.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy meat, sugar, milk, flour, beer, wine, cheese, eggs, starch, vegetable oil, etc.

loans.name: Hidoyatullo

texts.ru: Гулямхусейнов Хидоятулло житель города Турсун-заде. Возраст 47 лет. Женат и имеет четверых детей. Работает таксистом. Имеет свою автомашину , которую и использует в своей работе. Кроме этого  он занимается бизнесом. Торгует овощами и фруктами. Скупает рано утром у дехкан свежие фрукты и овощи , а затем продает розничным торговцам. Для того , чтобы расширять свой бизнес хочет получить кредит сроком на 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Hidoyatullo G. lives in Tursunzade. He is 47 years old, married and has 4 children. He works as a taxi driver, and he uses his personal vehicle to drive clients. In addition, he makes a living selling produce. He buys fresh produce early in the morning from peasants and sells it to retailers. Hidoyatullo would like to get a 10-month loan that would allow expanding his business.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase cah flow

loans.name: Erdenechimeg

texts.en: Erdenechimeg S. is a single mother who lives with her son in her own house in the "ger" district in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. (A ger is a traditional nomadic Mongolian home.) Since she began selling used handbags at Narantuul, the biggest outdoor market in Mongolia, she has bought a place to live and a retail stall at the Narantuul market for her brother. She is one of XacBank's (Kiva's partner microfinance institution in Mongolia) best borrowers, with a sterling credit history for the past five years. Erdenechimeg is a very responsible person. Her goal is to expand her own house. She wants this loan to buy more used handbags and leather bags (used handbags come from South Korea and are sold by the kilogram) to increase her inventory.

loans.use: To buy used handbags and leather bags

loans.name: Mahkam

texts.en:
G. Mahkam is a 49-year-old farmer who lives with his wife and three children. He lives in the northern part of Tajikistan, in Kayrakkum town in the Sugd region. He has two milk cows and sells dairy products to the local and capital traders. He has fifteen years of experience in raising cattle and selling dairy products. The milk products are in very high demand in his village. Mahkam’s orders for these products are very high but the milk his cows give is not enough for the traders, so he decided to apply for a $500 loan to purchase an additional cow and fodder. Mahkam is very grateful to everyone who is helping him to improve his living with this loan.
 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase cattle in order to expand the business

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: Blessing sells cooked foods and she has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell to her customers. She is 50 years old and married with 4 children. She says thanks to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Ma. Fatima

texts.en:
Ma. Fatima operates a sari-sari store (a community-based store) in their village in Marasat Paqueńo, San Mateo, Isabela. She and her husband are blessed to have four children: Carmela, 25, Carlo, 23, Jimmy Mar, 18, and the youngest, Margie, who is 16 years old. Jimmy Mar and Margie are both fourth-year high school students. With the support of Fatima's husband, they are able to provide for the needs of their family and to send their children to school. But they worry that they may not be able to pay for their college education next school-year.

Fatima would like to have additional capital that she can use to buy additional commodities to sell in her store. She is now looking for financial assistance amounting to PHP10, 000.00. She will be very much thankful if her loan will be granted by the lenders, for it will really help her towards the development of her business and to secure the needs of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional commodities to sell in her store.

loans.name: Dina

texts.en: Dina D. is a divorced mother of 3 children who has received no formal education.  She has worked as a fish monger selling smoked fish in Elmina since 2004.  Dina uses her income to pay for her children’s school fees and also her family’s lighting bills. She plans to use the loan to buy and sell larger quantities of fish. With the additional profits from her expanded business, Dina will save and further her children's education.

loans.use: To buy and sell larger quantities fish and grow her business.

loans.name: Hamida

texts.en:
D. Hamida is a married mother of six children. She has a business selling clothing for kids in the market of Dushanbe. Hamida’s business is going well as demand has been very stable over the last 15 years. Hamida is an entrepreneur of high integrity. She is very hard-working and energetic. Even when her competitors have similar products or lower prices, clients naturally gravitate to her as she can skillfully make them feel valued, respected and heard. Hamida is requesting a loan of 5000 Somoni to purchase seasonal clothing which will help her to continue stabilizing her business and income so she can continue to support her children.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and for the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing new clothing for the summer season

loans.name: Lonlon Kégué Group

texts.fr: Cette association  créée en 2008 regroupe 5 femmes dynamiques et un homme du quartier de kégué à Lomé, elle a pour objectif de mettre en commun  la force financière  de ses membres afin d’augmenter leur stock et bien vendre, les membres de l’association sont  mariés et ont des enfants. Les membres de cette association  mènent différentes activités génératrices de revenu comme la vente du jus de fruits, des céréales, de condiments, de produits de beauté et de charbons de bois. Cette association solidaire a une fois bénéficié du crédit et a bien remboursé. Ce deuxième crédit qu’elle sollicite  leur permettrait d’acheter 6 sacs de charbons de bois, 3 sacs de maïs, 1carton de produits de beauté et 3 sachets de condiments. Avec ce nouveau stock elles pourront bien vendre et aider les familles dans les besoins quotidiens.
texts.en:
This association, created in 2008, brings together 5 dynamic women and one man from the Kégué neighborhood in Lomé. Its goal is to use the financial strength of its members to advance the common good, increasing their stock so they can expand their sales volume. The members of the association are married and have children. They earn a living in various ways, selling fruit juice, cereals, condiments, cosmetics, and charcoal.

This solidarity association has received one loan which they have correctly reimbursed. This second loan that they are requesting will permit them to buy 6 sacks of charcoal, 3 sacks of maize, 1 case of cosmetics, and 3 bags of condiments. With this new stock, they will be able to make lots of sales and help their families with daily needs.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of maize, sugar, condiments, bag of "pure water" and various items

loans.name: Syson

texts.en:
Mrs. N. Syson is a promising lady, 30 years old, and married with two children. Her husband is a very hardworking man with a welding shop in Bushenyi trading centre.

Mrs. N. Syson owns a hardware shop located in Kizinda trading centre and she has been performing her business for over three years. She is using the loan to invest in the business by purchasing more hardware. Her future plan is to increase her inventory and to create more employment.

Mrs. N. Syson also owns a banana plantation and sells bananas as a side income. Her future hope for the plantation is to increase its output.

loans.use: To invest in her business by purchasing more hardware

loans.name: Mislima

texts.en:
A. Mislima is 45 year old. She is married and has two chidlren. She owns a specialized fabrics store at the central market in Dushanbe town. Mislima works in a sphere of trade where the demand is always very consistent and high, because the national dresses in Tajikistan are very popular and very important item of the dowry of any girl. She is one of the leading fabric vendors in the market where she works. She is very tenacious and determined in all of her business endeavors, which has helped to sustain her venture for 11 years. Mislima is a skilled entrepreneur. When she started this trade, she decided to implement basic concepts of integrity and hard work in her business to reach ultimate success. This laid a firm foundation for winning results and Mislima has obviously been a successful small entrepreneur. However, she doesn’t want to stop. She would like to continue seeing her venture grow. Today she is requesting a loan of 4000 Somoni to increase her assorted inventory. With your help, Mislima will be able to make her business succeed and support her children with education.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.
