Katty tiene 37 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos en la escuela, es madre soltera, desde el comienzo se a hecho cargo de sus hijos, tiene casa propia actualmente esta sobre el agua, es lo que ha podido comprar con mucho sacrificio del trabajo, su aspiración es que sus hijos estudien y no se queden sin profesión, fortalecer el negocio porque es su única fuente de ingresos, Katty es una mujer trabajadora y responsable lucha cada día por mejorar su calidad de vida.

loans.use: To buy a mill and freezer

loans.name: Jensiama

texts.en: Ohenewa is a client of Kraban Support Foundation. She has benefited from its products for several years. She wants to expand her business. She sells Ghanaian Kentey cloth. She is seeking a loan of $950.00 from Kiva.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase on his onion business

loans.name: Petrona

texts.en: Petrona is 26 years old, single, and living with her parents. Her five brothers and sisters live in Santo Domingo, because they go to the university there. Her parents are farmers. Petrona sells clothes and shoes in her parents’ house. She started that business one year ago after being obliged to drop out of school for financial reasons. Her parents couldn’t provide the transport for her, since she had to spend more than $40 a week to go to school in the city. Currently she is back in school, since she earns sufficient money from her business. The entrepreneur needs a loan to purchase more clothes and shoes, because she has these in short supply. She is working hard to grow her business so as to improve living conditions for herself and her family.

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of clothes and shoes for her business, since these are in short supply

loans.name: Namig

texts.en: M. Namig is a 42-year-old married father of two children. He is a farmer from Fizuli region and he lives with his family in Sumgayit, situated in eastern Azerbaijan. He started his business in 1993, when he purchased one cow with money he had saved. In 2005, Namig borrowed $500 to add to his own savings of $250 and purchased another milk cow. Since January 2006, prices have doubled. He is requesting a loan of  $1,000 to purchase three small bulls and feed for them. He will repay the loan within 12 months. This will help him improve his stock and increase his income.

loans.use: To purchase three small bulls and feed for them

loans.name: Mele

texts.en: Mele is a married woman with 4 kids, living in the village of Saaga Siumu. Her business is a Taro plantation run by her husband. She sells 2-3 bags of taro once a week at Fugalei market, and she gets $80-100 USD. Before joining the program, her family depends only on remittances from overseas. But when she joined SPBD in 2004, she experienced a big change. She can now pay her kids' school fees and a lot family purposes.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her taro plantation

loans.name: Rahmatullo

texts.en:
K. Rahmatullo is 39 years old. He is married with three children and his wife is a housekeeper.

Rahmatullo has been working with IMON for more than three years and has a positive credit history. For more than 12 years he has been running a small open café where he cooks kebabs. His café is located inside the food market of the city. Rahmatullo's children are growing up fast -- his the elder daughter is 16 years old and will enter university this year, while his younger daughter and son are 14 and 12 correspondingly. Rahmatullo needs to prepare a dowry for his elder daughter but unfortunately does not earn enough income for this.

Rahmatullo is requesting a loan of 3000.00 Somoni (US$875) to increase his capital and expand his business, promising to repay the loan in 3 months. Rahmatullo hopes that by being able to generate a good income, he will help his daughter to enter university and will also have the funds for to pay his daughter's dowry and arrange his elder daughter's wedding.

loans.use: To enlarge his working capital and to use the income generated to pay for his daughter's university education and her wedding.

loans.name: Firdos' Group

texts.en: My name is Firdos A.. I am married and have eight children, six boys and two girls. I live with my family in Multan, a mid-sized city in Southern Punjab, a province of Pakistan. One of my sons runs a TV cable agency and we need a loan to expand his business. I am borrowing in a group that includes three other women: Zarina I. runs a boutique. Laiqa N. is borrowing to expand her husband’s auto workshop. Arjaman B. also operates a boutique. These women are poor and need loans to expand their companies. Please help us secure the required amount of our loan and grow our businesses.

loans.use: Expand a TV cable agency and three other small businesses

loans.name: Zebi

texts.en: Zebi N. lives in the Spitamen region, and she is married with three children. She sells her homegrown potatoes wholesale in the collective farm bazaar. Now Mrs. N. is applying for a loan of 2,500 STJ for the seasonal preparation.

loans.use: The seasonal preparation

loans.name: Hubaldo

texts.es:
Mr. Hubaldo S. rents a home on Luís Espinal street in the Chuquiaguillo zone of the city of La Paz. He is legally separated from his wife and owns a car that he uses as a public taxi, generating income this way.

He is requesting a loan in order to purchase tires and repair his vehicle because without these things, he cannot work, this being his only source of income. He would like to leave his car in excellent condition so that he can go back to work as usual.

He has good credit history and qualifies for a new loan. He has been a member of IMPRO since 2006.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Hubaldo vive en alquiler en la calle Luís Espinal de la zona de Chuquiaguillo de la ciudad de La Paz; está separado de la esposa, tiene un auto el cual hace trabajar como taxi de servicio publico generando así sus ingresos de subsistencia.

El crédito que solicita es para comprar llantas y reparar su movilidad ya que con las fallas que tiene no puede trabajar y es su único medio de ingresos. Lo que quiere es poner su taxi en buenas condiciones y trabajar con normalidad.

Su antecedente histórico es bueno y califica para obtener un nuevo crédito. Es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2006.

loans.use: Purchase tires for taxi

loans.name: Rene

texts.es:
Sr. Rene is someone with a great desire to succeed despite his physical disability (he has problems with his lower limbs). He acts responsibly in whatever he does, always fulfils his obligations, and pays off his loans. In spite of his disability, he wants to get on in life so that he can feel useful. Currently he lives in the modest home that belonged to his parents before they died some time ago. He shares the house with his nephews and nieces whom he helps with their studies so that they can have the opportunities that were not available to him.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Rene es una persona con muchos deseos de superación pese a su discapacidad física, ( problemas en las extremidades inferiores) el desarrolla sus actividades con bastante responsabilidad y es muy cumplido con sus obligaciones y en el pago de sus créditos, pese a su discapacidad el quiere seguir adelante para sentirse útil en la vida, el vive actualmente en la casa muy humilde de sus padres quienes fallecieron tiempo atrás, la cual comparte con sus sobrinos a los cuales el les ayuda en sus estudios para que así tengan las posibilidades que el no pudo tener.

loans.use: To purchase wool.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothing wholesale for re-sale in a small, well-established shop

loans.name: Samuel Trust Group

texts.en: Esther S. is a divorced wife with five children. She is a 54-year-old trader of used bed spreads. She is the leader of a seven-member group with six females and a single male. These are the breadwinners of their families. They all have children who are currently in school. They are engaged in the trading of food stuffs, clothing, cosmetics, groceries, etc. as the source of livelihood for their homes. However, they barely make enough income to meet the demands of their households due to inadequate working capital. Their common dream is to see their businesses grow one day to enable them to improve the living conditions of their families. They believe this loan will help them to inject more capital into their businesses to materialize this dream. They belong to the group called Samuel Trust Group. Members in this group agree to guarantee for one another as a social collateral and assist one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase increased stock of food stuffs, groceries, clothes, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Las Rosas Semetabaj Group

texts.en:
The villagers from San Andres Semetabaj breathe the peaceful environment of this small lovely town. Most of the villagers know each other very well which creates an environment of trust. Walking down the clean streets of San Andres one can see many people chatting and children playing. This is a typical village where people help each other out with their daily tasks. 
Fortunately, this cultural factor is also reflected in Las Rosas´ organization. Some members of the group are better doing the paperwork and arrange the meetings, whereas others have more acquaintances that can help the younger ones of the group to sell their products to a bigger group of customers.
This is how Doña Manuela C., who is one of oldest of the group, helps the younger members. She has a store in one of the main streets at which she sells traditional blouses. Doña Manuela is very well known in the village because of her store. When a customer asks her about clothes she doesn't sell in her store, she refers them to group members like Ami. Ami is one of the younger members of the group. She also sells blouses, but from a different type, they are called croshet blouses, they have a very different look from the traditional ones.
Alma G. is the president of the group. She has a sister in another group who enthusiastically told her about Friendship Bridge. Alma, formed a group with her friends and neighbours who, like her, mostly work in buying and selling clothes. 
They all want to invest their credit in purchasing a more diverse repertoire of clothes. The other four women, who own a food store, also want to expand the diversity of products in order to capture more clients and increase their sales. 
Las Rosas want to keep working hard in order to keep building their new improved life. They wish to have a solid business so they don't have to leave their families behind in order to go and sell their goods at far away markets. That's why they try to communicate well to one another about their business ideas so they are not over-supply San Andres with the same goods, says Catalina. 
 Las Rosas are doing a great job a working together and accomplishing unity within their trust bank, with your support they will keep working in this manner and accomplishing their dreams. Thanks!

loans.use: Invest in the store itself and a bigger range of products

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es: Maruja es una joven madre de 26 años de edad, la actividad que aprendió de sus padres le permite cubrir las necesidades  básicas  de su hogar,  sobre todo  la de su pequeña y querida niña Nayel de un añito, su trabajo como artesana textil se convirtió en el sustento principal de su hogar, ya que su esposo tiene trabajos  eventuales  y poco remunerados.Con el dinero que solicita, esta talentosa madre tiene pensado comprar variedad de lana para seguir confeccionando sus pantalones, chullos y  diferentes prendas, que serán vendidas al por mayor en el mercado San José de la ciudad de Juliaca.
texts.en:
Maruja is a young mother, 26 years old. The trade that she learned from her parents has allowed her to cover the basic needs of her household, especially the needs of her dear, little girl, Nayel who is one year old. Her work as a textile artisan became the main means of support of her home. Her husband has occasional jobs who are poorly compensated. With the loan that she is applying for, this talented mother will buy a variety of wool to continue making pants, sweaters, and different clothing pieces that will be sold at wholesale at the San Jose market in the city of Juliaca


Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the quantity of wool and other materials to continue making her pieces.

loans.name: Haidarali

texts.ru: Азизов Хайдарали житель Джиликульского района. Возраст 24 года. Имеет двоих детей. Обеспечивает семью путем торговли. Торгует на центральном рынке.Привозит товар из города Душанбе, который покупает у оптовых реализаторов. Привозит товар к себе и продает в розницу. Его бизнес приносит доход ему лично, а так же население , покупая  у него товар выигрывает в том , что им не приходится ехать за покупками в город Душанбе и тратить деньги на дорогу. Планирует получить кредит для того , чтобы завезти сезонный товар. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Haidarali A. lives in the Jillikuli region. He is 24 years old and has two children. Haidarali provides for his family by selling goods at the central market. He purchases clothes from wholesalers in Dushanbe and brings them to his region where they can be sold for a profit. Haidarali's business is beneficial not only to him but to other people in the region who don't need to spend money traveling to Dushanbe in order to buy clothes. Haidarali would like to take out this loan in order to buy more seasonal goods wholesale. He will be able to pay back the loan in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seasonal goods wholesale

loans.name: Ticana Gaspar

texts.pt:
Ticana nasceu em Manhiça, tem 41 anos de idade estudou ata a 8ª classe vive maritalmente é mãe de 5 filhos com idades compriendidas entre os 29 aos 22 anos, 3 dos seus filhos estão na universidade e os restantes estão empregados.
 Ticana após de concluir a 8ª classe  teve que interroper os estudos  devido a má condiçao financeira dos pais. Sai de Manhiça para Marracuene  com o seu esposo em emisão de serviço este que era Director da agricultura daquele Distrito e governou durante 5 anos. Ticana porque tinha um bom nivel de escolaridade o administrador convida-lhe para trabalhar como secretaria particular dele dois anos depois  o seu esposo é  transferido para  trabalhar em Namaacha uma vila na fronteira de Swazilandia e assim abandona o seu emprego.. Chegado a Namaacha ticana pede emprestado um valor a sua  irma mais velha e começa a praticar negócio de criaçao de pintos  com ajuda do seu esposo que é tecnico agrónomo uma actividade que exerce ate hoje. Além de ser uma  grande criadora de frangos é dona de uma barraca de refeiçoes, mas porque os pintos precisam de muita atençao ela não tem horario fixo de trabalho, tem criado no maximo 5x100 caixas de pintos a 35.000.00mt e revende cada a 85.00mt  cria em fases para poder   vender alternadamente. Tem como melhor produto o frango já preparado que vende em sua barraca tem tido um lucro de 4.000.00mt mensalmente consegue poupar por mês 500.00mt porque tem que pagar dispesas dos seus filhos que se encontram a estudar na universidade, uma vez que o seu marido teve problrmas no seviço e perdeu o emprego.
Este é o segundo empréstimo de Ticana  na hluvuku e primeiro no kiva. O primeiro de 15.000.00mt usou para comprar pintos, conseguiu pagar sem nenhuma dificuldade e pede este segundo de 12.000.00mt para reforcar o seu negocio . Esta confiante que vai desembolsar antes do prazo e pedir outro emprestimo para a construcao do murro da sua residencia.
texts.en:
Ticana was born in Manhiça. She is 41 years old and attended school until the 8th grade. She is married and the mother of 5 children between the ages of 22 and 29. Three of her children are in college, and the others are working. After finishing the 8th grade Ticana had to interrupt her studies due to the poor financial conditions of her parents. She left Manhiça for Marracuene with her husband who served as the Director of Agriculture in that district for 5 years. Because she had a good level of schooling, Ticana was invited by the administrator to work as his secretary. Two years later her husband was transferred to work in Namaacha, a town on the border of Swaziland, so she abandoned her job. Having arrived in Namaacha Ticana got a loan from her oldest sister and began her business of raising chickens with the help of her husband who is an expert agronomist; an activity that they continue today. Besides being a great chicken farmer she is also owner of a food shack, but because the chicks require a lot of attention she does not have fixed hours of work. She makes at a maximum 5X100 boxes of chickens at 35MT and resells each one for 85MT. She raises them in phases to be able to sell alternatingly. Her best product is a ready-prepared chicken that she sells from her stand. She makes 4,000MT per month but is only able to save 500MT because she has to pay expenses for her children who are studying at the university, and her husband had problems in the service and lost his job. This is Ticana's second loan with Hluvuku and her first with Kiva. The first loan of 15,000MT was used to purchase chickens and she was able to repay without any difficulties. She is requesting this second loan of 12,000MT to reinforce her business. She is confidant that she can pay off the loan before maturity so she can ask for another loan to construct a wall around her residence.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising chickens

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es comerciante de revistas para colorear y pequeños libros para niños de 3 a 7 años de edad; tiene su puesto en la Ceja de El Alto. Esta actividad es su fuente de ingreso con la que cubre la manutención de sus tres hijos que depende de ella y la mayor de 15 años ayuda con otro puesto de venta en la misma ciudad de El Alto. La familia vive en casa alquilada ubicada en la Zona Loreto de la Misma Ciudad.
 
El préstamo lo destinará para la compra más revistas y libros durante las fiestas de fin de año y mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
 
Es primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica a María para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado.
texts.en:
Maria sells coloring books and small books for children between 3 and 7 years old at her stall in La Ceja, El Alto. This is the source of income with which she keeps her three dependent sons, the oldest of whom at age 15 helps with another stall, also in El Alto. The family lives in a rented house in the Loreto area of the city.

She will use the loan to buy more coloring and children's books at the end-of-year fair to increase her income.

This is Maria's first loan with Impro, which she has been approved to receive.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Stilgoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of more coloring and children's books for her business

loans.name: Mrs. Dalin Pich Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Eighteen people who live in Phum Thmey village in Kampong Chhnang province have formed a village bank group and are requesting a loan for a variety of purposes. Mrs. Dalin P. is the village bank group president. She is a farmer who earns a small rice farming revenue which cannot support the famiL. very well. Her husband, Mr. Hem Sambo, is an immigrant worker in Korea, working in a garment factory. Mrs. Dalin P. is 32 years old and the mother of five children, four are attending the local school while the youngest one is two years old. Although Mrs. Dalin P.'s famiL. members work hard, they still do not have enough money to build a fence for her house. Mrs. Dalin P. decided to ask for a loan to buy wood to build the fence for her house.

This is a village bank group loan consisting of mainL. end-of-term loans. Thirteen members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthL. payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financialL. able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of onL. 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% at Kiva.

loans.use: To buy wood to build a fence for her house.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 24-year-old man, living in Al Chwaifat in Mount Lebanon. Mohammad has owned an electrical equipment maintenance shop in his village for seven years. Mohammad wants to buy more inventory in order to satisfy his clientele's needs and to increase his profits. He is requesting a loan of $1000.

loans.use: Buy Inventory

loans.name: Seng

texts.en: Seng T. is 59 years old and has a business selling grocery items to the people in the community to earn about US$ 3 in profit every day. She has one child and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province. Her husband is a farmer who grows and sells vegetables at the market to earn approximately US$ 1.50 in profit per day. Her child is a worker and makes US$ 2 a day. She would like request a loan of US$ 300 to expand her grocery store by adding more goods to meet her customers’ demands.

loans.use: supplies for grocery store

loans.name: Muraa

texts.en:
Muraa F. is currently in the business of selling bread and is requesting a loan to expand her business. She is thirty years old. Her husband is a businessman. She has four children and they all go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to initiate an agricultural farm for a banana plantation. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: intiate an agricultural farm for a banana plantation

loans.name: Las Limonarias Group

texts.es:
Las integrantes del grupo Las limonarias son originarias de la comarca Belén del municipio de Los Altos, Tisma, son personas conocidas por su actividad y honorabilidad, tienen diferentes ocupaciones. Doña María Teresa vende quesillos en el mercado de Masaya, doña Ivaqnia del Socorro vende ropa al crédito y doña María Esperanza vende frutas y perduras en el mercado de Masaya.
Ellas son mujeres trabajadoras, están muy comprometidas en sus pagos para siempre tener créditos con Adim.

Doña Ivania es la coordinadora del grupo, es una joven mujer de 25 años de edad,es comerciante ropa en su comunidad, la vende al crédito y sus clientes le hacen muchos encargos, compra en el mercado de Masaya  los días martes y jueves, los demás días vende en la comarca, aprovecha las tardes para hacer su trabajo ya que por la mañana atiende a sus dos hijos pequeños de 2 y 4 años.
Su esposo le ayuda con los gastos, es zapatero y trabaja en Masaya en un taller de calzado.
Inició su negocio para ser independiente con su dinero y comprar lo que cree conveniente, esto hizo que ella pudiera decidir en todo en el hogar, está muy contenta porque además comparte con sus compañeras otras actividades, ella inició la formación del grupo y como han engrandecido un poco sus negocios está muy satisfecha también por sus compañera que junto con ella clasificaron para obtener el crédito con Adim.
texts.en:
The members of the group Las limonarias are from the Belén region in the municipality of Los Altos, Tisma. They are people known for their activity and integrity and they all have different occupations. Doña María Teresa sells cheese in the market of Masaya, doña Ivaqnia del Socorro sells clothing on credit and doña María Esperanza sells fruits and vegetables in the market of Masaya. They are hard working women who are very engaged in their payments so they always have loans with Adim. Doña Ivania is the group coordinator. She is a young woman, age 25 who sells clothing in her community. She sells the clothing on credit and her clients make many orders, buying in the market of Masaya on Tuesdays and Thursdays. The other days she sells in the region, taking advantage of the afternoons to do her work and in the morning she cares for her two small sons, ages 2 and 4. Her husband helps her with the expenses. He is a shoemaker and works in Masaya in a footwear workshop. She began her business to be independent with her money and to buy what she thinks is advisable. This means that she is able to decide on everything in the home. She's very content because she shares with her group members other activities. She began the formation of the group and has seen how their businesses have improved a little. She's very satisfied also because her group has qualified for a loan with Adim.

Translated from Spanish by Julie Lutz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Resources for work

loans.name: Tojiniso

texts.ru: Точинисо - женщина 59 лет. Вдова. Мать 5-х детей. У нее большой опыт торговли тканями. В основном она продает национальные ткани, потому, что потребность в национальных платьях очень большая, как городских женщин, так и сельских. Все женщины имеют в своём гардеробе национальные платья. Они очень красивые и очень идут таджикским девушкам и женщинам. Точинисо привозит свой товар из города Дубая Арабских Эмиратов. За один год кредитования в нашей организации, Точинисо увеличила ассортимент своего товара. Теперь у нее больше клиентов. Но она старается еще больше привозить товар, и сдавать оптом розничным торговцам. Последний кредит она потратит именно на это.
texts.en:
Tojiniso is a 59 year old woman. She is a widow and the mother of 5 children. She has a lot of experience selling fabrics. Mostly she sells traditional fabrics, because demand for traditional dresses is very high, both among city women and rural women. All women have traditional dresses in their wardrobe. They are very beautiful and look god on Tajik girls and women. Tojiniso brings her products from Dubai in the Arab Emirates. After one year of borrowing from our organization, Tojiniso increased her product assortment. Now she has more customers. But she tries even more to bring her products and to sell it in wholesale quantities to retail sellers. She plans to use her last loan precisely for this.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabrics for sale

loans.name: Souleymane

texts.fr:
Monsieur Souleymane S. est un homme marié de 30 ans et père de 2 enfants qui vit avec sa femme et ses enfants dans une famille monogame dans le quartier Torakabougou de la ville de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas fréquenté le système scolaire, très vite il commença les activités économiques notamment les travaux journaliers auprès des maçons, les travaux champêtres et le berger. Aucune de ces activités ne lui ont réussie. C’est ainsi qu’il décida de mener l’activité  d’achat et de vente d’articles  divers  de  boutique. Il fît ses premiers pas  auprès de son grand frère, commerçant  spécialisé dans le commerce général. Avec une expérience de 5 ans, Monsieur Souleymane S. maîtrise bien les tenants et aboutissants du commerce d’articles divers dans lequel il est très sollicité au niveau de la ville de Bougouni.
Monsieur Souleymane S., dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin de sa clientèle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son premier prêt individuel.
 Il s’approvisionne à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali) auprès des grossistes et effectue sa vente dans sa boutique avec une clientèle composée de toutes les catégories sociales.
Avec ce prêt, Monsieur Souleymane S. compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 32 500 FCFA qui servira à rembourser les intérêts du prêt et agrandir sa boutique .
texts.en:
Mr. Souleymane S. is a 30 year old married man and the father of two children. He and his wife are monogamous and live with their children in the Torakabougou quarter in the city of Bougouni (in the 3rd administrative region in the Republic of Mali). Not having gone through the education system, he quickly began trying to make a living, namely daily work with masons, shepherding and other jobs in the countryside. None of these activities succeeded for him. Thus, he decided to take up the purchase and sale of various shop items. He took his first steps into the business with his older brother, a specialized merchant in general commerce. With five years’ experience, Mr. Souleymane S. has well mastered the holding of, and resulting business from these various products, which are very sought after in Bougouni. Mr. Souleymane S., concerned with satisfying the needs of his clientele, decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution with whom it will be his first individual loan. He operates in Bamako (the capital of Mali) alongside wholesalers and makes sales in his store to a clientele composed of every social class. With his loan, Mr. Souleymane S. counts on coming to earn a monthly income of 32 500 FCFA which will serve to pay back the interest payments of the loan and to expand his store.

Translated from French by Laura Buhler, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sales of various items for his shop.

loans.name: Reine

texts.fr: Cette dame est une résidente du quartier de Zanguéra, un quartier  de la ville de Lomé, depuis la mort de son mari elle a la charge de ses 02 enfants, l’activité qu’elle exerce est la vente de volailles plus précisément les poules. Elle fait ce commerce depuis 2001, ce qui fait qu’elle maîtrise ce secteur d’activité. En période de fête, elle vend plus et réalise de bons chiffres d’affaire. Les poules dont elle dispose actuellement ne lui permettent pas de satisfaire sa clientèle raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 80 poules de race différentes.
texts.en:
This lady is a resident of the Zanguéra district, a neighborhood of the city of Lomé. Since the death of her husband, she is solely responsible for their 2 children. Her business is selling hens. She has been in this business since 2001, so she is very familiar with it. During holiday periods, she sells more and has a good turnover. The hens she presently has will not permit her to satisfy the needs of her clientele, which is why she has asked WAGES for a loan to buy 80 chickens of various breeds.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of hens for re-sale

loans.name: Raya

texts.en:
Raya M. is married and her husband is an entrepreneur. She has two children, who are the source of her inspiration and drive as she wants to give them a better life so that they can study and do well for themselves.

Raya started her grocery store six years ago to help her husband out financially. She started off with a few products, but her business has grown as she has many frequent clients.

Raya would like a loan of $1,200 to buy merchandise so that she can offer a wider variety of products and so that her business can grow. Her clients are always asking her for new things.

Raya and her family thank you very much for your support, which means that her business can grow and she can fulfill her goal of providing for her family.

loans.use: To buy merchandise so that she can offer a wider variety of products

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en: Mr. M. Godfrey has a retail or grocery shop at Mbarara old taxi park. He is using the loan to increase the stock in his shop by buying retail items such as cooking oil, shoe polish, dry cells, soap, salt, maize flour, sandals, etc. He intends to increase his stock and hopes to open up another branch for his grocery. He has been operating the business for over six years. He has six children; four of them are in school.

loans.use: To increase his stock

loans.name: Quyen's Group

texts.en:
Quyên Thị Nguyễn was born in 1965. (no: 010117020004). She lives in Kinh No village, Uy No commune with her husband, two children and parents-in-law. Her main job is farming. She raises geese and chickens. Her husband is a construction worker. She has a monthly income of about 3.000.000 VND. She has engaged in financial microfinance for three years. She needs 7.194.000 VND to buy food for the chickens. There are four other Fund participants in her group:
 Tình Thị Bùi was born in 1980. (no: 010117020003). She has two children. She has a store at home. She wants to borrow 4.142.000 VND to buy goods to resell.
 Hiệu Thị Ngô was born in 1961. (no: 010117020001). She has two children. She raises chickens. She wants to borrow 5.450.000 VND to breed pigs and poultry.
 Sơn Thị Tạ was born in 1974. (no: 010117020005). She has four children. Every day she buys dross to resell. She wants to borrow 6.322.000 VND to buy more dross.
 Hiền Thị Lê was born in 1969. (no: 010117020006).She has two children. She sells fruit in the market. She needs 4.578.000 VND to buy many other fruits.

loans.use: To buy feed for her chickens

loans.name: Rufina

texts.es:
Rufina es socia del Banco Comunal Bienestar II.
Rufina es casada, tiene 43 años y 4 hijos, Rufina viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde vende panes, frutas, abarrotes y de las ferias compra cereales, queso, carne, productos que vende en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Rufina necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cereales.
Los sueños de Rufina son construir una casa de material noble y vender sus productos en la ciudad de Lima.
texts.en:
Rufina is a member of the Bienstar II Communal Bank. She is 43 years old, married, and has 4 children. She travels to different regional fairs to sell bread, fruit and groceries. While at the fairs, she purchases grain, cheese, meat and other products which are then sold in the city markets of Ayacucho.

Rufina needs a loan of 900 soles to buy grain. She dreams of constructing a house made of solid materials and selling her products in the city of Lima.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase grain

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Mrs. Anecita D. is 53 years old, married with 3 adult children, and living in barangay Ma-ao Barrio, Bago City, Negros Occidental.

Anecita grew up knowing that being in business for oneself is not an easy task - it requires a lot of hard work, long hours, discipline and enthusiasm even when things are not going as well as you'd hoped, but it could also comfortably support a family if managed well. So when her parents who previously owned the farm supplies store she now operates decided to pass on the business to her, she had mixed feelings - excited because it had the potential of providing a steady income, enough to support her family, and at the same time she was doubtful that she could make a go of it, especially as she did not have the necessary working capital to buy stock for resale.

So when a friend told her about NWTF-Project Dungganon, she grabbed the opportunity to join and gain access to a credit line that she badly needed to make her business survive. She also admits that the discipline of paying back her loans made her realize the importance and value of good financial management.

Now on her 12th cycle loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Anecita is borrowing PHP 10,000 to enable her to buy more stock for resale in her farm supplies shop.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than $1/day to realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To buy stock for her farm supplies shop.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 50, married and has four sons and two daughters who are all in school. She works very hard to support her husband to provide for the family. they live in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. Mary is a trader who trades in secondhand textiles – clothes for unisex, bed sheets, etc. She hawks and treks to sell in other communities. She procures bales of secondhand textiles from Accra. She has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy secondhand textiles

loans.name: Godelive

texts.en:
Godelive M. is a widow, 41 years old, and she takes care of four children aged between 12 and 6.

Godelive has been selling for fifteen years by working from 8:00 a.m. to 11:00 p.m. She is requesting her first loan from Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding her business through purchasing more goods in order to earn more profit than before. With that profit, Godelive hopes to pay school fees and get more food for her family.

Through accessing this new loan, Godelive has a hope for the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell

loans.name: Abimael Jhon

texts.es:
Abimael es socia del Banco Comunal Pueblo Libre que significa Nuestra Fuerza en quechua.
Abimael es soltera, tiene 20 años y vive con sus padres, Abimael tiene un carro con el cual realiza transporte de pasajeros a la comunidad de Mollepata, además en algunas oportunidades vende abarrotes junto a sus padres en diferentes pueblos.
Abimael necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la reparación de su carro.
Los sueños de abimael son tener casa propia, comprar otro carro y estudiar topografía.

loans.use: Para la reparación de su carro.

loans.name: Dolapo

texts.en:
Dolapo is a 35-year-old married woman with four children. She lives in Oyo State, Nigeria.

To earn a living, she sells various foods, such as steamed beans and bean cakes. She is now requesting a loan in the amount of N100,000 ($675) to increase her inventory; specifically, she would like to purchase additional beans, oil, and eggs. She thanks all Kiva lenders for their continued support.

loans.use: To expand her inventory by purchasing additional items (e.g., beans, oil, and eggs)

loans.name: Prayer Is The Key Group

texts.en:
Salomey is 50 years old, married and has five children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Kade, a farming/commercial town in the Eastern Region of Ghana. She is a trader who runs a cold store.

Salomey (pictured middle) is the leader of a trust bank group called "Prayer is the key". Most of the group members are involved in trading activities. The group members are requesting a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand their businesses. It is their desire to give their children the best education they can afford.

loans.use: To buy goods in bulk

loans.name: Floride

texts.en:
Floride is a 43-year-old widow with four children aged between 4 and 16. In addition, she has two dependents from another family whom she cares for. Floride lives in Western Province of Rwanda, which is approximately three hours drive from Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda.

Floride sells potatoes to customers throughout her community. This is only her second year in this business but she is fairing well so far. She puts in long hours although she is not able to specify the exact time: she explains that she works from early in the morning until late in the evening every day, five days a week.

Floride is requesting a loan from Vision Finance Company and Kiva lenders in order to purchase a greater quantity of potatoes at better prices which she expects will help her to increase her monthly profit. With some extra profit, she will be able to reinvest in her small, growing business. With the remaining profit, she will continue to provide more and better food for her children and dependents as well as putting away a little bit of money for their future.

loans.use: To purchase more potatoes at better prices

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
La señora Hilda  es socia del Banco Comunal “3 de Mayo” desde hace 4 años, del distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno. Tiene 23 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo. Cuenta con estudios secundarios completos y se dedica a la venta de cereales y carne.
Hilda nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar su capital.
Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 2200.00 con el cual podrá comprar más mercadería como: chuño, papa, habas, cebada, carne.
Su sueño para el futuro es tener su casa en Ilave.
Lo que màs le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los ahorros que ganarà y las actividades con las promotoras.
texts.en:
Hilda has been a member of the Community Bank "3 de Mayo" for 4 years. in the district of Llave, province of El Collao, department of Puno. She is 23 years old, lives with her partner and has one child. She completed secondary studies and now makes a living by selling cereals and meats.

Hilda tells us that, with the first loan she obtained through the Manuela Ramos Movement, which was for S/. 300.00 new soles, she was able to increase her capital. Now, she's requesting a loan of S/. 2,200.00 new soles with which she will be able to purchase more merchandise, such as potato flower, potatoes, beans, barley and meat.

Her dream for the future is to have a house in Llave. As for the Community Bank, she is very fond of the money she will earn through savings as well as the promotional activities they offer.


Translated from Spanish by Joseph Mulligan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of potato flower, potatoes, barley, beans, meat

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena A. is from the village of Lobogon. She is 40 years old, is married and has three school-aged children.

Elena owns and operates a motorcycle transport business, providing motorcycle transport services to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Elena joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. 

Elena is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in her business. This loan will be her first from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.


About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in her business

loans.name: Ulan

texts.ru: Бобоева Улан проживает в районе Хуросон. Возраст, 46 лет. Замужем, имеет 4 детей. Имеет среднее образование. Бобоева Улан работает более чем 14 лет в области торговли. Она покупает товар и продает в своей торговой точке. Кредит берет для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Ulan B., 46, lives in the Khuroson region and has 4 children. She has a secondary education. For more than 14 years she's been a vendor, buying merchandise to sell from her stand. She plans to use her loan to increase sales.

Translated from Russian by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase sales

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn V. is 46 years old. She is married to Mr. Emeterio V., who is a fisherman. The couple has an only child, Diane Camile, who is a 15-year-old high school student.

Since her husband's income is not enough to sustain the daily needs of their family, she joined ASHI in 2007 because she wanted to have an expanded business and get closer to the fulfillment of their dreams.

She and her husband aim to continue to develop a stable business so they can support the education of their daughter and have their own big home. Now on her fourth loan, she is seeking 20,000.00 Philippine pesos. The loan funds will be specifically used to pay for one motor boat, a bubo (shrimp catcher), one sack of fish feed and two rolls of rope for her fishing business.

She hopes to have a successful business, dreams for a brighter tomorrow and to be away from the ties of poverty.

loans.use: Pay for one motor boat, a bubo (shrimp catcher), a sack of fish feed and two rolls of rope for her fishing business

loans.name: Siguidolo Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe  Siguidolo, 4 toutes mariées,  ont en moyenne  30 ans, 2 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à Konobougou une des sous préfectures de Ségou (quatrième région  administrative de la république).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  de la restauration et le commerce d’articles divers tels l’achat vente de poissons fumé et séché, de fruits et légumes et des condiments alimentaires.
Ces femmes du groupe Siguidolo  sont à leur premier prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter, des  paquets de condiments alimentaires, des paniers de fruits et légumes et des ingrédients pour la restauration.
Elles s’approvisionnent  généralement à Bamako (capitale du Mali), Mopti et sur place à Konobougou. Elles  effectuent leurs ventes au marché de Konobougou ville et dans les foires environnantes, au comptant, en détail et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20.000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the group Siguidolo (all four are married) average 30 years of age and two children each.  They all live in traditional extended families in Konobougou, a sub-prefecture of Ségou (4th administrative region of the republic).  These women know one another through ties of kinship. They work in food service and do commerce in a variety of goods, such as smoked and dried fish, fruit and vegetables, and condiments. The group members are on their first solidarity loan, which will be used to buy packs of condiments, baskets of fruit and vegetables, and some ingredients for food catering.  Supplies are generally procured in Bamako (capital of Mali), in Mopti, and locally in Konobougou.  Sales are made at the Konobougou City market and at the surrounding fairs.  Cash or credit is accepted at the retail level from customers composed of women and men.  The group members each envision making an average monthly profit of 20,000 francs CFA that will be used for expenses related to healthcare, food, and schooling costs.  The rest will be reinvested into the businesses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying a variety of goods

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 33 years old and married with one child. He has been running a retail shop for four years where he sells sugar, rice, flour, and other items. Previously, he was an employee at an industrial company, but now he concentrates on his shop. Since he became a member of Faulu, he has started saving his money. He hopes to expand his business to become a wholesale shop. As a hardworking man, he also dreams of having a bright future. He has requested a loan of 50,000 KES to increase his stock of sugar, rice, flour, salt, and other products for his shop.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, flour, salt, and other products for his shop.

loans.name: Deisy Virginia

texts.es:
Deisy tiene 27 años de edad ella vive con su mama la señora Francisca L. y su hermano que tiene Síndrome de Down, ellos viven en Esquilan Chico al sud Carretera a Quillacollo que es una provincia de Cochabamba.

Deisy es una muchacha trabajadora que se dedica  a producción de leche y la elaboración de quesillo junto con su madre, ella trabaja desde que era una niña colaborando para ayudar en la educación de su hermano ya que en nuestro país es algo ignorado las personas que tienen síndrome de Down son personas rechazadas a las cuales no les brinda la atención para poderlos ayudar a salir adelante ya que los centros de ayuda son en la ciudad los cuales se les hace muy lejos para la doña Francisca el poderle llevar y que le ayuden a su hijo es por esa razón que Deisy tuvo que dejar la escuela y poder trabajar para ayudar a su madre porque el papa murió en un accidente de tránsito en la cual ellos quedaron solos y la madre de Deisy es una persona ya mayor y ella tiene que hacerse cargo de su hermano como también de madre al ser la única responsable de su familia y tratarle de ayudar  ella es una persona que le duele el haberlo dejado la escuela porque ella soñaba con estudiar  medicina para saber el porqué su hermano tenía ese problema la situación en la cual se encuentra Deisy es muy triste porque ella tiene que ser la responsable de su hermano.

Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de soya para poder aumentar la producción de leche y la elaboración de quesillo y teniendo más ingresos podrá ofrecerle a su familia un mejor nivel de vida y seguir con el apoyo constante a su hermano y  tal vez en un futuro ella tiene la esperanza de terminar el colegio ella no sueña con tener su propia familia porque no quiere que le lastimen a su hermano ella lo quiere mucho porque él es un muchacho muy tierno y ayuda en la casa con las vacas y a veces se va a cortar alfa con su madre a quien quiere mucho y no la deja sola.
texts.en:
Deisy is 27 years old. She lives with her mother, Francisca L., and her brother, who has Down syndrome. They live in Esquilan Chico to the south of the road to Quillacollo, which is a province in Cochabamba. Deisy is a hard-working girl, who devotes herself to milk production and making “quesillo” (soft cheese) with her mother. She has worked since she was a girl. She was contributing in order to help with her brother’s education. In our country it is ignored. People with Down syndrome are rejected. They are not offered the help they need to get ahead. The help centers are in the city. It is very far for Francisca to be able to take him there for help. That is the reason that Deisy had to leave school to be able to work to help her mother. Her father died in a transit accident, and they were left alone. Deisy’s mother is elderly. Deisy has to be in charge of her brother, like a mother, as she is the only responsible person in her family. She tries to help him. It hurts her to have left school because she dreamed of studying medicine in order to know why her brother has this problem. Deisy is very sad to be in this situation because she has to be responsible for her brother. She is requesting a loan to buy soy in order to be able to increase the milk production and the making of quesillo. Having more income will allow her to offer her family a better standard of living and to keep up her constant support of her brother. She hopes that in the future she might be able to finish school. She does not dream of having her own family because she does not want to hurt her brother. She loves him a lot because he is a very affectionate boy. He helps at home with the cows, and sometimes he goes to cut alfalfa with their mother. He loves her a lot and does not leave her alone.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy food for dairy cows (soy)

loans.name: Kemi

texts.en: Kemi sells food and grocery items to make a living. With this business, she hopes to make more profits. She loves this business because of the opportunity it gives her to interact with her customers. She hopes to grow her business to become bigger and stronger. She is requesting for a loan amount of NGN100,000 to purchase more food and grocery items to sell. She is 40 years old, married, and has 4 children. Her children attend school and this gives her joy as a mother. Her husband also works to supports their home. She hopes to pull her family and business from poverty. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more food and groceries to sell.

loans.name: Marly Sofia

texts.es:
Marly Sofía R. Martínez, tiene 41 años vive en el barrio Soledad 2000;  está casada, tiene un hijo de 6 años de edad, y se dedica al negocio de las confecciones de pijamas, multiusos, edredones y bolsos desde hace 12 años; con él fin de tener mayor diversidad en su oferta y ampliar su mercado solicita un crédito por valor de $1.500.000, con el que comprará materiales para la confección, como correderas, telas y forros. 
A Marly le ha ido muy bien pues cuando hace 12 años inició su actividad de confecciones, lo hizo  produciendo solo bolsos, y gradualmente aprendió a elaborar multiusos edredones y pijamas, teniendo que comprar   una  fletadora para este tipo de confección  y luego fue agregando otras tres máquinas.  Ella desde que comenzó con la Fundación, ha visto mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales y así mismo en la microempresa aumentó la producción, reflejada en una mayor infraestructura en sus equipos. Su sueño es continuar ampliando su negocio, para que sea lo suficientemente grande para comercializar sus  productos en otras plazas de la Costa Caribe. Entre sus desafíos está el de sostenerse siempre vigente y con salud para conseguir sus sueños.
texts.en:
Marly Sofía R. Martínez is 41 years old. She lives in the Soledad 2000 neighborhood. She’s married, has a 6-year old child, and has worked in a business sewing pajamas, multi-purpose comforters and bags for 12 years. With the goal of having more diversity in her offerings and growing her market, she is requesting a loan of $1,500,000.00, with which she will buy materials for sewing, such as carriages, thread and lining.

Marly has been doing very well. When she began her business 12 years ago, she was producing only bags. Gradually, she learned to make multi-purpose comforters and pajamas. She has to buy a special tool for this type of sewing, and later she added three more machines. Since she has begun with the Fundación, she has improved her living conditions and augmented the production in her small business, reflecting a better infrastructure in her teams. Her dream is to continue growing her business, so that it will be big enough to sell her products in other plazas along the Caribbean Coast. Amongst her challenges is to always be effective and healthy to achieve her dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials for sewing, such as carriages, thread and lining.

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es:
María Eugenia es socia del Banco Comunal Nuevo Amanecer en el sector rural de la ciudad de Montecristi en la provincia de Manabí.

Ella esta casada tiene 27 años y tiene 3 niños, están pequeños aun, el esposo trabaja en una fábrica de pescado, tiene una tienda desde hace 3 años, de a poco empezó con pocas cosas, además vende bisutería, bebidas, ha podido comprarse una  refrigeradora, quiere incrementar su negocio por eso está solicitando este nuevo crédito , le ha ido muy bien trabajando con la Fundación  desea poder tener su tienda mas surtida, decidió invertir en este negocio una vez que dejo de trabajar en una fábrica de pescado cuando salió embarazada de su tercer bebe, además la ubicación de su tienda es muy estratégica está en la vía principal.

La señora María Eugenia tiene que saber compartir el tiempo para atender a sus hijos que están pequeños y entrar a estudiar este año y tiene que trabajar más, desea que la situación económica mejore.
En estos momentos ella vive en casa de su mamá, y su mayor sueño es tener su propia casa para poder brindarles una mejor comodidad a sus hijos.
texts.en:
María Eugenia is a member of the Nuevo Amanecer (New Dawn) commual bank in a rural area of the city of Montecristi, Manabí province. She is 27 years old, married and has three young children. Her husband works in a fish processing factory. She has had a small general store for the last three years. She started out selling just a few items and also sells novelties and beverages. She has manged to buy herself a refrigerator. She is asking for new funds to enlarge her store. She has done very well working with the Foundation and wants to have a better-stocked store. When she became pregnant with her third child she decided to stop working at the fish processing plant and invest in her own business. Her store is strategically located on the main street. Maria Eugenia knows that she must divide her time among caring for her children who are still little and enrolling in school; she as to work more because she wants her economic situation to improve. She currently lives in her mother’s house and her greatest wish is to have her own home to provide her children with more comfort.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy novelties, beverages and food items.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
Cesar es un padre de familia de 39 años de edad que vive junto a sus esposa y a sus tes hijos en el distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz, un distrito conocido por ser el mas poblado de la región, pero también por tener los más altos indices de pobreza, posee además bastante movimiento comercial ya que en el se encuentra situado el mercado mayorista de la región.

Se dedica desde hace seis años aproximadamente a la venta de verdura y limones en el mercado del distrito de Ciudad Eten, el negocio le ha permitido agenciarse de un ingreso estable con el cual sostener a su familia, todos los dias el adquiere sus productos en el mercado mayorista y luego se dirige a su centro de labores, el negocio tiene una clientela fija gracias a su esfuerzo, ya que siempre trata de brindar productos de buena calidad y un trato cálido a sus clientes.

Cesar desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas limones y verduras, de modo que su negocio crezca y que el volumen de sus ventas aumente. Además el comenta que empezará a vender limones y verduras a cevicherías y restaurantes de la zona. Para lograr su objetivo el se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles.

Cesar es un padre de familia bastante trabajador y responsable, su anhelo es poder brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida, el ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado ser un cliente puntual y responsable al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Cesar is a father of 39 years old. He lives together with his wife and their 3 children in the José Leonardo Ortiz district, a district known as the most populated in the region, but also as having the highest poverty levels. There is also a lot of commercial movement as the wholesale market for the region is situated here too. For approximately 6 years Cesar has sold vegetables and limes in the market in Ciudad Eten market. The business has permitted him to manage to obtain a stable income with which he sustains his family. Every day he acquires his products in the wholesale market and later goes to his work place. His business has a reliable customer base thanks to his hard work, as he has always tried to provide good quality products and give his customers hot deals. Cesar wants to expand his business by purchasing more limes and vegetables, so that his business and sales volumes grow. Cesar tells us that he has also begun selling limes and vegetables to the ceviche cafes and restaurants in the zone. To achieve his objective he is seeking a loan of 800 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa. Cesar is the father of a responsible and hard-working family. His dream is to be able to give his family a better quality of life. He has worked with this institution previously and has demonstrated to be a punctual and responsible client in making his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase limes and vegetables

loans.name: Feruzahon's Group

texts.en:
Life obstacles and difficulties make people stronger and wiser. They give us the experience which later helps us improve our lives and make a better living. The heroes of our story also regard the difficulties in life just as good practical lessons for the future and definite steps toward a better life. 

Feruzahon M. is the leader of this group. She is forty-two and has four children. One of her children is disabled. He has a disability of the 3rd degree. Her husband is in Russia at the moment. He has gone there in search of a job. To provide for the family, Feruzahon tends a cow and a calf and is occupied with farming. Her eldest daughter works as a seamstress and thus helps her mother to meet their daily needs.  

Due to cattle breeding, farming, and her husband’s support they have been able to build a new house. Recently they have even managed to repair three rooms. Feruzahon is planning to marry off her daughter and provide her disabled son with a good treatment. But to achieve all this she needs to save sufficient funds. Therefore, Feruzahon has decided to apply for this loan to buy a cow to raise. 

Halidahon M., 46, is a mother of three children. Her eldest son is a baker and her daughter is a seamstress. Halidahon’s husband works as a private builder. Currently Halidahon is engaged in the repair of their house. She needs this loan to finish the repair and prepare for her son’s wedding. 

Odina A., 47, is a farmer. She used to grow wheat in the past, but now she grows potatoes and sunflowers. As for her husband, he is working in Russia. Odina has two children. Now, she needs a loan to purchase mineral fertilizers for potatoes and sunflowers. 

Halimahon I., 48, is divorced. She is looking after her old mother and her two children. To provide for the family, Halimahon is engaged in cattle breeding and also works as a nurse. She hopes to obtain this loan and purchase three sheep for fattening and resale. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: to purchase a cow for breeding

loans.name: Herinques Paulo

texts.pt:
Henrique Paulo M. nasceu no Distrito de Macia, Província de Gaza, sul de Moçambique, casado e pai de 3 filhos de 12, 8 e 2 anos de idade, os dois mais velhos vão a escola. Frequenta a escola na Universidade Pedagógica. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e  não sustenta mais ninguém para alem da sua famila.
Saiu de Gaza para Maputo atrás de emprego, mais tarde decidiu fixar sua residência e formar uma família. Trabalha como docente ha mais de 8 anos e é do quadro Ministério da Educação. Tem um salário de 4.500.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de colegas que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 16.500.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, chapas de zinco e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua residência. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para concluir e mobilar a sua casa oferecendo melhores condições de habitabilidade a sua família.
texts.en:
Henrique Paulo M. was born in the District of Macia, Gaza Province, in southern Mozambique. He is married and the father of 3 children ages 12, 8, and 2. The two older children attend school. He attends classes at the Teachers University. He lives in his own home and does not support anyone other than his family. He left Gaza for Maputo in search of work. Later, he decided to establish residence there and start a family. He has been working as a teacher for more than 8 years, and is part of the Ministry of Education. He has a monthly salary of 4.500.00mt, which he uses for household expenses and saves a bit in his bank account. He has never had a loan in other banks. He learned about Hluvuku through colleagues who are also clients of this institution. This is his first loan, in the amount of 16,500.00mt, which he plans to use to purchase construction material (cement, zinc panels, etc.) to continue construction of his home. He promises to pay back the loan on schedule in order to have access to future loans. In the future he plans to request additional loans to complete and equip his home, in order to provide better living conditions to his family.

Translated from Portuguese by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of construction mateiral (cement, zinc panels, etc.)

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a dedicated member and chairman of Thoth Ber Self Help Group which is being funded by Juhudi Kilimo. He is a farmer from Kisii town, in Western Kenya. He has been farming for 38 years and produces kales (a type of cabbage), maize, groundnuts and beans, which he sells to schools and the local market.

Michael is 63 years old. He is married and has 6 children who are all adults. Apart from farming, he is also employed by Kenya Lake Field.
He has requested this loan, from Juhudi Kilimo, of KES 45,000 to purchase and insure a dairy cow. This loan will increase the family's income hence improve their lifestyle. He believes that with hard work and more financial help he will expand his business and increase his income.

He is grateful to Juhudi for the loan that he has been given.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Kuy

texts.en:
Kuy S., 41, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. S. is employed at a garment factory for an income of $2.60 per day. Her husband is a motorbike repairman and dealer, earning an income of $2.60 per day. 

S. is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase used motorbikes for resale. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy used motorbikes to resell

loans.name: Hermenegilda

texts.en:
Hermenegilda F. is a married woman who lives in Barangay Pasil, Santander, Cebu. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures:  pig fattening and an ice cream vending businesses. Her husband, Melchor F., who is 36 years old, works as a tricycle driver to earn his living. They have 3 children who between 9 mos. and 9 yrs. old.

Hermenegilda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 16 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Hermenegilda has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 6000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 17th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 15000, which she intends to use to purchase piglets to raise and the feed needed to raise them. She also intends to use some of the money as revolving funds for her ice cream business so that she can continue to save up for the education of her children. Hermenegilda F. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase pigs and feed.

loans.name: Hamza

texts.en: Hamza is a 30 year old married man and the father of one child. Hamza has worked in car services for 11 years, dealing with all electric car maintenance. He opened his own garage in 2002, and he is proud of what he has accomplished. Hamza is an expert in airconditioner maintenance, therefore many people visit him from far away places. Hamza is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua to buy a special KEYMAKE machine, which is used to program keys for new cars. Competition is a major problem for him. Hamza’s dream is to open a showroom for new cars.

loans.use: To buy a special KEYMAKE machine.

loans.name: Porfirio Antonio

texts.es: Porfirio es un padre de familia que tiene 4 hijos y la felicidad de tener trillizas y un hijo varón lo cual lo hace muy feliz al lado de su cónyuge; con su familia vive en la Ciudadela 20 de Julio, barrio al sur de Barranquilla, donde se combinas las actividades productivas y comerciales, con el futbol y muchos  escenarios recreativos integrados a la comunidad, entre conjuntos residenciales multifamiliares, viviendas individuales y sobre todo mucha música con sonido compartidatido. Este es el ambiente  donde Porfirio tiene el negocio de preparar y vender comidas rápidas como salchipapas, perros calientes, chorizos, hamburguesas y carnes, que inició desde el año 1997  y desde entonces solo descansa los jueves y tiene un horario de 4:00 P.m. hasta las  3:00 P.m del día siguiente. Su actividad genera 3 empleos y es muy competida, pero aprovecha la afluencia de público de la competencia, para hacerle una oferta con elementos diferenciadores como son los componentes que utiliza en la preparación de sus comidas,, las deliciosas salsas  y el código de higiene que mantiene permanentemente. Desde hace tres años está vinculado a la Fundación Santo Domingo y con esta organización ha logrado mejorar su liquidez, aumentar las ventas y utilidades y sobre todo seguir educando a sus hijos. En la actualidad solicita  su credikiva que es su tercer crédito, pues planea comprar insumos para las comidas rápidas en un mayor volumen y de contado, como salsa y tambien refrigerios, porque desde ya está preparándose para las fiestas que se avecinan como la del amor y la amistad y aun las decembrinas. Su sueño es tener una casa propia para su familia y ver sus hijos convertidos en profesionales y ubicados laboralmente.
texts.en:
Porfiro has four children. He has the joy of having triplets and a son. Together with his wife, this makes him very happy. He lives with his family in the Ciudadela 20 de Julio, a neighborhood south of Barranquilla. That is where productive and commercial activities are combined with soccer and many other recreational settings. These are integrated in the community among groups of multi-family residences and individual houses. Above all, there is a lot of music that is shared. It is in this environment that Porfiro has his business. He prepares and sells food like “salchipapas” (fried potato and sausages), hot dogs, sausages, hamburgers and meats. He started in 1997, and since then he only rests on Thursdays. His schedule is from 4:00 p.m. until 3:00 p.m. the following day. He has three employees, and his business is very competitive. He takes advantage of the competition’s flow of people by offering different ingredients to prepare his food, delicious salsas, and a code of hygiene that is always maintained. He has been with the Fundación Santo Domingo for three years. With this organization he has managed to improve his liquidity, increase his sales and profits, and, above all, continue to educate his children. He is currently requesting a Kiva loan, which is his third loan. He plans to buy supplies to make his fast food, like salsa and snacks, in greater volume and for cash. He is preparing for the approaching holidays like Valentine’s Day and the December holidays. His dream is to have his own house for his family. He also dreams of seeing his children become professionals with jobs.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a greater volume of supplies for fast foods, salsas, and snacks

loans.name: Chixacol Group

texts.es: Don Felipe S. Chún, es Casado, cursó el segundo grado de primaria, tiene cinco hijos tres de ellos casado dos van a la escuela, uno en básico y uno  en la primaria, él se dedica al  servicio, (Tienda de consumo diario), tiene 25 años ya con este negocio. Contando con entusiasmo y la ayuda de algunas vecinas organizan un grupo, el grupo solidario se denomina Chixacol, cuenta con cinco integrantes mujeres 2, Hombres 3 quienes se dedican  especialmente al comercio, uno de ellos se dedica al servicio.  El préstamo que solicitan es para la ampliación de capital así incrementan el volumen de ventas. Por tal razón se acercaron a las oficinas de la ASOCIACION DE ASDIR  ubicado en el paraje Pologuá, Momostenango  para solicitar un préstamo de esa manera podrán surtir sus mercaderías.
texts.en:
Don Felipe S. Chún is married and completed elementary school through the second grade. He has five children, three are married and the other two are in school. One is attending basic (middle) school while the other is in elementary school. Don Felipe earns a living by selling daily consumer products. He has a store that he has managed for 25 years.

With enthusiasm and the help of some of his neighbors, Felipe was able to organize a solidarity group called “Chixacol”. The group consists of five members, two women and three men. Most of them engage in retail businesses, but one has a business in the service sector. The loan they are requesting will be used to expand their capital so that they can increase their sales volumes. For this reason, they visited the offices of Asociación ASDIR in Pologuá Momostenango to request a loan for buying merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to buy merchandise

loans.name: Annabel

texts.en:
Annabel L. is from the village of Linabu, Balingasag, Misamis Oriental. She is 29 years old. Annabel is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Annabel owns & operates a business providing tri-sikad or pedicab services, with her husband as the driver, to local community members. Annabel has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Annabel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Annabel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed for the maintenance to provide service. Annabel is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding or starting a new business like a sari-sari store. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Annabel from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding or starting a new business like a sari-sari store.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en:
Candelaria is a member of the Communal Bank "The Pink Women" located in the district of Ilave, in the province of El Collao in the department of Puno. She is 30 years old and in a common law marriage with one child. She has completed primary school.

Candelaria has worked with the field partner Manuela Ramos for four years. The first loan she got was for 300 PEN which she used to increase the capital for her business of growing and fattening livestock such as cows and sheep. Candelaria is now asking for a loan of 1,500 PEN which she will use to increase the capital of her business. 

Candelaria’s dream is to be a businesswoman for vacas lecheras (dairy cows), and to have a distributor for cheese and yogurt. The thing she likes most about working with the Communal Bank is that she is very happy when she can share ideas and joke with the other women. She is also happy that she is able to rely on the Communal Bank and that it is located so close to her community.

loans.use: To improve increase her livestock business

loans.name: Flores De Las Lomas Group

texts.es: El grupo las flores de Loma Alta está integrado por 3 personas,  mujeres casadas,  con hijos originarias de la localidad, ellas se dedican a la venta y cultivo de variedad de flores que se da en este país, como rosas, crisantemos, chastas, gerberas, gladiolas,  ellas tienen deseo de  seguir invirtiendo en la compra y cosecha de de flores ya que en estas fechas, por la celebración del día de los santos  es cuando tienen más demanda y requieren de mucho capital, y sobre todo poder aprovechar la temporada y así mismo prepararse para la temporada navideña, entre sus sueños es seguir manteniéndose en el negocio en la cual ya llevan varios años, por heredad de negocio, con la cual apoyan a sus esposos económicamente y se sienten con entusiasmo para seguir  perseverando y alcanzar sus sueños, como familia.
texts.en:
The Las Flores de Loma Alta (Flowers of Loma Alta) has three members.  They are married women with children from the location.  

They grow a variety of flowers common to this country, like roses, chrysanthemums, daisies, gerberas and gladioli, to sell.  They want to continue investing in the purchase and harvesting of flowers which in this season, because of the celebration of All Saints Day, is when they are most in demand.  They also need capital to take advantage of the season and to prepare for the Christmas season.
