Among their dreams is to stay in business; they have already been in it for several years, having inherited it.  The business allows them to help their husbands economically and they are enthusiastic about persevering and reaching their family goals.

loans.use: For flower sales.

loans.name: Jenny  Eliana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “GRANITO DE MOSTAZA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Jenny; ella tiene 43 años de edad, separada y tiene 1 hijo; La socia se dedica a la compra y venta de productos de belleza, la socia es consultora de la línea Avon , Esika, a la vez la socia se dedica a la venta de plantas ,vendiendo a sus amistades. 

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar más productos de belleza como cremas, shampus, perfumes entre otros.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Jenny is a member of the “Granito de Mostaza” (Mustard Seed) community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Jenny is 43 years old.  She is separated and has one child.  She buys and sells Avon and Esika beauty products.  She also sells plants.  She sells to her friends.

She is requesting this loan to buy more beauty products such as creams, shampoos and perfumes.

She is grateful to those who will take part in her dream by funding her loan and pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy more beauty products such as creams, shampoos, perfumes, etc.

loans.name: Sembradoras Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal “SEMBRADORAS” iniciará su  primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, en el Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes.  La mesa directiva está compuesta por la presidenta, tesorera y secretaria de actas. Los negocios que ellas desempeñan son variados: tres señoras son comerciantes de queso, una tiene una heladería, dos señoras venden verduras, una vende ropa de segunda mano, uno es ayudante de una fábrica de ladrillo y una fabrica ladrillos.

En el caso de la presidenta, señora Nora esta casada es madre de cinco hijos, tiene el negocio de venta de Queso desde hace diez años, realiza sus ventas en la Ciudad de La Paz y en la Ciudad de El Alto.   Ella compra el queso de la provincia Ingavi y de la localidad de Viacha.   Ha elegido este negocio por que ha evidenciado que se recupera el capital con facilidad y la ganancia es considerable. Actualmente sus hijos le ayudan en la venta de los quesos.
texts.en:
The community bank "Sembradoras" will start its first loan cycle with field partner Pro Mujer at the Regional Office in Villa Exaltacion. This group is made up of eight members. The board is composed of the president, treasurer and recording secretary. They have a variety of businesses: three women sell cheese, one has an ice cream parlor, two women sell vegetables, one sells second-hand clothes, one is an assistant in a brick factory and one makes bricks. 

Nora, the president, is a married mother of five children and has had her business selling cheese for ten years. She makes her sales in the city of La Paz and the city of El Alto. She buys the cheese from the province of Ingavi and the town Viacha. She chose this business because she has seen that she can recover capital easily and her profits are considerable. Currently her children help with her cheese sales.

loans.use: Purchase cheese.

loans.name: Luz's Group

texts.en:
Luz T. is from the village of Luzon, Cabatuan, Isabela. She is 45 years old. Luz is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Luz is married and has 2 children. To make a living, Luz owns & operates a business venture making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. Luz has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 2300 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Luz joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luz is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Luz from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ephantus Sandika

texts.en:
Ephantus Sandika M. is 52 years old, married to Evagerine and they have four children. Ephantus has been in the carving business for the last 13 years. He has been carving sculptures for sale in a semi permanent premise in Nyali, Mombasa and has been doing well.



This marks Ephantus' second loan from KADET, and he plans to purchase more art materials for carving the sculptures. 


He hopes to direct the anticipated profits to his children’s school fees.His dream is to own a permanent business premise where he can make, display and sell his wares.

loans.use: To purchase more art materials for carving

loans.name: Zebogul

texts.en:
Zebogul sells macaroni, sugar, tea, and sweets in a local market of Kurgantyube, Southern Tajikistan. Her small vending kiosk is located very favorably in a nice part of the marketplace busy with potential customers. Zebogul launched this business 9 years ago. Her business can boast high profitability. Foodstuffs always sell well in any season and are always in high demand among customers. Zebogul is dreaming about growing her business and eventually opening a grocery store. She is requesting a loan of 7,000 Somoni to increase her turnover capital.   
  
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Expanding store inventory

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald M. is from the village of Siari. He is 47 years old. Ronald is married with three children. To make a living, Ronald owns and operates a sari-sari store. He also sells gasoline in his store by the liter. Ronald has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Ronald joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. Ronald is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to add to his working capital. This will be the second loan taken out by Ronald from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For additional capital to buy products to sell

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.en:
Forty-eight-year-old Rodolfo grows rice to earn a living. He tills his own farm located in the town of Banga, South Cotabato. He is the provider in his family so he works hard to improve his business and earnings. He also dreams to be a successful entrepreneur someday.

Rodolfo needs seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. He requested a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos, which he will use to buy what he needs. Rodolfo likes CEVI's program and its insurance services.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Silvia Lorena

texts.es:
Silvia de 29 años de edad, reside en El Transito departamento de San Miguel, posee una panadería, vive con sus padres y es madre soltera de un hijo de 4 años de edad, él depende económicamente de Silvia.
El negocio comenzó con el apoyo de sus padres, la panadería la tiene instalada en su propia casa, tiene 14 empleados, no tiene un horario fijo de trabajo y necesita de un préstamo para invertir en la panadería, comprando harina, sal, azúcar todo al por mayor, esta compra le será de mucha ayuda porque tendrá los materiales necesarios para la ejecución del trabajo y realizar el pan.
El objetivo de Silvia es mejorar su producción, aumentarla y que aumente la clientela, con este avance las condiciones de vida de ella y su familia serán más estables.
texts.en:
Silvia, 29, lives in El Transito, San Miguel department.  She has a bakery.  She lives with her parents and is a single mother of a 4-year-old son who depends economically on her.

The business started with help from her parents.  The bakery is located in her house.  She has 14 employees.  She does not have a fixed work schedule and needs the loan to invest in the bakery buying flour, salt and sugar at wholesale.  This purchase will be of much help because she’ll have all the necessary materials to do the work and make bread.

Silvia’s objective is to improve production, increase it and get more customers.  This advance will lead to improved, more stable living conditions for her and her family.

loans.use: To buy flour, salt and sugar at wholesale.

loans.name: Lay

texts.en:
Lay K. is a 57-year-old widowed villager who lives in the Kompong Cham province. She is the mother of two children, one of whom is married and the other one is single. Her husband died of senility years ago. 

She is a local farmer who has been planting a variety of crops for years. She also relies on income from her daughter, who is a sewing worker. 

Lay K. has planned to open a small grocery kiosk near her house for selling a few items, but she doesn’t have enough money to do that. To achieve her goal, she would like to ask for a loan from Kiva’s partner HKL in order to purchase some essential goods for running her grocery business. This will allow her to increase her income to ensure that her entire family can attain a good standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase some essential goods for running her grocery business.

loans.name: Dennys Daniel

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Managua. El  Sr. Dennis M. Rivas, se dedica  arduamente a laborar como agente de seguridad interna, dedicándose a esta labor desde hace diez años, es casado y con dos hijos a los que tiene que proporcionarles las condiciones necesarias para que se desarrollen.
Una de las necesidades que el  Sr. Dennis atraviesa hoy en dia es que debe mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda debido a que ha estado en malas condiciones por lo que a tomado la sabia decisión de iniciar la obra de mejora. Es por ese motivo que acude a ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción como: bloque, cemento, hierro y arena, Para realizar la mejora de  la vivienda realizando  el cambio de una pared de su casa de habitación la cual se encuentra en mal estado. 
Por medio de esta obra brindara mejores condiciones de vida a sus hijos. Es importante destacar que por medio de la realización de esta obra, le proporcionara a su familia un techo digno donde vivir y con todas las condiciones necesarias para el desarrollo de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Dennys M. R.works in Managua as an internal security officer and has been in this line of work for ten years. He is married with two children, for whom he needs to provide the necessary conditions for their growth.

One thing that Dennis needs is to make housing improvements, as his house has been in poor condition. This is why he has made a wise decision to begin the project. As a result, he is turning to CEPRODEL to request a loan for the purchase of construction materials like blocks, cement, iron and sand. For the project, he will change a wall of his house which is in poor condition.

As a result of this project, he will provide his children with better living conditions. It is important to note that through this project, he will provide his family with a decent roof under which to live and all of the necessary conditions for his children’s growth.

loans.use: to buy construction materials like blocks, cement, iron and sand.

loans.name: Cielito

texts.es:
La señora Cielito G., vive en la comunidad de San Francisco Tlachichilpa, es casada y tiene 4 hijos, 3 estudian la escuela primaria, su esposo es comerciante, vende fruta y verdura en el mercado del pueblo.

Ella y su familia viven en casa de su suegra, y ahora está solicitando un préstamo para su negocio de cría de animales, ésta actividad la realiza desde hace varios años, ella nos comenta: "yo quiero progresar mas y tener mas animales para que tenga mejor rendimiento en el dinero", ella espera tener una buena inversión en los borregos y en los pollos para cuando los venda tenga mas ganancias que antes, ella compra los borregos para que se puedan multiplicar y así pueda brindar a su familia todo lo que necesitan y los pueda beneficiar. Ella espera ayudar a su esposo para que pronto puedan tener una casa propia. "Quiero hacer ahorros para darle dinero a mi esposo y acabar nuestra casa".
texts.en:
Ms. Cielito Garcia lives in the community of San Francisco Tlachichilpa. She is married and has 4 children, 3 of whom are in primary school. Her husband is a merchant and sells fruit and vegetables in the town market.

She and her family live in the house of her mother-in-law, and is now asking for a loan for her animal care business. She has been doing this work for a few years and tells us "I want to be able to progress and have more animals in order to make more money." She hopes to make a good investment in lambs and chickens so that when they are sold they will be worth more than before. She buys lambs so that when they reproduce, she will be able to bring her family everything that they need and thus will benefit from the sale. She hopes to help her husband so that they can soon have their own house. She says, "I want to save to be able to give money to my husband and buy our own home."

loans.use: To buy sheep and chickens to raise.

loans.name: Dolores Alejandra

texts.es: Dolores Alejandra se dedica a la compra de mercadería en general. Tiene 31 años de tener esta actividad. Aprendió este medio de vida por la necesidad de sufragar los gastos de su hogar, Dolores tiene la necesidad de conseguir un trabajo que le brindara el sustento de su familia. Ofrece diferentes productos  como bolsos, calzado, ropa en general, perfumes, tratamientos, prendas y sabanas,  ya tiene mucha clientela pues su carisma y buen servicio atrae a las personas del lugar. Ella solicita este crédito para la compra de materia prima como  sabanas, calzado, perfumes, tratamientos, delantales, ropa interior, bolsos, prendas y otros productos.
texts.en:
Dolores Alejandra buys assorted merchandise.  She’s had this business for 31 years.  She learned this way of life because she needed to cover household expenses.  Dolores needs to find a job that will provide support for her family.  

She sells a variety of different products like: purses, footwear, clothing in general, perfume, hair treatments, items of clothing and bed sheets.  She has a lot of customers because her charisma and good service attracts locals.  

She is asking for this loan to buy stock merchandise like: bed sheets, footwear, perfume, hair treatments, aprons, underwear, purses, clothing items and other products.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 54 years old and has six children. She is married and two of her children are in school. Marilyn is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Marilyn requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Marilyn has been raising pigs for 15 years now, and has borrowed 16 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Kanze

texts.en:
Kanze is a married woman with 8 children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past 4 years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. Kanze dreams of expanding and establishing a retail shop in the future. 

With the KSHS 80,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, rice and beans. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, rice and beans.

loans.name: Yevgeniya

texts.en:
Yevgeniya is married and has two teenage sons. She runs a small vending business selling household items, books, office supplies, souvenirs and gift sets in a local marketplace of Kamenka. Yevgeniya has been in this business for 11 years. Her family has been actively helping her run the venture. Presently, Yevgeniya has already about 80,000 Grivnyas invested in merchandise. Her income amounts to 10,000 Grivnyas. 

Yevgeniya is seeking a loan of 10,000 Grivnyas to purchase additional supplies for seasonal trade. She is hoping to stock her merchandise on inflatable toys, air mattresses, balls, rubber rings, as well as a variety of greeting cards and puzzles. One of her main goals is to continue investing in her enterprise, seeing it grow and develop even more.

loans.use: to purchase inflatable toys and office supplies for summer season trade.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Ana Maria tiene 30 años, su actividad económica es la venta de ropa y productos omnilife. Este no es el primer financiamiento que ella ha realizado con Fundación León 2000, pues estos han sido de gran apoyo. Pues ella es una persona muy ejemplar que disfruta su negocio y además que siempre ha trabajado, ella tiene muchos clientes por lo que tiene una diversidad de encargos, por lo que está muy acostumbrada a realizar este tipo de trabajos. Es por este motivo que ella solicita este financiamiento que es destinado para capital de trabajo y comprar pantalones, camisas, faldas, trajes, entre otras.  Su deseo es mantener activo su negocio que es su único medio de vida.
texts.en: Ana María, 30, sells clothes and Omnilife products.  This isn’t her first loan with con Fundación León 2000 because they have been of great help to her.  She is an exemplary person who enjoys her business and has always worked.  She has many customers which mean quite a diversity of pending orders which makes her quite accustomed to this type of work.  Because of this, she’s asking for a loan that will be destined to working capital to buy pants, shirts, skirts and suits, among others.  Her wish is to keep her business active since it’s her only source of livelihood.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, skirts and suits, among others.

loans.name: Fabiano

texts.en:
Fabiano is 45 years old and married with four school-aged children who all attend school. He has been practicing farming for the last five years in his hometown of Nkubu in eastern Kenya. His farm produces french beans, bananas and milk, which he sells to Homegrown company and through middlemen. He earns additional income from his business of selling shoes to the local market.

Fabiano has made a loan request of 80,000Kes in order to cultivate his banana farm. He says that the income that will be realized from this project will enable him pay school fees for his children and improve his family's livelihood. His primary challenges have been lack of enough water for irrigation and lack of stable markets for farm produce. In the future, he plans to buy his own car for the purpose of transporting his farm produce to the market.

loans.use: to cultivate his banana farm.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman with seven children. Five of her children attend school and two are still too young for school. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a restaurant business. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. She faces the major challenge of perishable food products leading to losses. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the KSHS 20,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar.

loans.name: Bosco

texts.en:
Bosco is a thirty-eight-year-old married man with five children who owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. 

He has been operating a retail shop for five years which he started with 500,000 shillings. He now has 3,000,000 shillings as his working capital. His hardship is the lack of enough capital to purchase the desired goods; his vision is opening another shop plus educating his children. 

Bosco intends to use the loan to buy sugar and rice for reselling.

loans.use: To buy sugar and rice for reselling.

loans.name: Clementino

texts.es:
El señor Clementino tiene 39 años de edad, está casado con Blanca de 30 años, vive en su casa propia. Es chapista y pintor hace más de cinco años y su esposa es artesana, ella fabrica sobrecamas que después es comercializado a los vendedores de la zona. Blanca ayuda con sus ingresos a solventar los gastos del hogar.
Clementino aprendió el oficio de su tío con quién estuvo trabajando varios años, después viajó a la Argentina a trabajar y fue allí donde conoció a su señora. Después de varios años regresaron con un capital ahorrado para comprar sus herramientas necesarias y habilitar su propio local en su domicilio.
Actualmente está trabajando con él un primo a quien le enseña el oficio y le remunera por el mismo. En la actualidad cuenta con clientela formada por la buena atención y la calidad de su servicio.
Don Clementino solicita el crédito para la compra de materia prima, como por ejemplo pinturas, insumo necesario para su profesión. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le brinda.
texts.en:
Clementino, 39, is married to Blanca, 30.  He lives in his own house.  He’s been an auto detailer and painter for over five years and his wife’s a craftsperson, she manufactures bedspreads that are later sold to local vendors.  Blanca helps cover household expenses with her income.

Clementino learned his occupation from his uncle that he worked with for several years.  He then traveled to Argentina to work and that’s where he met his wife.  After several years they returned with some capital they had saved up to buy the necessary tools to set up their own home-based shop.

At present, he’s working with a cousin that he’s teaching the occupation to and that he pays a salary to as well.  He currently has a well-established clientele thanks to the good service and quality of his work.

Clementino is asking for the loan to buy raw materials, like paint for example, that’s a necessary ingredient for his profession.  He thanks the Fundación for the opportunity it provides for him.

loans.use: to buy paint.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fish to sell and thread for making fishing nets.

loans.name: Donata Amparo

texts.es:
Donata nació en la provincia del Cusco. Actualmente, Donata tiene 56 años de edad, es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene tres hijos. 

Donata vive en la misma ciudad donde nació y donde realiza sus actividades económicas, ella se dedica a elaboración de pasteles, tortas, bocaditos y otras cosas más, ella tiene un pequeño taller donde está equipada con las necesidades básicas. Ya son 22 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. 

En esta oportunidad Donata requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo harina, azúcar, leche, huevos, mantequilla, frutas, cocoa y otras cosas más.  
 
El Banco Comunal “Comuzone IV” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Donata was born in Cusco Province.  Currently, she’s 56 years old, married and has three children.  Donata lives in the same city where she was born and where she carries out her economic activities.  She makes cakes, pastries, snacks and other things to sell.  She has a small workshop where she has all the basic equipment.  She’s been in business 22 years and does very well.

On this occasion, Donata needs the loan to buy merchandise like flour, sugar, milk, eggs, butter, fruit, cocoa and other things.

The “Comuzone IV” communal bank meets monthly in the city of Cusco (Perú).  Cusco is known for being a very touristy, commercial area as well as for its traditional “Inti Raymi” festival and also because one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machupicchu, is here.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, milk, eggs, butter, fruit, cocoa and others.

loans.name: Yakutai's Group

texts.en:
Yakutai is the leader of this group. She is 55 and, together with her husband, has raised two sons. Her older son is a dentist and her younger son works in Russia. Yakutai works as a bookkeeper. Eleven years ago, she got a bull-calf as a present from her dad and since then she has been breeding livestock. At the moment she keeps four sheep. 

Yakutai is requesting a loan to purchase livestock. In the future, with the profits gained from reselling livestock, she wants to purchase furniture and improve her family's living conditions.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan.
 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more plastics, rubber, flasks and food containers.

loans.name: Jimelita

texts.en:
Jimelita is 62 years old, married, and has five children. She lives in Poblacion, Panaon, Misamis Occidental.

Jimelita sells nutritious snacks to earn a living and has had this business for five years. She is requesting a loan for 8,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase flour for her snack sales.

Jimelita has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, she hopes to have a number of food stalls in the town.

loans.use: to purchase flour.

loans.name: Sinoeun

texts.en:
Sinoeun (in the photo) is 45 years old and his wife, Bunvon is 37 years old. They have been married since 1999 and have two children- one son and one daughter. They are living on an island in the MeK. River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sinoeun is a house constructor, while his wife is a weaver. Sinoeun is operating his business by investing with his brother, but he now wants to run the business independently. Hence, he is requesting a loan of $1,000 to buy construction crane materials.

loans.use: To buy construction crane materials.

loans.name: Gloria's Group

texts.en:
Gloria is a businesswoman who operates an animal sales business from her home. She purchases goats and sheep when they are young, raises them up by giving them food, and then sells them at a profit to butchers and during the season of Eid.
Gloria's husband is an electrician by profession and offers an electrical repair service to his customers. He is an expert in his work and receives a good amount of work every month.
Gloria has two daughters, both of whom are studying. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her business. She will use the loan to buy sheep and goats in larger numbers, which will allow her to improve her business and profits. Gloria has been operating her business for many years and is very confident of business success after the loan investment.

loans.use: to buy goats and sheep for her animal sales business.

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr:
Koffi est  un homme âgé de 38 ans. Il est marié å une tresseuse et ont ensemble 03 enfants.
Koffi travaille comme reporter -Vidéo depuis 2000. Il a une entreprise dans laquelle il répond à la demande de ses clients dans un quartier de la place. Il achète ses outils à Lomé.
Koffi a requis son sixième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter de la Caméra.
Il dit qu’avec les profits, Il prévoit assurer un avenir meilleur à ses enfants.
texts.en:
Koffi is 38 years old and married to a braider. The couple have 3 children. Koffi has been working as a video reporter since 2000, and has a business which fulfills the demands of customers in his local neighbourhood.

Koffi buys his tools in Lomé and is requesting a 6th loan from WAGES in order to buy a camera. He plans to use the profits from his business to provide his children with a better future.

loans.use: to buy a camera.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es: Con su credikiva anterior,  Luz Marina compró mucha mercancía, como calzado, ropa interior y exterior que vendió a un buen precio, porque así mismo los consiguió con descuentos. Su nuevo credikiva lo invertirá en la compra de productos de aseo personal y de belleza tales como colonias, talcos, chancletas y ropa interior. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Mis agradecimientos y entera satisfacción por el apoyo que Kiva brinda a los empresarios. Porque gracias a ellos han mejorado su nivel de vida
texts.en: With her prior loan, Luz Marina bought a lot of merchandise like shoes, clothing and undergarments that she sold for a good price because she got them at a discount. She'll invest her new loan in the purchase of personal hygiene and beauty products like colognes, powders, slippers and undergarments. Her message to Kiva lenders is, "I'm grateful and completely satisfied with the support Kiva provides businesspeople. Thanks to you they've improved their quality of life."

loans.use: to buy personal hygiene and beauty products such as cologne, powders, slippers, and undergarments.

loans.name: Safar

texts.ru: Сафар проживает в районе Шахритус. Он женат. Ему 37 лет. У него четверо детей. Сафар более шести лет занимается растениеводством. У него при доме имеется небольшой участок земли, где он выращивает овощи и сажает фруктовые деревья. Кроме того Сафар в летнее время года занимается торговлей продуктов питания. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Safar lives in the Shahrituz district. He is married, is 37 years old, and has four children. Safar has been involved in agriculture for more than six years. He has a small plot of land by his house, where he grows vegetables and plants fruit trees. Safar also sells groceries in the summertime. He is requesting this loan to purchase fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Mahuena-Sourou B Group

texts.fr: Le groupement MAHUENA-SOUROU B est formé de onze personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Le représentant de ce groupement, nommé Gaston est celui dont la main est levée sur la photo. Gaston est âgé de 49 ans, et est marié à Séraphine. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Gaston a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Depuis cinq ans environs, Gaston vend des cartes de recharges téléphoniques à son domicile ; ce qui lui permet d’assurer ensemble avec sa femme les diverses charges de la famille. Gaston achète ses produits au Bénin. C’est la troisième fois que Gaston et les autres membres du groupement MAHUENA-SOUROU B sollicitent un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce crédit leur permettra de renforcer leur activité et d'accroître leur chiffre d’affaire, afin de mieux répondre à la demande de leur clientèle.
texts.en: MAHUENA-SOUROU B is a group composed of 11 people who all live in the same neighborhood. The group representative, Gaston, is the one raising his hand on the picture. Gaston is 49 and is married to Séraphine. Together they care for their 3 children, some of whom go to school. Gaston quit school at the primary level. For about 5 years, Gaston has been selling refill cards for prepaid phones. It has enabled him to financially take care of his family, along with his wife. Gaston buys those items in Benin. It is the third time that Gaston and the other members of the MAHUENA-SOUROU B group are applying for a loan from ALIDÉ. Thanks to this loan, he will be able to strengthen his business and boost his sales, in order to better meet the needs of his customers.

loans.use: to buy refill cards for prepaid phones.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 33 years old, married to Dorcas, and blessed with two children. He has been in the farming business for the last six years and he earns a monthly income of KES 15,000.

He is applying for his first loan with KADET in the amount of KES 30,000. He plans to use the funds to buy seeds and fertilizers. With the anticipated profits he will repay the loan. He was introduced to KADET ltd by a credit officer.

His hopes are to venture into large scale farming and to educate his children.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Zakaria

texts.fr:
Né en Janvier 1970 à Sikasso Monsieur Zakaria est marié et père de 8 enfants résidant dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie à Mancourani II, le centre ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur Zakaria est un dépanneur de radios et télé, qui pour améliorer son entreprise décida d’associer la vente des appareils d’occasion à son activité de dépannage. Il dispose d’un atelier au grand marché de Sikasso, il est beaucoup  sollicité par sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter.
 Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décide de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a quelque mois.  Il est à son premier prêt individuel. 
Monsieur Zakaria vend ses appareils (TV, Radios, Mines Chaînes, DVD, etc) dans son atélier de réparation à ses clients composés généralement de ceux qui sollicitent ses services de réparations
Avec ce premier prêt, il compte acheter 10 DVD, 6 Radios, 5 TV écran 29, 3 Mines Chaînes et des CD. Ses appareils proviennent de la république de Ghana.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 200 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour  contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en: Born in January 1970 in Sikasso, Zakaria is married and a father of 8 children living in a large traditional extended family in Mancourani II, the central town of Sikasso (the third largest administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Zakaria is a radio and TV repair man, who decided in order to improve his business, to add the sale of second hand equipment to his repair business. He has a workshop in the 'grand marché' of Sikasso, and is much sought out by his ever growing customer base. With a view to better servicing this growing customer base, he decided several months ago to approach the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. This is his first individual loan. Zakaria sells his appliances (TV, radio, mini HiFi systems, DVD etc) in his repair workshop to customers - mostly people who have brought in equipment for repair. With this first loan, he intends to purchase 10 DVD players, 5 29 inch TVs, 3 mini HiFi systems, and some CD players. This equipment comes from the Republic of Ghana. With this loan he expects to generate a monthly profit of 200,000 FCFA which will mostly be used to contribute to the family expenses, to pay the loan interest, and the rest will be invested in the business.

loans.use: to purchase electronic equipment

loans.name: Quilla Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal QUILLA, él banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Paulina continua con su negocio de restaurante, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua elaborando desayunos y almuerzos para todos sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones personales, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca a adelante a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de arroz, carnes, menestras entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
Las socias que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde  a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
Los demás socios se dedican al negocio de restaurante, artesanía, venta de comida, maestro constructor.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank QUILLA.  The bank is located in the district of Cusco and Cusco department.

Paulina continues her restaurant business.  She is a responsible and earnest person.  She daily prepares breakfast and lunch for all customers who request it.  She gets up early for her business which brings her personal satisfaction, and she feels that in this manner she brings to support her family.

She requested a loan for the purchase of rice, meat, beans and others products.  She is grateful for the loan and agrees to meet the payments.  The members who appear in the accompanying photo asked permission to be late for work meeting.  The other partners are engaged in restaurant business, crafts, food sales, and building.

loans.use: to buy rice, meat, beans and other items.

loans.name: Melrose

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Melrose works hard to support her family.

She has a furniture making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Melrose is borrowing PHP 14000 through NWTF to buy materials like woods, nails, varnish and maintenance for her equipment.

Melrose has been sustaining her business activities through her past  loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials like woods, nails, varnish and maintenance for her equipment

loans.name: Lider

texts.en:
Lider has a small pharmacy in his home. With 20 years of experience running this kind of business, his entire family is dedicated to this line of work, and he has worked with them and in other pharmaceutical businesses. 5 years ago he placed his business in his home so that his wife could work there, and he worked there on his days off. One year ago he left his other job and dedicated himself to his pharmacy. Their location is well placed where there is no competition and the service they offer is good because of his experience. They are open every day of the week, from 7:00 am until 10:00 pm.

He needs this loan in order to place orders for pharmaceuticals and take advantage of discounts, and to stock a display case with items related to babies and toddlers, for example diapers, bibs, milk, and gifts for children, since in that area there are many children.

Lider is 55 years old, with 3 children already in school. He is married, and his wife supports him in the business, especially when he isn't there. They are a very hardworking family. With mutual effort they have been able to buy their house and bit by bit they are remodeling it from cane to concrete block. They hope to grow in this business as it is the only source of income for the household.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Lider tiene una pequeña farmacia en su casa, con una experiencia de 20 años atendiendo estos tipos de locales, toda su familia se dedica a esta línea, él ha trabajado con ellos y en empresas farmacéuticas, hace 5 años puso su negocio en su casa para que su esposa lo lleve adelante y él lo hacia en sus días libres, hace un año lo despidieron de la empresa como no encuentra trabajo tomo la decisión de dedicarse a su farmacia, su local esta bien ubicado porque no hay competencia y el servicio que él brinda es bueno por su experiencia, ellos atienden todos los días de la semana, a partir de las 7:00AM hasta las 10:00 PM.

Él necesita el préstamo para poder realizar los pedidos a las farmacéuticas y aprovechar los descuentos, implementar en una de sus vitrinas lo que es todo lo relacionado para bebes y niños grandecitos, ya que en el sector lo que más hay son niños, es decir comprar: pañaleras, biberones, leche, regalos para niños.

Lider tiene 55 años de edad, con 3 hijos todavía están en el colegio, esta casado, su esposa le apoya en el negocio especialmente cuando él no se encuentra, son una familia muy trabajadora, con el esfuerzo mutuo han podido comprar su casa y remodelarla de caña a bloque, poco a poco la están cambiando, esperan crecer en el negocio ya que es su única fuente de ingreso para el hogar.

loans.use: to buy medicines and baby items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Gladys would like to buy two standing driers, two blow driers and chemicals

loans.name: Edoh

texts.fr:
Edoh Y. is a widow, age 35, with three children to care for. Alone in dealing with household expenses, she is confronted with serious problems because of the limited income from her modest business involving gari (granulated cassava root) and beignets (a kind of doughnut). The cost of schooling for her children is the main concern that she has not managed to cover.

To conquer this situation and to see her children succeed one day, she is requesting a loan of $500 in order to strengthen and diversify her business. The profit gained will then help ensure that her family reaches its full potential. So let's help her realize her dream.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Madame Y. Edoh est une veuve de 35 ans avec trois (03) enfants à charge. Seule face aux besoins du ménage, elle est confrontée à de sérieux problèmes car le revenu de son petit commerce de gari et de beignet est très limité. La scolarisation des enfants est sa principale préoccupation qu’elle n’arrive pas à assumer.

Pour vaincre cette situation et voir ses enfants réussir un jour, elle sollicite un crédit de $500 afin de renforcer et de diversifier son commerce. Ainsi donc le bénéfice obtenu l’aidera à assurer l’épanouissement de la famille. Aidons la donc à réaliser son rêve.

loans.use: Buying flour, sugar, and oil

loans.name: Logossou

texts.fr:
Born in 1969 in Tsévié (Zio Prefecture), Logossou K. is a father of a family with six children from his two wives. Though lucky enough to have a valuable middle school diploma, he had to abandon his studies due to a lack of funds. He then focused on the business of raising sheep and goats, which he enjoyed doing when he was still in school. Given current problems, his family barely manages to eat two meals a day. In order to acquire new kinds of livestock and to extend the corral for them, he is requesting a loan of $900 to be devoted entirely to his business. The loan will allow him to ensure his family's well-being.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Né en 1969 à Tsévié (P/Zio), Monsieur K. Logossou est père d’une famille de six (6) enfants avec ses deux (2) femmes. Nanti d’un diplôme de BEPC, il a dû abandonner les bancs, faute de moyens financiers pour poursuivre les études. Il a alors intensifié l’activité d’élevage de moutons et de chèvres qu’il s’amusait à faire quand il était encore sur les bancs. Avec les difficultés du moment son ménage arrivait à peine à satisfaire 2 repas par jour. Afin de se procurer de nouvelles races et d’étendre son enclos, il sollicite un prêt de $900 pour se donner à fond à cette activité. Ceci lui permettra d’assurer le bien être de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy new kinds of animals and to extend the corral

loans.name: Faiz

texts.en: I am Faiz B., a mother of six children. Two of my daughters are married whereas the youngest one supports me in my embroidery and stitching business. The eldest son operates a fruit cart, which I bought him from a loan I have previously taken, and the son after  him drives a rented rickshaw. I was unable to educate them because of our poor financial condition, but now we are doing better and therefore I have enrolled my youngest in school. My son is quite an expert in driving by now and he wishes to operate his own rickshaw, which will maximize his profits, as he will no more have to pay the rent. I need a loan of USD425  for my son to purchase  a rickshaw on installments.

loans.use: Buy rickshaw for my son

loans.name: Amelia Antonia

texts.es:
Doña Amelia R. is 50 years old, is originally from Bluefields, is single, and has two sons who are high school students. For the past 20 years she has worked selling pork and beef nacatamales Thursdays through Sundays every week. Mrs. Amelia is very well known in the neighborhood where she lives because of the years she has been working this business. However, because of lack of resources, her nacatamales sell very quickly because she prepares only small quantities. For this reason, Mrs. Amelia needs a loan to be able to buy the materials to prepare her product and sell it in larger quantities that will allow her to make a larger profit.
The large pot costs US$48.00; an industrial stove costs US$60.00; a pound of beef, US$0.70; a pound of pork, US$1.20; a sack of carbon, US$4.00 each, and a quintal (~100 lbs.) of corn costs US$ 22.00 each

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer
Doña Amelia R. tiene 50 años de edad, es originaria de Bluefields, es soltera tiene dos hijos ambos estudian en secundaria. Se dedica desde hace 20 años a la venta de nacatamales de cerdo y de res,negocio que realiza desde el dia Jueves hasta el Domingo de cada semana. La señora Amelia es bastante conocida en el barrio donde habita por los años que se ha dedicado a este negocio, sin embargo por la falta de recursos sus nacatamales se venden rapidamente ya que la cantidad que prepara es poca. Por tal razon es que necesita un financiamiento para poder comprar los insumos para la elaboracion de su producto y poder vender mayor cantidad que le permita tener mas ganancia.
El caldero grande le cuesta US$ 48.00 dolares, un fogonero industrial esta valorado en US$ 60.00 dolares, una libra de carne de res la compra en US$ 0.70 dolares, una libra de carne de cerdo cuesta US$ 1.20 dolares, un saco de carbon esta valorado en US$ 4.00 dolares cada uno y un quintal de maiz cuesta US$ 22.00 dolares cada quintal.

loans.use: To buy a large pot, an industrial stove, 50 lbs. of chicken, 50lbs. of pork meat, 8 sacksof coal, and 200 lbs. of corn.

loans.name: Lotu

texts.en: “The more you work hard the more you get” is the saying that the single mother of three, Lotu F., adopts. She is 38 years of age and lives in Tuanai center with her parents and her children. Her business is selling ice cakes, which cost fifty cents each, and Samoan cocoa, which costs $5.00 WST ($2 USD) cooked and $3.00 WST ($1.20 USD) uncooked. She sells her goods from her house and also delivers them to the nearby villages. Lotu earns about $200.00-300.00 WST ($80-120 USD) from her business. This is the only source of income for her family. She would like a loan so she can purchase more supplies for her snacks business.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her snacks business

loans.name: Zulfida

texts.en: Zulfida is a refugee from the Tartar region situated in the east part of Azerbaijan, in the Azerbaijan-Armenian conflict zone. She lives in Sumgayit town now. She sells clothing near the marketplace. She is in this business for more than 10 years. She has taken loans from Normicro Sumgayit branch before and successfully paid back her loans. She wants to increase the number and variety of her goods and she has little of her own funds. She applies again for a loan. She will repay the loan in 14 months.

loans.use: To increase the inventory

loans.name: Tomasina

texts.en:
Tomasina, a forty-seven-year-old mother of five children, sells a collection of fashionable shoes to the men and women of her community. Tomasina purchases her stock in response to her customers' orders and sells them from her house. She has been selling these goods for two years and now she a well-established clientele. With the profits from the business, Tomasina helps her husband to support the household and the children's studies.

With her loan, Tomasina will buy a showcase to display her shoes for sale.

loans.use: To improve a retail shoe business

loans.name: Maiya

texts.en:
Mrs. Maiya G. lives in a single family with her husband and two children. Both her son and daughter are studying in grade 2. Her husband name is Pinj G. and he is a laborer in house construction work. In her family only her husband's income is not enough to run family and to provide education for their children. So in order to upgrade the living standard of her family she opened a poultry farm two years ago. She sells chickens in local market. People also come to buy chicken from her farm. Now the demand for chicken is increasing rapidly in that area but due to lack of fund she cannot fulfill the demand of her customers. So Mrs. G. is requesting for her first loan to buy more chicken for her farm.
Her income is used to support her husband and fulfill the needs of her family.

loans.use: To buy chicken for her farm

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Ms. Sonia M. lives in her own home with her mother on Loyola Street in the Alto Tacagua district of the city of La Paz. Sonia has a one-year-old daughter and works as an operator in a Radio Taxi company. Furthermore, she recently obtained a car that she rents out as a taxi, which generates income for her on a daily basis.

She is requesting this loan in order to repair her vehicle, replace its tires, give maintenance to the engine, and perform a complete automobile check.

This is her first loan with Impro, but her credit check has determined that she is able to make monthly payments, so she qualifies for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Sonia vive en casa propia con su mama en la calle Loyola de la zona de Alto Tacagua de la ciudad de La Paz; Sonia tiene una hija de un año y trabaja como operadora en una compañía de servicio de Radio Taxi, además de haber adquirido recientemente un auto el cual le genera una renta diaria, también como radio taxi.

El crédito que solicita es para reparar su movilidad, cambiar llantas, mantenimiento de motor y chequeo completo de todo el automóvil.

No tiene antecedente con Impro es su primer crédito, pero califica para obtenerlo, pues el análisis de flujo de caja efectuado permite el pago de sus responsabilidades mensuales.

loans.use: Replace tires and give maintenance to her taxi

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is 36-years old and the father of 3 children. All his children are in school. He is a driver by profession. Samuel is so lovely a husband that he has opened a grocery store for his wife to so she can also earn a living. He will use his loan to buy more grocery products like babies’ diapers, sanitary towels, washing powders, rice, vegetable oil, etc. to increase her wife’s inventory.  He plans to help his wife save some money for the children’s education. Samuel is a member of the group called “Asomdwe” meaning Peace. Members agree to guarantee each other as social collateral to repay the loan. Samuel in the photo with the wife.

loans.use: To buy grocery products

loans.name: Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Parveen baji, wife of M. N., has lived in a city named Pak Pattan, Pakistan for the last 17 years. She is a mother of seven children: three sons and four daughters. All of her children are enrolled in a local school. Parveen baji wishes to give her children good education. Parveen baji’s husband is a building contractor. She successfully completed her first loan from Asasah. She bought a buffalo with her first loan. Now she is applying for a loan to buy a buffalo for selling milk for profit.

She has been joined in her loan group a few more members: Tahira baji wants a loan to buy a pop corn maker; Karam baji wants a loan for her grocery shop; Kalsoom baji wants a loan to buy land and start a farm; Mairaj baji wants a loan to buy fertilizer.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo

loans.name: Alfa Y Omega Group

texts.es:
Hi.  We are the Alfa y Omega ("Alpha & Omega") group.  We earn our living buying and selling merchandise, each one of us operating small businesses, selling different kinds of products.  We've known each other for some years and we've always worked together.  Thanks to the income from our businesses, we've been able to improve the lives of our children and have higher standards of living.

Antonia V..  My main business is making and selling tortillas.  I'm a senior citizen now.  Thanks to the income from this business, I can help my husband with family expenses.  We support each other and that's how we managed to build our house.

Norma Suypa G..  My main business is making and selling clothes and "chicharras" (not sure, literally cicadias, so possibly something that makes a sound or looks like a cicadia?).  I have a daughter who is in the first grade.  I should mention that thanks to this business, I can contribute to paying my family's expenses.  We've managed to buy a solar panel to use at the house that we'll build later.

Luis Edgardo L. M..  I work as a street vendor, selling new clothing in different neighborhood around the city of Danli.  My wife and I are trying to improve our standard of living.  We have a boy at a local preschool.  We now need to stock our business but we don't have enough capital to do it so we're applying to you for help.
Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer
hola nosotros somos el grupo alfa y omega, nuestra actividad principal es el comercio, cada uno de nosotros cuenta con un pequeño nengocio de diferentes actividades, tenemos varios años de conocernos y siempre hemos trabajado juntos,  gracias a los ingresos que nos generas estos negocios hemos podido sacar adelante a nuestros hijos y asi lograr un merjor nivel de vida.

Antonia V..  Mi actividad principal es la elaboracion y venta de tortillas, soy de la tercera edad, gracias a los ingresos que tengo de este negocio puedo ayudar a mi esposo con los  gastos familiares,  ya que nos apoyamos mutuamente y asi es como hemos logrado construir nuestra Casa.

Norma Suypa G.. Mi actividad principal es la confeccion de ropa y elaboracion y venta de 
chicharras, tengo una hija la que esta en 1er grado, es importante mencionar que gracias a 
este negocio puedo contribuir con los gastos de mi familia logrando asi comprar un solar
para posteriormente construir nuestra casa.

Luis Edgardo L. M. tengo un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa nueva, el que distribuyo de manera ambulantes en los diferentes barrios y Colonias de esta ciudad de Danli.  atentemos mi esposa y yo hemos mejorado nuestro nivel de vidad, tenemos un niño el que esta cursando educacion Prebasica, actualmente necesitamos surtir nuestro negocio y no contamos con el capital suficiente, razon por la cual solicitamos el apoyo de ustedes.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Mrs. Lay Kunthea Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The Village Bank which is located in Ta Reab Doun Sar Village in the Kandal Province consists of fifteen members. Mrs. Lay K., 30, is the village bank president who has been selected by the members in the village bank. She sells different kinds of vegetable in the local market. Her husband, Mr. Hem V., is a farmer who cultivates rice and vegetable. Aside from this business, he is soldier who has been retired and he can get a small salary to support his family. The couple has four children, three of whom are attending school while the youngest one is too young to work or study.

Since her business is going well, Mrs. Lay K. wants to expand and is requesting a loan to purchase more vegetables for resale. (Mrs.Tat S. is not shown in the picture but her husband is because he came to take a loan instead of her while Mrs.Tat S. is very busy with her work.)

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables for resale at the local market.

loans.name: Liv

texts.en: Liv Y., 52, has a business selling fish and a variety of vegetables in the market since 2001. She is able to make US$3 per day. She is a widow who lives with three children, one of whom is a garment worker and two sons who are farmers growing sugar cane and rice. She would like a loan from Kiva to increase the supply of fish and vegetables that she sells in the market.

loans.use: To buy fish and vegetables to sell in the market.

loans.name: Magnolia

texts.es: Magnolia de 50 años, es madre de 7 hijos, de los cuales 5 de ellos ya se independizaron y tiene su propia familia, quedando solo los dos últimos a su cargo, estudiantes y la razón de su esfuerzo y de seguir adelante, esperando que en un mañana  sean hombres de bien ante la sociedad. Magnolia se dedica a la venta de comida y de frutas de la región, teniendo como principales clientes a los funcionarios D. hospital regional, por lo que ella se siente satisfecha, lo más importante para ella, es surgir en su negocio, con el tiempo ampliar  su kiosco para la venta de comida y frutas, y desde luego brindar una mejor acogida a sus clientes, para ello necesita de un capital, para implementar su negocio y cumplir con su objetivo.
texts.en:
Magnolia is 50 years old and is the mother of 7 children, of whom 5 are independent and have their own families, leaving only 2 children in her care. These 2 children are students, and they are the reason for her efforts and of going forward. She hopes that they will be good men in the society. Magnolia sells food and fruit in the area. Her main clients are the officials of the regional hospital. She feels satisfied with this. The most important thing for her is to grow her business, with time, expand her kiosk for the sale of food and fruit, and later, offer a better reception to her clients. For this, she needs capital to supply her business and achieve her goal.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand and supply his business for the sale of fruit

loans.name: Janeth

texts.es:
Janeth es enfermera pero por las condiciones de trabajo en Bolivia se ve obligada a realizar el trabajo de costura ya que su esposo realiza buzos y el crédito que ahora solicita será destinado para la compra de una maquina de coser.
Este crédito será de gran ayuda ya que al comprar la maquina tendrá la oportunidad de ayudar a su esposo y generar mayores ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida
Vive en la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La paz.
Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, las ganas de superarse le dan la oportunidad de acceder a este crédito.
texts.en:
Janeth is a nurse but due to the lack of work in Bolivia, she finds herself forced to work as a seamstress. Her husband makes athletic wear and the loan Janeth is requesting will go towards buying a sewing machine.

This loan will be a great help as in buying the sewing machine Janeth will be able to help her husband and generate more income to improve her quality of life.

She lives in the area of Tembladerani in the city of La Paz. This is her first loan from Impro and her desire to excel has given her the opportunity to gain access to this loan.


Translated from Spanish by Ines Teles, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a sewing machine to help her husband in his athletic wear making business

loans.name: Carmelon

texts.es: Carmelon tiene 58 años, está separado de su pareja, pero vive con sus cuatro hijos, menores de edad. Se dedica al cultivo de café, lo cual desarrolla desde que era niño, desde siempre le agradó trabajar en la chacra y estar mayor tiempo posible en el campo, le gusta limpiar sus terrenos de cultivo para que pueda producir adecuadamente. La venta de café, desde su juventud, ha sido un negocio rentable, debido a que su zona es reconocida por producir café de muy buena calidad, pero de la misma manera es costoso y trabajoso, por todo el proceso que este conlleva, como el afán de secar los granos. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP. Carmelon desea invertir en la compra de plantas de café y abonos para los terrenos.
texts.en:
Carmelon is 58 years old, separated from his wife, but lives with his four children who are all minors. He grows coffee, a profession he has had since he was a young boy. He has always like working on the ranch and being in the countryside as much time as possible. He likes to prepare his fields so that they can produce adequately. Selling coffee, since his youth, has been a profitable business, as their area is known for producing a high quality coffee. However, it is also expensive and labor intensive, for the processes involved such as efforts involved in drying the beans. This is his first loan with MFP. Carmelon wishes to invest in buy coffee plants and fertilizer for his land.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy coffee plants and fertilizer

loans.name: Samon

texts.en: Mrs. Samon N. was born in 1981 and lives in Khsom village in Kandal province. She is employed at a garment factory. Her husband, Mr. Sing Rith, is a pig breeder. Even though they try to work hard, they can't earn enough income to provide a better life for their family, or for the family members who also live in their old house. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Samon N. decided to request a loan to repair the house for her family. Her husband is presented on the right in the picture.

loans.use: To repair the house for her family.

loans.name: Jeanette

texts.es: Jeanette tiene 38 años, vive soL. ya que es soltera, habita en L. casa que le dejaron sus padres, donD. puso su tienda D. abarrotes. Trabaja usualmente desD. muy temprano para lograr buenos ingresos, comenzando desD. las 6 D. L. mañana y cerrando a las 9 o 10 D. L. noche, elL. es conciente que si trabaja más logrará mayores ingresos económicos, es por eso que trata D. esforzarse al máximo para tener éxito en las ventas. A Jeanette le gusta mucho su trabajo y es por eso que le pone tanto empeño, pero en algunos casos se siente muy agotada, y esa es L. parte fea D. su trabajo, pero sobrellevando este inconveniente elL. sabe que toda ganancia requiere su sacrificio. Este es su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, y se ha comprometido a ser puntual en los pagos. Con el dinero que se le facilite en este crédito implementará mejor su tienda para tener más variedad D. productos y lograr mejores ventas.
texts.en:
Jeannette is 38 years old, is single and lives alone. She resides in a house she inherited from her parents where she has installed a grocery store. She usually works from very early in the morning to generate income, starting at 6 am and closing at 9 or 10 pm in the evening. She is conscious of the fact that, the harder she exerts herself, the more earnings she will have. This is why she works her hardest for successful sales. Jeanette enjoys her work greatly, which is why she puts forth such effort. However, in some instances, she feels exhausted which is an unappealing aspect of her work. Overcoming this obstacle, she knows that all gains require a sacrifice. This is her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and she has committed to being timely with her payments. She will use her loan to set up her store better, to have a greater variety of products and generate increased sales.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise.

loans.name: Salim

texts.en:
Salim O. is a 34-year-old businessman. He is married, and he and his wife have three children. All their children are studying at the local school. Salim is a farmer, like his wife. They started their work 10 years ago. The beginning was very difficult, because they needed to invest a lot of working capital. With much effort and the help of his wife, he was able to move forward and today has a large plot of land.

His vegetables are very good quality which he says is due to the constant irrigation they receive since the business has a complete underground irrigation system. They sell their products in the fruit and vegetable market of the city. Salim is requesting the loan for the purchase of fertilizer, seeds, fuel and lubricants. This will allow him to better provide for his family.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds, fertilizer, fuel and lubricants

loans.name: Channra

texts.en:
Mr. Channra Y., 43, and his wife, Mrs. Nary Sin, 37, live along the number one national road, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1986 and have six children: three sons and three daughters. One of their sons works in a plywood factory, two daughters work in a garment factory, and the other three children attend school.

Channra has been driving a taxi for nineteen years, taking people to beautiful locations. Besides being a taxi driver, he is also a fisherman. His wife stays at home to take care of their children. Channra’s car was damaged, which disrupted his business. He is asking for his first loan of $1,000 to make repairs to his taxi, purchase an outboard motor for his fishing business, and to build a new kitchen for his home.

loans.use: Repair his taxi, purchase an outboard motor, and build new kitchen

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en:
Dinah O. sells materials, such as cloth at Gari Moree market, near Cape Coast, which she has done since 2001.

She is married with two children and has received schooling through senior high school. Dinah’s husband is employed as a driver.

Dinah uses her income to pay for school fees and utilities. She will use the loan to purchase more materials for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Dinah plans to give her children a quality education.

loans.use: Purchase more materials for resale.

loans.name: Eshkuzi

texts.en:
B. Eshkuzi is 50 years old. He is married and has four children. Eshkuzi was born in a simple rural family and has worked with livestock for 21 years. He is very experienced and has special skills in livestock care that help him to develop his business. He raises and sells livestock and sells meat and milk.

Eshkuzi is requesting a loan of $800 to enable him to purchase a second dairy cow. The second cow will enable him increase milk production and will provide income security to the family whenever one of the cows is in calf. The income will allow Eshkuzi to provide for his family, take good care of his cows, and supply his neighbors with quality milk.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to epic mountain passes, communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 percent of the country is mountainous and only 7 percent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase cattle in order to expand his business.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
La señora Elena vive en casa propia, en la zona  de Alto Llojeta, área periférica de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposo, el señor Gregorio Vargas.
La señora Elena es costurera, realiza fundas y almohadas que vende en un puesto de venta ambulante y su esposo es chofer asalariado en una empresa de transporte público.
El crédito solicitado es para la construcción de una habitación que funcionará como su taller de costura, ya que al no tener espacio realiza su trabajo en su dormitorio que le resulta pequeño.
Esta es la séptima vez que solicitan préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califican favorablemente y pueden acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Elena lives in her own house in the Alto Llojeta zone, in the outskirts of the city of La Paz, with her husband, Gregorio Vargas. Elena is a seamstress. She makes pillowcases and pillows that she sells as a street vendor and her husband is a salaried driver for a public transportation business. The requested loan is for the construction of a room that will function as her sewing workshop; since she doesn’t have a space she works in her bedroom, which is small. This is the seventh time they have requested a loan and the socioeconomic analysis of them that has been done favorably qualifies them so they can take out a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the construction of a room that will be her sewing workshop.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 45 year old man who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon with his wife.  Hasan works as a car mechanic and also sells spare car parts. He requests a loan for 1300 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase spare parts.  This is the first time that Hasan has requested a loan.
 
Hasan does his work very well.  His clients are his friends and neighbors.  When Hasan first started his business, he did not face any difficulties. He decided on doing his business because he learned the trade when he was young.

loans.use: Hasan will use the loan to purchase spare parts.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie T. is from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan De Oro City. She is 31 years old. Rosalie is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Rosalie owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste, canned goods, and other products in the local community. Rosalie has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Rosalie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital.

Rosalie is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Rosalie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her children's education and to provide the needs of the family.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her business

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua T. sells soft drinks and other groceries at Kormantse near Cape Coast. She has received education through to the junior high school level. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a commercial driver.

Efua has been selling soft drinks and other groceries since 2000. She is responsible for feeding her family. Her loan will be used to increase her capital to buy more of the soft drinks she sells and also groceries such as milk, Milo (a milk beverage), rice, sugar, soap and so on to fill her shop. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards building a house for the family.

loans.use: To buy more of the soft drinks and groceries she sells

loans.name: Kumri

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
       Кумри – 48 лет. Замужем и мать 3-х детей. Она занимается продажей галантереи, бижутерии. Она торгует на рынке «Панчшанбе» города Худжанда, на втором этаже магазин № 172. Кумри закупает товар из оптового рынка города Истаравшан. Она ездит за товаром 3-4 раза в месяц. Её муж нигде не работает. Он приехал из Росийской Федерации, потому что из за финансового кризиса работодатели ему не оплатили за работу.  Когда она начинала бизнес, у нее было маленькое количество товара. Но сейчас Кумри расширилась. Кумри просит кредит для закупки новых видов модных женских заколок и бижутерии. Тогда у Кумри увеличится ассортимент ее товара.
texts.en:
Kumri is 48 years old. She is married and is a mother of 3 children. She sells notions and costume jewelry.
