She sells at the Panchshanbe market in the city of Khujand, on the second floor, store #172. Kumri buys her merchandise at a wholesale market in the city of Istaravshan. She goes there 3-4 times per month. Her husband is not employed. He returned from the Russian Federation because his employers did not pay him for work due to the financial crisis. When Kumri started her business, she had a small quantity of goods. Now Kumri expanded. Kumri is requesting a loan in order to purchase new types of stylish women’s hair accessories and costume jewelry. Then Kumri’s merchandise assortment will increase.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of women's hair accessories and jewelry

loans.name: Carmen Martha

texts.es:
Préstamo anterior: http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id= 92194&_tpos=7&_tpg=1
Carmen es socia del Bancomunal Jesús D. Praga.
Carmen ha empezado a vender golosinas, fruta  en su casa, también esta vendiendo vinos que esta trayendo del sur D. Chincha. 
Carmen necesita un préstamo D. 2200 soles, para la compra D. herramientas, va comprar una vitrina  mostrador.
El préstamo esta ayudando a surgir en su negocio.
El sueño D. Carmen es que su negocio crezca y  darle educación a su nieto por que su nuera murió.
texts.en:
First Kiva loan: http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id= 92194&_tpos=7&_tpg=1 Carmen is a member of the Jesús D. Praga Village Bank. She has started selling sweets and fruit from her home, in addition to wines, which she brings up from southern Chincha. Carmen needs a loan of 2200 soles to buy tools and a display case. The loan is helping her get ahead with her business. Her dream is to expand her business and and educate her grandson, since her daughter-in-law died.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tools and a display case

loans.name: Ederliza

texts.en:
Ederliza B. is from the village of Puerto, Lurugan Valencia City. She is 48 years old. Ederliza is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Ederliza owns & operates a business running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Ederliza has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Ederliza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ederliza has successfully repaid a previous loan from HSPFI. This previous loan was used as additional working capital. Ederliza is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Ederliza from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To grow yams

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort is fifty-nine years old. She is married and has given birth to six children, who are all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Wiawso is a commercial and farming town. Comfort runs a licensed chemist store. She sells all kinds of drugs, both tablets and syrups alike. She sells in a store by the road side in her community. Comfort buys her goods from nearby towns and from distribution vans. She has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to buy drugs in bulk to increase her stock.

loans.use: To buy drugs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: acheter des engrais

loans.name: Make A Difference Group

texts.en:
Make A Difference is a group of 5 borrowers which is led by Mama K.. Mama is a 29-year-old married woman with three children. Her children are between the ages of 5 and 12 years old, and their educational levels are between first and fifth grades. Unfortunately, due to poverty, she is illiterate. Mama and her family live in northern Liberia in Ziggida, a small town close to Zorzor, a district in Lofa county.

Mama is engaged in the business of selling foodstuffs. More specifically, she buys goods such as seasonings, dry fish, cassava, and plantains at wholesale prices, and she then sells such goods at retail prices (for a profit) to local residents. She explains that she has been operating this business for 3 years and that she is hoping to expand to the point that she can purchase her own shop. Mama notes that she serves her customers with respect and talks to her customers in a courteous manner in order to encourage them to continue buying from her.

Mama and her family depend on the success of this business for their day-to-day needs. She has been facing financial difficulties as of late: for one thing, her business is not particularly large, so her profits do not fully cover her family's living expenses at this time; further, her husband is sick, so she is carrying the entire burden of providing for the family. Thus, she is seeking this loan in order to purchase more foodstuffs. Her ultimate dream is for her children to receive a quality education.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional foodstuffs (e.g., seasonings, cassava, plantains, and fish)

loans.name: Edria

texts.en: Edria E. is married to a trader and has two children. She has received tertiary education. Since 2009 Edria has been selling hair weaves, body creams, hair relaxers and so on, at Elmina market. She supports her husband in paying the utility bills and school fees. Her loan will be used to buy more hair and body products to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save and reinvest into the business.

loans.use: To buy more hair and body products for resale

loans.name: Antonio Magaiza

texts.pt:
António Magaiza M. nasceu no Distrito da Manhiça, Província de Maputo, tem 44 anos de idade casado e pai de 2 filhos de 17 e 12 anos de idade, todos vão a escola. Fez somente 1ª classe, não continuou porque perdeu os pais muito cedo. Vive na casa própria, sustenta um sobrinho órfão de mãe.

Saiu da Manhiça para o Distrito de Boane em 1969 transferido pelos serviços, posteriormente decidiu fixar a sua residência e buscar a família para residirem em Boane. Tem um negocio próprio a 19 anos, vende produtos da 1ª necessidade das 7h as 19h com a ajuda da sua esposa. Nesta actividade consegue render cerca de 1.000.00mt por dia, poupa algum mensalmente na sua conta bancária.

Nunca teve empréstimos em outras instituições financeiras, conheceu a Hluvuku através de seu vizinho que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu 3º empréstimo no valor de 25.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos de 1ª necessidade para o seu negócio (açúcar, óleo, arroz e outros). Os créditos anteriores foram de 10.000.00mt e 15.000.00mt ambos para a mesma actividade.

No futuro, pretende solicitar mais créditos para poder aumentar a área de cultivo na sua machamba e reforçar o produto do seu negócio para responder a demanda da sua clientela.
texts.en:
António Magaiza M. was born in the district of Manhiça in the province of Maputo. He is 44, married, and the father of 2 children who are 17 and 12. Both of them go to school. He only studied through the 1st grade and didn't continue because he lost his parents very early. He lives in his own home and supports one nephew who lost his mother. He left Manhiça for the district of Boane in 1969 because he changed jobs. He previously decided to build his home and to start a family in Boasne. He has had his own business for 19 years. He sells basic goods from 7 a.m. to 7 p.m. with the help of his wife. He manages to make around 1,000 meticais a day and saves some every month in his bank account. He has never had a loan with another financial institution. He became familiar with Hluvuku through his neighbor who also is a client of the institution. This is his third loan and it is for 25,000 meticais. He will use it to buy basic goods for his business (sugar, margarine, rice, etc.). His previous credits were for 10,000 and 15,000 meticais, which were both used for the same purpose. In the future, he hopes to request more credits to be able to expand the growing area of his small farm and to reinforce his products for his business to respond to his customers' demand.

Translated from Portuguese by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell products (rice, sugar, etc.)

loans.name: Sicily

texts.en:
Sicily is 30 years old and married with two young children, aged three and eight. She sells second-hand clothing and has been in this business for three years. She describes herself as hardworking and focused, and says that through her training with Kiva partner Faulu she has learned how to plan and keep records for her business.
Sicily has requested a loan for 20,000 KES from Faulu to buy additional clothing stock. Her hope is to have a stable family and a good business in the future.

loans.use: To buy more stock of used clothing

loans.name: Tumendemberel

texts.en: Tumendemberel is 42 years old and lives with her 14-year-old daughter in Uvurkhangai province, Mongolia. She and her daughter live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian tent, and her daughter attends the local secondary school. Tumendemberel sells clothes for a living and imports her products from China. She started her business in 2005, and in 2007 began selling women clothes exclusively. Customers are happy with the quality of her products, and she is hardworking lady with good communications skills. She says, “I want to rent one more stall in order to expand my business.” She is requesting a 1,300,000 tugrug (~$914 US) loan to buy more items to sell.

loans.use: To buy more women's apparel to sell to her customers

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla B. is from the village of Calaran Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 51 years old. Perla is married and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, Perla owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling "polvoron" in the local community. ("Polvoron" is a common dessert in the Philippines, a powdered milk candy similar to shortbread.) Perla has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from this activity.

In 2009, Perla joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Perla has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Perla is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional ingredients for making polvoron. This will be her 3rd loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients for making polvoron

loans.name: Muhamad

texts.en:
I. Muhamad is 49 years old. He is married with two children. Muhamad has a small cafe where he sells breakfast, lunch and dinner. When he first started his business he only opened to sell breakfast because he worked at night. Once his place became more popular he was able to dedicate himself to the business full time. 

Muhamad wants the loan so he may invest in tables, chairs and utensils. He is asking for 4500 Somoni. With this money, Muhamad will be able to expand his business, to earn more profit and in turn help his children move forward to complete their school studies and further continue studying at the university. The well-being of this family is in your hands. Contribute to the growth of his business and they will be grateful. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Tables, chairs, and utensils for expanding a cafe business

loans.name: María Adela

texts.es: María Adela V. T., de 46 años de edad, vive en municipio de Paraiso de Osorio, departamento de La Paz, en vivienda propia y acompañada de su esposo, el señor Juan Panameño,  y 4 hijos: Ever, Juan, Noemi y Jairo de 26, 19, 17 y 15 años de edad respectivamente. Juan se encuentra pensionado, recibiendo una cantidad de dinero que no logró sustentar las necesidades de esta familia, fue así como Adela hace 9 años decidió emprender su propio negocio. Hablando con algunos profesores del Centro Educativo Nacional de dicho municipio en que vive le permitieron instalarse con un chalet en el que inicio distribuyendo a sus clientes, boquitas como nachos ó chips, pupusas por la mañana, refrescos naturales y una buena oferta de golosinas para niños y jóvenes del centro educativo. Maria Adela ha batallado mucho por hacer que su negocio prospere y gracias a su dinámica esto ha sido posible. Ahora ella ha echado a andar una última idea, la de ofrecer almuerzos tanto a los profesores y estudiantes del Centro Escolar, le ha ido muy bien, su clientela está creciendo, dado que reconocen que su toque culinario es exquisito así como la amabilidad de Adela, esposo e hijos e higiene del lugar. Para satisfacer la demanda de nuevos platillos de sus clientes y poner a su disposición mayor variedad de productos es que se encuentra solicitando este nuevo crédito.-
texts.en:
María Adela V. T., age 46, lives in the municipality of Paraiso of Osorio, department of La Paz, in her own dwelling and accompanied by her husband, Señor Juan Panamanian, and their 4 children: Ever, Juan, Noemi and Jairo ages 26, 19, 17 and 15 years respectively. Juan is retired and receives a pension that fails to support the needs of the family. For this reason Adela decided 9 years ago to start her own business. Speaking with some professors of the National Educational Center of the municipality in which she lives, she was permitted to open a cafe there in which she began distributing to her clients foods like nachos and chips, pupusas (a biscuit-like flat bread made from maize) in the morning, natural refreshments and a good variety of delicacies for children and youths of the educational center. Maria Adela has worked hard to make her business prosper and thanks to her effort this has been possible. Now she has decided to pursue a new idea, that of offering lunches both to the professors and students of the school. This has gone over very well. Her clientele is growing, given that they recognize that her culinary tastes are exquisite as well as appreciating the amiability of Adela, her husband and her children and the cleanliness of the place. To satisfy the demand of her clients for new dishes and to offer a greater variety of products, she is requesting this new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy foods for the preparation of new dishes and to offer a greater variety of products in her food service.

location.town: Municipio de Paraiso de Osorio en el departamento

loans.name: La Flor Del Jicaral (Flat) Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama  LA FLOR DEL JICARAL porque asi se llama la localidad donde viven.   Las personas que forman el grupo son siete, y son: Cornelia Ramírez C., Carmela Ramírez, Cristina Solís Pérez, Felipa Hernández C., Gladis María  López V., Andrés Ramírez Gómez   y  Mary carmen Gómez López.  Todos ellos  viven en el estado de Veracruz, y se dedican  a la crianza de  borregos, cerdos  y a las labores del hogar o al  trabajo del campo.

Cristina esta casada.  Tiene dos hijos. Cristina se dedica a la crianza de borregos y en temporadas  también a la de cerdos ya que a su esposo le gusta  tener  ganado, pues dice que es como un ahorro.  Ella está segura que esta actividad le rendirá suficientes ganancias como para comprar una becerra y en un futuro también dedicarse a la cría de vacas.  

Con este crédito, quiere comprar unos borregos.  Su meta para el futuro es dar una mejor vida a sus hijos en especial al más chico, ya  que  apenas cuenta con seis años.  Con sus ganancias, ella espera mejorar su calidad de vida, y que algún día su hijo pueda ir a la universidad.  .  

Cristina dice sentirse  muy a gusto en el grupo de LA FLOR DEL JICARAL porque ella  conoce a sus  compañeros  y sabe  que puede confiar en ellos.  

A cristina le parece muy bien que existan  prestarios como los de Kiva que  apoyen las actividades  que les ayudan a mantener  a sus familias.

* La senor a la mano izquierda vestido con azul y blanco no es parte del grupo.  Es solamente una amiga.
texts.en:
This group is called LA FLOR DEL JICARAL, because that is the name of the place where they live. There are seven members in the group: Cornelia Ramírez C., Carmela Ramírez, Cristina Solís Pérez, Felipa Hernández C., Gladis María López V., Andrés Ramírez Gómez and Mary Carmen Gómez López. All of them live in the state of Veracruz, and they work raising sheep and pigs, doing household labor or working on farms. Cristina is married and has two children. She works raising sheep, as well as pigs in some seasons. Her husband likes having livestock, since he says it is a form of savings. Cristina is sure that this activity will give her sufficient income to buy a heifer and also begin raising cattle in the future. With this loan, she would like to buy some sheep. Her goal for the future is to give her children a better life, especially the younger one, who is now only six years old. With her earnings, she hopes to improve her quality of life and someday send her son to the university. Cristina says that she feels very comfortable with the group LA FLOR DEL JICARAL, because she is well acquainted with her fellow members and knows that she can trust them. Cristina thinks that it is very good that loan programs such as Kiva exist to help support the activities that allow them to provide for their families. * Note: the woman on the left side of the photo dressed in blue and white is not part of the group; she is only a friend.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing sheep to raise

loans.name: Octavio Joaquin

texts.es:
El señor Octavio V.  tiene 60 años de edad, esta casado  viven en  la ciudad de Encarnación.
Es propietario de un negocio de decoración y ventas de alfombras y es atendida por el mismo. Es una Persona muy   trabajadora y gracias a las actividades que realizan han podido salir adelante e ir creciendo en sus micro-empresa.
El negocio ofrece diferentes servicio ya que además de vender los artículos decorativos también hacer decoraciones de salones para fiestas de quinceaños, cumpleaños infantiles y casamientos.
Agradece a la Fundación y Kiva por crédito ya que mediante el pude completar algunos artículos que hacían falta en el negocio como las telas que utilizan en las decoraciones, así como jarrones, flores y otros.




.
texts.en:
Octavio V. is 60 years old, married, and lives in the city of Encarnación. He is the owner of a decoration and carpet store which he runs himself. He is a very hardworking person and thanks to the business that he has, they have been able to move forward and continue growing in their micro-business.

The business offers different services, since in addition to selling decorative items, he also makes room decorations for 15th birthday parties, children’s birthday parties, and weddings.

He thanks the Foundation and Kiva for the loan, since through this, he could purchase a few items that he was missing in the business such as the fabrics that they use for the decorations, such as vases, flowers, and others.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise such as colored fabrics, paintings, artificial flowers, vases, and others

loans.name: Sharifan's Group

texts.en:
Sharifan lives in the small city of Raiwind in Pakistan. Her house consists of three big rooms, and she has lived there with her family for the past 30 years. Sharifan is a seamstress by profession and sews clothes for her neighbors in order to earn an income. She uses her income to pay for utilities. She also saves a part of her income for rainy days.
Her husband, A. P., has a wood-selling business. He supplies wood for tandoors (ovens made from mud and used to prepare bread). He also sells wood in the community. People purchase wood for cooking food since gas is not available in their community. Sharifan is applying for a loan to buy more wood in bulk to expand her husband’s wood-selling business.

loans.use: To purchase wood in bulk for resale

loans.name: Luz Aurora

texts.es:
Luz L. de 49 años, vive en una zona periurbana en Paraíso de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento y si cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Es madre soltera tiene un niño que estudia en una escuela del gobierno.  

Hace años atrás Luz no tenia como mantener su hogar y por la necesidad tuvo que poner una cabina telefónica en su casa para sus vecinos, aunque no le rendía muchas ganancias ella poco a poco comenzó a ahorrar.

En la actualidad por la buena administración que tuvo puso más cabinas telefónicas en su casa pero ya con la publicidad de una empresa telefónica muy famosa en el Ecuador llamada “Porta”. Trabaja desde las 08:00 am hasta el anochecer, también vende tarjetas y recargas para celulares desde $ 1.00 hasta $ 30.00. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar tarjetas y recargas telefónicas para su negocio. En el futuro quiere adecuar el local con más cabinas telefónicas.
texts.en:
Luz L., 49, lives in a periurban area of Paraíso in Guayaquil; her house is cement and has all basic utilities. She is a single mother of a son who goes to public school. Years ago Luz had no way to support her home so she had to set up a phone booth in her house for her neighbors to use. Although it didn’t produce much income at first, gradually she began to have some savings. Currently, thanks to the efficient way she ran it, she installed more phone booths in her house but now having publicity from a very famous phone company in Ecuador called “Porta.” She is open for business from 8am until nightfall; she also sells pre-paid phone cards and cell phone recharges for from $1.00 to $30.00. She will use the funding to buy pre-paid phone cards and cell phone recharges for her business. In the future, she would like to set up even more phone booths in her location.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pre-paid phone cards and cell phone recharge points.

loans.name: Cristo La Fuente Group

texts.en:
Disiana, 63, is the coordinator of her group Cristo La Fuente (Christ is the Source), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) generally. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding La Romana, an area dominated by the sugarcane industry and characterized by the Haitian workers who live there; running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long term partner and her two grown children.

Disiana is excited to be taking her fourth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business (running a small food stand) by purchasing more bananas, bread and cookies to sell. She will use the profits to reinvest in her business, which she would like to grow into a small store. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Bananas, cookies and bread to sell

loans.name: Nohemi

texts.es: Noemí, de 26 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos, Jack de 5 y Leydi 3 años de edad. Juntos viven en la comunidad de Sirenachayocc, ubicada en la hermosa selva cuzqueña, donde tienen su casa propia. Hace mas de 8 años vendía golosinas por la calles de su comunidad, ya que su familia no le podía dar todas la necesidades que requería. Así que tuvo que conseguir la manera de salir adelante. Hoy se dedica a la actividad agrícola, específicamente a la comercialización y producción de cacao, en donde le está resultando buenas ganancias económicas, además se siente satisfecho por lo que viene realizando; usualmente trabaja en su chacra, pero en tiempo de sembrío y cosecha, recibe la ayuda de sus familiares. Su rutina diaria es desde las 7:00 de la mañana hasta las 6:00 de la tarde, solo que en los días domingos descansa, para estar cerca a su familia y ya tiene como 6 años trabajando de manera constante en este rubro agrícola. Su producto los vende en los centros de acopio de su comunidad a precio de mercado. En el futuro anhela ampliar su terreno de cultivo en otras zonas, donde haya acceso a carretera y pueda facilitar el traslado directo de su producto, con el motivo de minimizar tiempo y mano de obra. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con sus obligaciones de pago, además se siente cómodo con su grupo comunal, por el respaldo que lo otorgaron sus compañeros. Con el crédito que solicita le servirá para darle mantenimiento adecuado a sus plantaciones de cacao, para ello comprará abono e insumos.
texts.en:
Noemí, age 26, is a single mother. She has two children. Jack is five years old, and Leydi is three years old. They live together in the Sirenachayocc community, which is located in the beautiful Cuzqueña jungle. They have their own house there. More than eight years ago she sold sweets on the streets of her community. She did this because she could not give her family the necessities. She had to find the way to get ahead. She now works in agriculture, specifically in the production and sales of cacao. She is getting good earnings from it. Also, she feels satisfied with what she is doing. She usually works on her farm. But, during planting and harvesting times she gets help from her relatives. Her daily routine is from seven in the morning until six in the evening. She only rests on Sundays to be close to her family. She has been working this way in the agricultural field for six years. She sells her product at market price at the centers where people in her community gather. In the future she would like to increase her agricultural land in other areas where there is access to a road. Then she could facilitate the direct transportation of her product. This would save time and labor. This is her first loan with MFP. She promises to keep making her payments. Also, she feels comfortable with her communal bank because of the support of her colleagues. She will use the requested loan to provide adequate maintenance to her cacao crops. She will buy fertilizer and supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and supplies to apply to her cacao crops

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en: Annabelle D. is from Barangay Roxas, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 37 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Annabelle owns and operates a butcher shop, butchering and selling pork in the market. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Annabelle joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Annabelle is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her second from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children’s tuition fees. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Khanbala

texts.en: Khanbala F. is a 48-year-old beekeeper who works and lives in the small village of Agsu with his wife and four children. Quality honey is very expensive in Azerbaijan and takes a lot of time and effort to produce. Khanbala has been working very hard from May to October to produce quality honey since 2000. He has repeat clients who buy his honey and once a year he brings his products to the honey fair in Baku city which is 150 kilometers from his home village. Now Khanbala has applied for 800 AZN to purchase new beehives and improve his working conditions.

loans.use: purchase new beehives and improve working conditions

loans.name: Diénabou

texts.fr: Diénabou S. est une femme de 38 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de KANDIA depuis le 01er juin 2007 et a 06 fois de suite bénéficié de prêt et a toujours fidèlement remboursé. Elle vend du carburant et des lubrifiants dans son village. Le village est très distant de la ville et on y note inexistence de station à essence alors le principal moyen de locomotion de la population est la moto. Elle tire profit de cette situation pour développer un petit commerce de carburant et de lubrifiants, ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer cette activité en achetant par quantité plus nombreuse. Elle participe financièrement à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Diénabou S. is an 38-year-old woman who is married and the mother of four children to support.  She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of Kandia since June 1, 2007 and has had six successive loans, which she has always repaid faithfully.  Diénabou sells fuel and lubricants in her village.  The village is quite far from the city, and people notice the lack of a gas station there, while the principal means of transportation is the motorbike.  Diénabou is deriving a profit from this situation in order to develop a small business for fuels and lubricants.  This loan will enable her to bolster this business through buying in greater quantities.  Financially, she is helping to improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Developing her business involving fuels and lubricants

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira S. is from the village of Bonbon, Sagay, Camiguin Province. She is 49 years old. Elvira is married and has 2 adult-age children. To make a living, Elvira owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store.  The main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Elvira has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Elvira joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elvira is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Elvira from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Eleonor

texts.en:
Eleonor S. is from the village of Western, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 34 years old. Eleonor is separated from spouse and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Eleonor owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling motorcycle parts in the local community. Eleonor has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 9500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Eleonor joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Eleonor is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Eleonor from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Noorah

texts.en:
Noorah N. lives in Kyebando in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is divorced and has four children, two of whom are in school. She also takes care of two additional family members (a sister and a brother). 

Noorah sells second-hand clothing. She has been in this business for four years. She works seven days a week. Noorah sells her products in a retail shop. Noorah has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy bales of second-hand clothing. 

The main business challenge for Noorah is the transportation of bales of clothing from Owino market to her shop in Kyebando. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to buy land and build rooms to rent. She decided to join MCDT because of good customer care. Noorah lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but she doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include medication, food, rent, and school fees.

loans.use: To buy bales of second-hand clothing

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
La señora Gregoria es una señora que se dedica a la lechería, tiene 42 años, casada tiene 5 hijos.

Gregoria tiene 4 cabezas de ganado vacuno, de las cuales produce casi 50 litros de leche cruda cada dia. La señora Gregoria siempre esta buscando mejor oportunidades, es asi que se compro una vaca y empezó a vender su leche casa por casa dia a dia y con el tiempo  ha logrado comprarse hasta 4 cabezas de ganado lechero y ya tienes clientes fijos a quienes les entrega la leche, es asi que la Sra Gregoria se levanta muy temprano ordeña las vacas y les dejas pastoreando mientras va a vender su leche, luego regresa a su casa para prepara el almuerzo y mandar a sus hijos a la escuela, luego se encarga de pastorear cortar alfalfa (alimento para el ganado vacuno) y luego al finalizar la tarde nuevamente realiza el proceso de ordeñar a las vacas y con esa leche prepara Yogurt, que también lo comercializa.

Es asi que la Sra. Gregoria se apersono a Cidre solicitando un crédito para la compra de cascara de soya para que su ganado pueda producir mayor cantidad de leche y asi generar mas ingresos y poder dar a su familia un mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Gregoria dedicates herself to dairy farming. She is 42 and married with 5 children. Gregoria has four heads of cattle that produce nearly 50 liters of raw milk every day. She is always looking for better opportunities, which led her to purchase a cow and sell its milk going door to door, day after day. With time, she has succeeded in purchasing four heads of milking cattle, and she already has regular customers that she sells the milk to. Gregoria gets up very early in the morning to milk the cows, then she puts them out to pasture while she goes to sell the milk. Later she returns home to prepare lunch and send her children off to school. Then she takes care of herding the cattle to graze alfalfa (food for cattle). When the afternoon draws to an end, she milks the cows once more. She uses this milk to prepare yogurt, which she also sells. Gregoria comes to CIDRE [the field partner] requesting a loan to purchase soybean husks so her cattle can produce a greater quantity of milk. This way, she can earn more income and provide a better quality of life for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Rachael Mossey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase soybean husks for her cattle

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita C. is from the village of San Lorenzo. She is 58 years old, married, and has two adult children. Teresita owns a business in which she makes and sells cooked food for daily meals. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Teresita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Teresita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to continue to improve her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer F. makes a living providing electrical repairs in his community. He is a 32-year-old married man from the village of Mangandingay, Cabarroguis, Quirino. Jennifer has been in his business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2009, Jennifer joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. Jennifer has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase equipment to improve the business. Jennifer is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase equipment to improve the business. This will be his third loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase equipment to improve the business

loans.name: La Finca Group

texts.es:
El grupo La Finca lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras provenientes de Masaya, ciudad de las Flores una de ellas es Ileana Margarita C. de 25 años quien inicio hace cinco años vendiendo helados de coco, nancite, mamon, piña, de cocoha…etc. actualmente vende frescos, gaseosas, galletas y chiverías. Ella tiene dos niños de 7 y 5 años los cuales van a clases y su meta es tener una pulpería bien surtida. 
Las otras integrantes del grupo son Concepción B. propietaria de una carnicería la cual inicio en 1980 con la venta de una pequeña bolsa de hueso actualmente comercializa una vaca entera y Heydi G. vende ropa usada desde hace tres años y su meta es tener un tramo.
texts.en:
The Villa Group is made up of three hard-working women from Masaya, the city of flowers.  One of them is Ileana Margarita C., who is 25 years old.  Five years ago, she started selling ice cream (coconut, nancite [a citrus fruit], papaya, pineapple, chocolate and more), and she currently sells soft drinks, cookies, and yogurt drinks.  She has two children who are 7 and 5 years old and go to school.  Her goal is to have a well stocked general store.

The other members of the group are Concepción B., who started a butcher shop in 1980 with the sale of a small bag of bones, and now sells whole cows, and Heydi G. who has sold used clothes for three years.  Her goal is to have her own place for a store.

loans.use: Purchase fruits, soft drinks, and yogurt drinks

loans.name: Sonia Guadalupe

texts.es: La señora Sonia Guadalupe Márquez  E.  es casada  tiene 3 hijos aun menores de edad que estudian ,inicio con su negocio hace 11 años vendiendo productos por catalogo por medio de una amiga  que la recomendó  sus primeras ventas fueron aproximadamente  de Q.300.00 , su lugar de venta  es donde vive  luego  fue a vender en las aldeas  cercanas, sus ventas fueron creciendo  y ahora tiene personas que le ayudan a vender su producto, ahora cuenta con una venta de Zapatos que lo tiene ubicada en su casa  desde hace un año   con la  ayuda de su esposo han podido salir adelante, siempre sigue vendiendo  productos por catalogo en su casa y tiene personas que le siguen vendiendo, su mayor deseo es poder tener variedad en productos de Zapatos, solicita el credito para comprar calzado o zapatos ahora en el tiempo de Navidad y sacar a delante a sus hijos   y  poder aportar un poco más en  los gastos de la casa.
texts.en: Mrs Sonia Guadalupe Márquez E. is married and has 3 young children who are in school.  She began her business 11 years ago selling products from catalogs.  A friend recommended her and her first sales were for approximately 300 quetzals.  She sold her products from home.  She then went on to sell in nearby towns.  Her sales started to increase and now she has people who help her to sell her products.  For the past year she has had a shoe sales business which is also located in her house.  With the help of her husband they have been able to make progress.  She still sells products from catalogs in her home and has people who keep selling them.  Her main wish is to be able to have a variety of shoes to sell.  She is requesting this loan to buy footwear and shoes now, in time for Christmas.  She would like to help her children get ahead and be able to help a bit more with household expenses.

loans.use: Shoe sales

loans.name: Carmen Alicia

texts.es: La Señora Carmen Alicia S. O. es una persona joven pero con muchas ganas de salir adelante, ella se dedica a la venta de churrasquitos  tiene un comedor y venta de ropa típica, agradece grandemente a Fape por otorgarle un crédito Kiva ya que le ha ayudado mucho para agrandar su negocio pudiendo invertir más en su local de ropa como en su comedor y ahora vende productos de consumo diario, y ha logrado captar más clientes ya que en un solo lugar pueden  encontrar diversos productos que ella les ofrece; por lo que el día de hoy ella solicita un nuevo crédito Para comprar productos de comestibles  y asi poder surtir mas si tienda, todos los días  desde muy temprano junto a su niña de tres  años ella se encamina al mercado municipal de un pueblo llamado San Juan Sacatepéquez, donde tiene su negocio  y empieza sus labores diarias donde está desde el amanecer hasta el anochecer lo que le ha llevado al éxito en su negocio.
texts.en:
Carmen is a young woman with a strong desire to succeed. She works selling grilled meats. She has a store with a dining area where she sells local cuisine. She is very grateful to her field partner FAPE for giving her a Kiva loan, which has helped her grow her business by enabling her to invest in her store. Now she also sells groceries, enabling her to attract more customers since they can find many product offerings in one place.  

Carmen requests a new loan to buy groceries so that she can restock her store. Every day, alongside her three year old daughter, she walks to the market in a town called San Juan Sacatepéquez, where she has her business. She begins her daily chores at dawn and works until to dusk. This is what has led to the success of Carmen’s business.

loans.use: Groceries

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: El sr. Jose Antonio M. B. es una persona que quedo sin empleo ya que la empresa para la que el trabajaba cerro a causa de la crisis y el con sus conocimientos de soldadura abrio un tayer en su domicilio y hoy endia es a lo que se dedica pues le fue muy bien por lo cual se dio cuenta de que la fundacion se enfocba a dar prestasmos para micro empresa y vio en el credito una oportunidad para hacer creser su negocio ya que el esta nesesitando una maquina de soldar y algunas otras herramientas de trabajo el usara su credito para in vercion al negocio y mejoramiento de su economia familiar.
texts.en: Jose Antonio M. Bustamente is a person who ended up out of a job when the firm he worked for closed as a result of the economic crisis.  With his welding skills, he opened up a workshop in his home and this is where he now works.  His business has done very well.  He realized that Fundación para la Vivienda Progresiva focused on providing loans to small businesses and he saw in one of our loans the opportunity to grow his business since he needs a welding machine and some other work tools.  He will use his loan to invest in his business and improve his family's finances.

loans.use: To buy goods for his business

loans.name: Marlon's Group

texts.en:
Marlon A. is from the village of Carikkikan Sur, Ilagan, Isabela. He is 31 years old. Marlon is the leader of a seven-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Marlon is married and has one infant child. To make a living, Marlon plants and harvests rice for sale. Marlon has been engaged in his business for more than four years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Marlon joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. Marlon is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This will be the first loan taken out by Marlon from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to financially support his family. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Genelita

texts.en:
Genelita is a 43-year old married woman who supports her family by operating a general store. She lives in Medellin, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2009 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 8,400 PHP. 

Genelita is borrowing 10,000 PHP so she can purchase more stock to sell. This will be her third loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 4,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Genelita aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Ermetania

texts.en:
Ermetania P. is from the village of Poblacion, Gingoog City. She is 46 years old. Ermetania is widowed and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Ermetania owns & operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing hairdressing & other beauty services to local community members. Ermetania has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities. In the picture, Ermetania is the one who is combing the hair of the customer and the other one is the customer.

In 2010, Ermetania joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ermetania has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional materials needed for the service and as working capital. Ermetania is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Ermetania from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to expand services provided

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
"Hardworking woman" best describes Josie R., a 26-year-old single woman who lives in Poblacion 2, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. Despite her situation, being handicapped, Josie still lives normally. She remains strong in order to survive. That’s why she opened a “carenderia,” or small restaurant. 

The business is doing very well with hard work and God’s help. She was able to send her children to school and able to meet the needs of her family. She got her capital from Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative when she joined the organization in June 2003. She has availed herself of several loans already. Now she is applying for a 5,000-PHP loan to buy kilos of meat and spices for her carenderia, and grocery items for her sari-sari (variety) store. She really wants to have a comfortable life ahead.

loans.use: To purchase meats and other ingredients for her eatery

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is a married woman who lives in Bantayan, Cebu. She earns her living by operating a bakery/cake-making business and a food vending business. Her husband Eldifonso, who is 39 years old, works as a tricycle driver to earn his living. They have eight children who are between 4 and 16 years old. Analiza joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 18 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Analiza has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 29,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 15,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 19th loan, she is borrowing PHP 29,500 to buy a motorcycle for her bakery so that she can continue to save up for future education of her children and build a new house. Analiza is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for her bakery business

loans.name: Agripina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “ALLIN MUJU”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Agripina; La socia tiene 34 años de edad, la socia es conviviente,  y tiene 4 hijos; (18,14,10,8); la socia se dedica al comercio minorista, la socia compra y vende cuyes, gallinas y todo tipo de ave de corral los cría engorda reproducen y los vende, ella trabaja los sábados y domingos en el baratillo, y de lunes a viernes entrega los pedidos que tiene para toda la semana, la socia desea contar con este capital de trabajo para comprar cuyes y gallinas específicamente al por mayor, ella está en espera de este capital para lograr sus metas de crecer y dar mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. La socia invertirá el préstamo en la compra de gallinas y cuyes para la venta.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Agripina is a member of the Communal Bank “Allin Muju” which is located in the District of Huanchac, Province and Department of Cusco.

She is 34 years old, in a common law marriage, and has four children (ages 18, 14, 10, and 8). Agripina is a small businesswoman who buys and sells guinea pigs, hens, and all types of poultry. She raises and fattens these animals for breeding and resale. On Saturdays and Sundays, she works at a secondhand shop. From Monday through Friday, she delivers the orders that she receives throughout the week. Agripina wants to have operating capital to buy guinea pigs and hens at wholesale. She hopes this capital will help her reach her goals of growing and providing a better quality of life for her children. This loan will be invested in the purchase of hens and guinea pigs to sell.

Agripina is happy with the loan that was provided and promises to complete her payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase hens & guinea pigs to sell

loans.name: Rezyl

texts.en:
Rezyl is a 25-year-old married woman from the town of Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. She has 3 young children aged 5, 3 and 2.

Rezyl is engaged in farming and hog-raising. Her husband, who is also a farmer, mainly manages their rice farm, while she helps weeding when she can. Rezyl makes sure that the pigs she grows are healthy. She also takes good care of her children.

This loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and pig feeds. In the future, Rezyl hopes to have a stable business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pig feed.

loans.name: Patricia Del Carmen

texts.es: LA SEÑORA E.  LABORA COMO GRABADOR DE DATOS ,ES  SOLTERA ,TIENE  TRES PERSONAS  A SU CARGO, ES  EL TERCER  CREDITO  QUE CEPRODEL LE OTORGA, AGRADECE EL APOYO  QUE  LE HA BRINDADO  CEPRODEL  CON LOS DESEMBOLSO QUE LE HAN APROBADO , ESTE CREDITO LO NECESITA  COMPRAR MATERIALES DE CONSTRUCCION COMO PERLINES, CINZ Y PAGAR  MANO DE OBRA ,PARA REPARAR  PARTE        DE SU VIVIENDA QUE SE ENCUENTRA EN MAL ESTADO..
texts.en: Ms. E. is single and works as a data recorder.  She is in charge of three other people.  This will be her third loan with CEPRODEL.  She is grateful for the support and the disbursements approved by CEPRODEL.  As part of her home is in need of repair, she plans to use the requested loan to buy construction materials, such as support rafters and metal sheeting for her roof.  The loan will also be used to pay the labor costs.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es: Me llamo Reyna, yo me dedico a engordar reces, algunas las compro ya grandecitas y otras las crio desde pequeñas, ya tengo mis clientes que seguido vienen por las reces y se las llevan, me pagan mis res como 15 dias despues, por ese lado no tengo mayor problema, lo unico seria que hay que tenerles limpio o tratar de que el lugar este limpio, y me meto al corral a barrerles y sacar todo el escremento, tambien darles de comer sale un poco caro cuando uno quiere tener las reces bien gordas, cada que venda el ganado lo ocupo para mi familia por ejemplo habeces que bajo a cobrar a los clientes pues de paso llevo leche, comida, fruta. Tambien cuando se puede les doy dinero a mis hijos que van a la escuela o los ayuda con ropa, mis metas son superarme y que mi familia vica mejor , finalmente para eso trabaja uno para que a su familia no le haga falta nada y vivamos mejor, con las ganancias son para volverlas a invertir y sacar para la familia de uno, tengo 2 hijos, soy casada desde hace 17 años, donde vivimos es casa propia y mi esposo es empleado en una fabrica.
texts.en: My name is Reyna and I work raising cows.  I buy some already grown and others I raise from the time they are small.  I already have customers who regularly come for the cows and take them away.  They pay for the cows about two weeks later.  I don't have any big problems with my work.  The main challenge is keeping the animals and their place clean.  I get into the pen to sweep and remove all the manure.  It is also a bit expensive to feed them when one wants to have the cows nice and fat.  I sell livestock to help my family.  For example, sometimes when I go to collect payment I bring milk, food, and fruit and deliver it on the way.  I also give my children money when I can when they are going to school or I help them with clothing.  My goals are to improve myself and for my family to live better.  This is why one works--so that their family doesn't lack anything and so they can live better.  I invest my earnings and take what is needed for the family.  I have two children.  I have been married for 17 years and we live in our own home.  My husband works at a factory.

loans.use: buy cows to fatten

loans.name: Dolores Miladis

texts.es:
En el balneario de San Clemente  cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal 1 de Diciembre. Este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, que son muy visitadas por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros,  ofrece diversidad de lugares hermosos y una rica variedad de platos típicos de la región.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Dolores, tiene 53 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 24, 18 y 14 años, los mayores estudian en la universidad en Manta, el menor estudia en colegio. El marido es obrero.
 
Es una gran ama de casa que para ganarse el sustento diario y ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar hace seis años decidió instalar un bar en su casa, en este bar vende bocadillos y comida rápida, además de sodas, aguas, jugos, entre otras cosas. Trabaja todos los días desde las 15h00 hasta las 21h00, nos cuenta que le ha ido muy bien en su negocio y que gracias a su negocio sus hijos están estudiando en universidad.
 
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar sodas, aguas, bocadillos, jugos, entre otras cosas para vender en su local. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace  6 años, le gusta porque con los créditos pudo poner su negocio que le ha servido de mucho y por la unión que hay en el banco.
 
Su sueño es tener un gran restaurante.
texts.en:
The “1 de Diciembre” communal bank meets every two weeks in San Clemente. This area is known for its beautiful beaches that are visited by many national and international tourists. It offers diversity in locations and a delicious selection of regional dishes.

Here we meet 53 year old Dolores.  She’s in a live in relationship and has three children, ages 24, 18, and 14.  The oldest study at university in Manta; the youngest attends high school.  Her husband works as a laborer.  She’s a great housekeeper.

In order to support herself and help her husband pay the household expenses, she opened a pub in her home six years ago.  There she sells snacks, fast food, soda, water, and juices, among other things.  She works every day from 3:00 pm to 9:00 pm and tells us that things have gone well for her.  Thanks to her business, her children are studying at university.

She will use the money from this loan to stock her business.  She’s been a member of the communal bank for six years and likes the fact that the loans helped her start her business.  She also likes the unity that the members have.

Her dream is to open a big restaurant.

loans.use: to stock her pub

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is married and has five children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and rent bills.

Beatrice has been operating a clothes-selling business for the past three years, selling from home and door-to-door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and high cost of transportation for her business.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to do plumbing in her house, purchase water meter, pipes and iron sheets. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To do plumbing in her house, purchase water meter, pipes and iron sheets.

loans.name: Allen

texts.en:
Allen is a 33-year-old single mother of five children, and she rents a house in Kasese, Uganda. 

She has been operating a bar and lodge business for six years. Her hardship is bad debtors and her vision is building a house and owning a hotel.

Allen intends to use the loan to buy food and drinks to sell.

loans.use: To buy food and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “YAHUAR MAQUI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene 46 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de restaurant, ella prepara desayunos, almuerzos y cenas, ella trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 4:00 p.m, y en las noches la socia vende pizzas en el local de restaurant, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de restaurant. La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar el restaurant y comprar sillas, ollas y productos para cocinar como arroz, carne y verduras.
                                                         
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower is a member of the "Yahuar Maqui" community bank which is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province and department.

The borrower is 46 years old, married, and has two children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her restaurant business.  She prepares breakfasts, lunches and dinners.  She works from 8.00am to 4.00pm and, in the evenings, she sells pizzas from her restaurant premises.  The borrower would like to expand and improve her restaurant business.  She is requesting this loan to equip her restaurant and buy chairs, pots and cooking supplies such as rice, meat and vegetables.

The borrower is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to equip her restaurant and buy chairs, pots and cooking supplies such as rice, meat and vegetables

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
Mari Guadalupe, vive en coapilla Chiapas, ella es madre soltera en donde tuvo cinco hijos quienes ya todos están casados   y su mejor orgullo.

   Ella se dedica a ala  elaboración de panes y solicito el préstamo para apoyarse con la compra de ingredientes como son: harina, huevo aceite, queso, royal, entre otros, en donde lleva practicando seis años y cuatro meses de lo que nos comenta que le va  bien.

    En ello se inspiro en esta actividad por sus hijos que le dijeron que hace y  tiene una idea de elaborar panes y así los insiera para vender tendría una buena ganancias a un así su hermana también la apoya para elaborarlos.

    Su más grande deseo es que con el crédito y su actividad pueda tener ahorros para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Mari Guadalupe lives in Coapilla, Chiapas.  She’s a single mother of five children who are all now married and are her greatest source of pride.

She bakes bread and asked for the loan to buy ingredients like flour, eggs, oil, cheese, and Royal brand baking powder, among others.  She’s been in business six years and four months and she comments that she does well.

Her children inspired her to go into this activity.  They told her to do it and she had the idea of making bread and if she sold them she’d earn good profits.  A sister of hers helps her make it.

Her greatest wish is that with the loan and her work she will manage to have savings to get ahead.

loans.use: to pay for bread baking ingredients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase printing colors and bundles of materials to print t-shirts.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “ILLARY III”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Vicenta; ella tiene 50 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de madera, ella vende madera para la fabricación de muebles, roperos, mesas, sillas y puertas, la socia trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de madera. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar madera al por mayor.
 
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Here is a member of the communal bank "Illary III". It is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province of  Cusco and the department of Cusco.

Her name is Vicenta. She is 50 years old, single, and she has 3 children. She alternates her daily activities with her busienss buying and selling lumber. She sells lumber for the production of furniture, closets, tables, chairs, and doors. She works from 9 a.m. to 7 p.m. It is throught this business that she is able to support her children. She wants to expand and improve her lumber sales business. She requests a loan to purchase lumber in wholesale.

She is happy for this loan and she is committed to making her loan payments.

loans.use: to purchase lumber in wholesale.

loans.name: Binti Mohamed

texts.en:
Binti Mohamed is a married woman with one child who attends school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past six years, she has operated a cashew nuts selling business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is seasonality in production of cashew nuts. She dreams of selling cashew nuts wholesale in the future. 

With the KES 40,000, she wants to purchase four sacks of cashew nuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase four sacks of cashew nuts for resale.

loans.name: Elmer Hector

texts.es: Elmer es socio del Banco Comunal Divina Gracia, tiene 7 hijos y vende papa en el Mercado Nery García, es socio de FINCA Perú gracias a su esposa, ambos se retiraron por algun periodo debido a un accidente muy grave que tuvieron, pero empezaron de nuevo y tienen la meta fija de progresar, le gusta mucho las reuniones de su bancomunal, porque le ayuda a ser mejor padre y esposo que es lo mas importante para él, gracias a las capacitaciones que reciben aprendieron a ahorrar, y ahora tienen la meta fija de incrementar su negocio, este préstamo lo necesita para poder invertir en su puesto de papa comprando al por mayor directo de chacra.
texts.en: Elmer is a member of the Divina Gracia Community Bank, has seven children, sells potatoes in the Nery Garcia Market, and, thanks to his wife, is also a member of FINCA Peru. Both Elmer and his wife were forced to stop working for a short while as a result of a serious accident they suffered, but they have begun to work again, and have set a goal of getting ahead. Elmer likes attending his community bank meetings a lot, because they help him to be a better father and husband, which is the most important thing for him. Thanks to the training they have received, Elmer and his wife have learned how to save, and now they have set a goal of increasing their business. Elmer needs this loan to be able to invest in his potato stand by purchasing wholesale direct from the farm.

loans.use: To buy potatoes direct from the farm.

loans.name: Carlos Rodolfo

texts.es:
Carlos es un joven de 23 años de edad, soltero y vive con sus padres, hoy en dia es un profesional es medico veterinario, pues con apoyo de sus padres y esfuerzo de estudio logro terminar su carrera.
Hoy cuenta con su propia clinica, en su casa de habitacion, pues parte del capital lo ha logrado con ahorros de su trabajo en otra clinica, en donde ah adquirido mas experiencia sobre la especia. Asi como el apoyo economico de sus padres. Tambien da cursos de cirugia de especializacion y castracion, logrando otros ingresos.
Tiene construida casi toda la infraestructura donde es la estetica, pero necesita a condicionarla en divisiones y fontaneria, para una mejor higiene, mejor atencion al cliente y presentacion.
Lo que opta al financiamiento para poder, hacer posible la obra en corto plazo. Lo que comprara materiales de construccion y comenzar. Contento por que sus planes se estan haciendo posibles, para un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Carlos is a 23 year old young man and single. He lives with his parents. He has a professional job as a veterinarian. With the support from his parents and his efforts in studying, he finished his degree. 
He now has his own clinic located in his home. Part of the capital came from earnings saved from his work at another clinic. There he was able to obtain more experience about his profession. He also had financial support from his parents. He also offers specialty and castration surgery courses to earn more income. 
Most of the infrastructure for the grooming salon has been built. However, he needs to build divisions and plumbing in order to have better salon hygiene, better service for the customers and a better appearance. 
The loan will be used to do the work in a short amount of time.
He will buy the construction materials and start building. He is happy that his plans are becoming possible so he can have a better future.

loans.use: buy construction materials to finish divisions and the plumbing in the grooming clinic in order to offer better service.

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en: For the past 20 years Adwoa has been a palm oil extractor. She is married to a farmer and has 5 children. The palm fruits in the basket will be used to make palm oil but she needs a larger quantity to be able to make more oil to meet the increasing demands of her customers. A loan will help her to buy more bags of palm fruits.  She plans to reinvest the new profit for further growth.

loans.use: to acquire more bags of palm fruits.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en: Mildred is 35 years old and married to a casual labourer.  They have four children, between fourteen years and eight months old.  Mildred runs a retail shop in which she sells such items as detergents, soft drinks, sugar, rice, flour and other items to the local people.  Her business is located at the Manyatta area in Kisumu, which is very densely populated. She has been in this buisness for four years now.  She says that this business is profitable and her major challenge is the low purchasing power of the people living in Manyatta.  However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more general items to expand her business.  She hopes to grow her business to wholesale. She also sees herself building a house for her family in the future. She describes herself as Godfearing and humorous.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flour, rice, detergents, beverages etc

loans.name: Zenabu

texts.en:
Zenabu is a fish monger. She sells provisions as well. The small mini-shop behind her is stocked with provisions such as Milo, milk, biscuits, canned fish and tomatoes and other things. She is married and has 3 children.  Her husband is a security man. Zenabu has been selling provisions for 5 years.

The loan, when received, will be used to acquire other types of provisions to bring variety into the business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a bigger shop.

loans.use: to acquire other types of provisions to bring variety into the business

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is married with two children. She is 55 years old and lives in Gil Sanchez, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.

Rosita sells silver and fancy jewelry to earn a living and has had this business for six years. Each month, she earns 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to purchase additional jewelries to sell/retail.

Rosita has been a member of PMPC for more than one year. In the future, Rosita hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional jewelry to sell/retail.

location.town: Liloy-Gil Sanchez, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Shahar

texts.ru: Шахар жительница района Шахритус. Она замужем. Ей 50 лет. У нее пятеро детей. Она имеет среднее образование. Арендует земельный участок, где выращивает овощи и сеет пшеницу для продажи. Этим видом деятельности занимается 12 лет. Кредит берет для закупа семян пшеницы и минеральных удобрений. В дальнейшем она хочет за счет полученной прибыли отремонтировать свой дом. Шахор надеется, что кредиторы Кива помогут ей в продвижении ее деятельности и улучшению уровня жизни.
texts.en: Shahar is a resident of the Shahrituz region. She is married. She is 50 year old and has five children. She has secondary education. Shahar rents out a parcel of land where she grows vegetables and sows wheat for resale. She has been in this business for twelve years. She is taking out the loan to buy wheat seeds and mineral fertilizer. In the future she wants to use the profit to repair her house. Shahar hopes that Kiva lenders will help her in growth of her business and improvement of quality of live.

loans.use: to buy seeds of wheat and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: 060202-Hoằng Châu Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en:
Mrs Yến is 37 years old, married, and has two children. She is the leader of a five-member group, the 060202-Hoằng Châu solidarity group.
