She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province. Yến works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She has been involved in this business for more than ten years. 
One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns Yến is her lack of capital. In 2005, Yến joined Kiva partner Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Yến has successfully repaid six loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is now requesting a loan to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.
With her business profit, Yến hopes to be able to buy a new motorbike, help her business do well, and make enough money to provide for her children.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Christa Joriz

texts.en:
Christa Joriz, age 23 and unmarried, owns and operates a general store business where she sells such items as canned goods, snack foods, and beverages. She has had this business for three years.

Christa joined HSPFI earlier this year and dreams of improving her business.

She has requested a loan in the amount of PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to offer for sale in her store.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to offer for sale in her store

loans.name: Lucina

texts.en:
Lucina is from Guingona, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old. Lucina is married and has 12 adult children. 

To make a living, Norma operates a business venture, selling vegetables to local community members. Lucina has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

Lucina is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase more vegetables and for the expansion of the business. 

In 2007, Lucina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve her house.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables.

loans.name: Asuman

texts.en:
Asuman is 40 years old, single, and for a time was staying at home babysitting her sibling’s child.  After a while, she started to get bored and began thinking about what she could do.  She enrolled in a wood painting and jewelry making course.  Asuman started making jewelery and selling to those around her. When she learned that the municipality was going to open an art bazaar for women, she made an application. She was given a stand and began selling her wood paintings, the jewelry she made, and lingerie that she bought in Istanbul at the bazaar.  Later, she heard from a woman in the stand next to her about Maya and applied for an individual loan.  

Asuman has been working in the bazaar for six years and with Maya for five years. This will be her first Kiva loan. She will use the capital to buy jewelery and wood supplies and to buy a wider variety of lingerie products to increase her sales.

In the future, she wants to increase her profits. With the additional profits, she is considering opening a store.  Asuman would like to get married one day. Asuman is considered by those around her to be determined and reliable.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff and voluunters

Asuman 40 yaşında,bekar ve bir süre evde kardeşinin çocuğuna baktı.  Daha sonra sıkılmaya başladı ve ne yapabilirim diye düşünmeye başladı.  Ahşap boyama ve takı kursuna kayıt oldu.  Asuman takı yapıp,etrafına satmaya başladı.  Belediyenin kadınlar için stand açtığını öğrendi ve başvurdu.  Sanat sokağında Belediyenin standında, ahşap boyama,yaptığı takıları ve İstanbul’dan aldığı çamaşırları satmaya başladı.  Sonra,yan standtaki bir kadından Maya hakkında bilgi aldı ve bireysel kredi için başvurdu.  Asuman bu işi 6 yıldır yapıyor,Maya ile de 5 yıldır çalışıyor.  Bu onun ilk Kiva kredisi.

Bu bütçe ile, takı ve ahşap malzemesi,ve satışlarını arttırmak için, kadın iç çamaşırı çeşidi alacak.

Gelecekte, kazancını arttırmak ve kazandığı ile dükkan açmak istiyor.  Asuman bir gün evlenmeyi arzu ediyor.  Asuman, azimli ve güvenilir.

loans.use: to buy jewelry, wood supplies, and lingerie products.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is married with four children. Myrna is 61 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Myrna is a farmer and grows pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan to purchase feed for her piglets. 

Myrna has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.

loans.use: To purchase 10 sacks of feed and vitamins for her piglets.

loans.name: Channov's Group

texts.en:
A 44-year-old mother of one dependent child who is still in school, Channov is also a farmer who has been farming for 20 years to earn a living in her village located in the Ponhea Krek district. She has been supplementing her income by raising pigs for five years to gain additional income to better support her family. With her current business, she earns around US $2 per day and saves around US $1.50 daily. 

Now Channov leads a group of four female members. This is her first loan with VisionFund. She will use this loan to buy feed for her pigs for US$50. She hopes to feed her pigs to be healthy and earn more income to improve her living conditions and keep her child in school.

loans.use: To buy feed for her pigs

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is a father of 4 children between the ages of 12 and 5 years, with all schooling. He has been producing maize, vegetables and tomatoes for the local market in his home area of Kitale town for the last 10 years.

Simon has requested a loan of 36,400 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He says he wants to diversify his farming so that he can get milk for family consumption as well as for retail, in order to generate more income to meet other basic needs like the education of the children.

He concurs with other farmers on the poor infrastructure and price fluctuation as the major challenges in the farming business. He appreciates Juhudi Kilimo for their loan services.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary, 29, has a grocery shop. She wants to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items for her shop

loans.name: Tawakaal Credit & Savings Group

texts.en: Sebbi is a member of Tawakaal Credit & Savings Group, where members guarantee each other. He is aged 58, with 6 children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a retailer selling bicycles, and at the same time a dairy farmer supplying milk, which has earned him more income. He faces challenges of price fluctuation, which hinder him from buying new stock. Besides that, his vision is expanding his animal farm to new areas. Sebbi has asked for a loan to  buy more bicycles to sell. Out of seven members in the photo, only six have asked for a loan; the other member is still saving, hoping to borrow in the next cycle.

loans.use: to buy more bicycles to sell

loans.name: Dary's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer in Battambang province, Dary is 46-year-old married mother of three dependent children, one of whom is still in school. She and her husband have been cooking food to sell and working for others for a fee. 
Since she lacks of working capital, she is leading a group of three members to apply for loans from VisionFund to save her business. She will use her loan to buy meat, vegetables and ingredients to support food selling business. She hopes to earn more income to expand her business and to support her children’s studying.

loans.use: To buy meat, vegetables and ingredients to support food selling business to support children’s studying.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda has a small business where she sells CDs and also sells lunches. She started off working by selling as a street vendor. She saved enough money to set up a business in her home and she also decided to invest in the necessary utensils to be able to open a small restaurant. Most of her clients come from a nearby school and market. She is requesting the loan in order to invest in a new grill so she may sell barbecued foods. She has four children with her husband. She is optimistic about the loan and hopes she can use the extra profits to provide a better living for her children.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in a grill for her restaurant operation

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Antie Agie sells fabrics, children's wear and ladies' underwear. She is a beneficiary of Kraban Support Foundation's TEACH programme. She is seeking a loan of $750.00 from Kiva. She is hardworking and capable of paying back.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia is 34 years old and has eight children. Her husband is a construction worker. She works making blouses, which she later sells to the women of her neighborhood. Julia is part of a collective consisting of other women in her line of work, and together they will use to loan to purchase fabric, needles, etc. in bulk so they can lower the cost of their supplies and increase their production and profits.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

JULIA TIENE 34 AÑOS Y 8 HIJOS SU ESPOSO TRABAJA EN EL AREA DE LA CONSTRUCCION COMO PEON . JULIA SE DEDICA A LA CONFECCION DE BLUSAS DE MANTA , LAS CUALES POSTERIORMENTE BORDA Y VENDE ENTRE LAS MUJERES DE SU COMUNIDAD PERTENECE AL GRUPO ARCOS 5 QUE ESTA INTEGRADO ADEMAS POR ADELINA GOMEZ D. (CONFECCION Y BORDADO DE BLUSAS ) MARCELA DE LA CRUZ D. ( CONFECCION Y BORDADO DE BLUSAS ) JUNTAS ESPERAN CON EL PRESTAMO COMPRAR TELA DE MANTA , HILOS , TODO AL POR MAYOR LO QUE REBAJA EL COSTO DE LA INVERSION Y AUMENTA LA PRODUCCION DE SUS BLUSAS LAS QUE ESPERAN PODER VENDER EN EL MERCADO DE ARTESANIAS DE LA CIUDAD DE SAN CRISTOBAL A LOS TURISTAS Y ASI OBTENER MAYORES GANANCIAS

loans.use: Purchase supplies to make blouses

loans.name: Kayi

texts.fr:
Born in 1962, Mrs. Kayi E. lives in Aklakou in the Prefecture des Lacs with her six (6) children and her husband. A shopkeeper by profession, she has at her disposal a marketing channel for mats which should a priori be very profitable for her. However, not having enough liquid assets to buy in cash before re-selling, she does not gain a significant profit from her business. Gifted in the management of her income, she is very confident and is capable of productively using a loan of $700, which she is soliciting in order to stockpile mats for resale. This will allow her to increase her revenue and thereby change her quality of life.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1962, Madame E. Kayi réside à Aklakou dans la Préfecture des Lacs avec ses six (6) enfants et son mari. Commerçante de profession, elle exploite un canal de commercialisation de nattes qui devrait a priori lui être très rentable. Cependant n’ayant pas l’argent liquide pour acheter au comptant avant de revendre, elle ne tire pas profit de façon significative de son commerce. Douée dans la gestion de ses revenus, elle est très confiante et se sent capable de pouvoir utiliser à bon escient un crédit de $700 qu’elle sollicite pour faire un stockage de nattes afin de revendre. Ceci lui permettra d’accroître son chiffre d’affaire et changer ainsi sa qualité de vie.

loans.use: To stockpile woven mats for resale

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina N. is 36 years old, widowed and has three children. She also takes care of two of her brother's children. Her husband passed away when her first born was only seven. She runs a small hair salon that is located via a path, deep in the center of the Rubaga District of Kampala.

Robina has owned the business at this location for the past seven years. She has attained two loans which she has had no problems paying off. She plans to use the next loan to buy cosmetics, shampoo, hair dye and braids. It is not unusual to see women with beautifully braided hair in Rubaga.

Robina is a very confident woman. She talks about her finances openly and knows what she needs to do to improve her and her children's lives. Some interesting facts about her finances:

- On a good day she may gross $5.00 US.

- Her rent is $30.00 per month.

- She currently has no place of her own, so she often sleeps at the salon.

- Her children stay with a friend, though she sees them everyday.

- She is trying to grow her business so that she can afford rent and have her children back under one roof.

(If you would like to learn more, please check out the Fellows Blog: The Women of Rubaga)

loans.use: To increase her inventory of shampoo, cosmetics, hair dye and braids.

loans.name: Viviana

texts.es:
Mrs. Viviana lives in her own house in the area of Pasankeri ladera oeste of the City La Paz with her husband and her three sons; Mrs. Viviana works as a store clerk for a clothing store. With the loans that she previously received she fixed four of the rooms in her house and installed a fence in the front of her house. This new credit will be used to fix the interior walls and structure of her house. This is the third time that she is asking for a loan and the credit analysis performed shows that she is a favorable candidate and that she should be capable of repaying this new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Felipe Salcedo, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Viviana vive en casa propia en la zona de Pasankeri ladera oeste de la Ciudad de La Paz con su esposo y su tres hijos, la señora Viviana trabaja como empleada en una tienda de venta de ropa. Con los créditos anteriores realizaron la refacción de cuatro habitaciones y el amurallado frontal de su vivienda. El crédito solicitado será destinado a la construcción de su vivienda en estructura y muros interiores. Esta es la tercera ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: To fix the interior walls and structure of her house

loans.name: Pene

texts.en: The school field is the place where Pene spends most of her time from Monday to Friday. She is a mother who is 55 years of age and has five children. Her canteen is the most important thing in her daily work. She earns $100.00-$200.00 WST ($40-80 USD) a week from selling banana salad and pancakes and she uses that money to support her school children and her family remittances.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her snacks business

loans.name: Arzu

texts.en: Arzu is a resident of Baku, but she lives in Sumgayit City now. She has been engaged in mobile clothing and household goods sales for three years. She travels with the goods and sometimes sells them from her house. She has many good clients that know her and buy goods from her. Now she is a bit short in her goods. She has taken loans from Normicro Sumgayit branch and successfully repaid them back. Now she applies again for a loan to increase the number of her items in inventory that she sells.

loans.use: To increase the number and variety of goods

loans.name: Lamin

texts.en:
Lamin sells jewels and cosmetics in Kabala in Sierra Leone.

Married with a wife and six children, Lamin has to generate sufficient income to meet his family's expenses. With his last loan, Lamin was able to purchase more goods and sell them on wholesale to retailers in the villages.

He would like to increase his wholesale activity and also involve his wife in the business. He is therefore requesting a loan of $350 (Le.1,000,000) for that purpose.

loans.use: Lamin has a vision of working in partnership with his wife to run the business and to increase his wholesale activities.

loans.name: Abdusattor

texts.ru:
Abdusattor G. is 63 years old, married and has 4 children. He is a mathematics professor at the Tadjik National Unviersity. Three sons and a daughter are married. He has 7 grandchildren. He owns a house, but the construction is not finished yet. The price of cement continues to increase. Abdusattor would like to borrow 4100 TJS to purchase cement and finish building his house.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Гафаров Абдусаттор возрост 63 года , женат имеет 4 детй работает учителем математики в Таджикском Государственном Универститете.Три сына женаты, дочь замужем.Жена Абдусаттора .Абдусаттор имеет 7 внуков.Он имеет свой дом,постройка которого еще не закончена.Для этого он хочет взять кредит.Ему необходимо купить в данное время цемент , так как цемент заметно дорожает .Еиу нужно 4100 сомони.

loans.use: потребительский займ

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Señora Bertha P. T. is 42 years old and has five years of secondary education. She has four children, but only two of the younger ones are still dependent on her. She lives in the neighbourhood of Aurora Díaz, district of Salaverry in La Libertad department, Peru.

When she began her business, she was selling clothing for men, women, and children. Her neighbours, acquaintances, and friends asked her for loans which they didn’t always pay back on time. As a result she gradually began to lose her capital and finally decided to quit the clothing business. She decided to prepare stuffed potatoes in the afternoons, at the beginning selling them from house to house. As time passed and she became better known, people started to come to her house to buy the prepared food.

She belongs to the Community Bank “Jerid—Camino al Exito”, from which she obtained her first loan of S/. 300.00. With this money she bought a range of underwear. She will pay off the new loan of S/. 800.00 in six months. With it she will buy a bag of potatoes, a can of oil, and disposable plates and forks. Her greatest dream is to open a hardware store with a full range of products that she can sell at low prices.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Bertha P. T. tiene 42 años de edad, estudio hasta el quinto año de secundaria. Tiene cuatro hijos pero solo dos menores aun dependen de ella. Vive en el sector Aurora Díaz en el distrito de Salaverry en el departamento La Libertad – Perú.

Cuando inicio su negocio vendía ropa para dama, caballero y niños. le hacían pedidos sus vecinos, conocidos y amigos pero a veces no le cancelaban a la fecha y poco a poco se descapitalizaba así que decidió dejar ese negocio. Tuvo la idea de prepara papa rellena por las tardes, al principio ofrecía de casa en casa con el tiempo se ha hecho conocida ahora la gente la busca en su casa para comprarle sus preparados.

Ella pertenece al Banco Comunal “Jerid- Camino al Éxito” lugar donde obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 con este dinero compró una variedad de ropa interior. Con el préstamo de S/. 800.00 el cual pagara en seis meses comprará un saco de papa, un bidón de aceite, platos y tenedores descartables. Su mayor sueño es poner una ferretería con todos sus implementos en donde ofrezca productos a precios cómodos.

loans.use: She will use the loan to buy ingredients for her products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy used women's clothing.

loans.name: Kayi

texts.fr:
Mrs. Kayi A. was born June 6th in Lomé. She is married and the mother of four children all going to school. She is a retailer of basic goods in the Agoè neighborhood of northwest Lomé. She started doing business in 1998 and makes significant sales on market days because she displays her merchandise at Agoè’s market. The first credit she obtained allowed her to stock rice which increased her sales in November and December, especially during holiday periods, producing good results. After prompt repayment of this first loan, she is seeking a loan of 500,000 Francs CFA to buy three bags of sugar, ten bags of rice, seven drums of vegetable oil, and six cases of canned goods.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer

Madame A. Kayi est née le 6 juin 1961 à Lomé. Elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants tous scolarisés. Elle est une revendeuse des produits de premières nécessités dans le quartier d’Agoè au nord ouest de Lomé. Elle a commencé cette activité depuis 1998 et réalise de chiffre d’affaires important les jours de marché car elle expose ses marchandises dans le marché d’Agoè. Le premier crédit qu’elle avait obtenu lui a permis de faire le stock de riz ; et ceci lui a permis de bien vendre dans le mois de novembre et de décembre surtout pendant les périodes de fêtes et de dégager de bons résultats. Après un prompt remboursement de ce premier crédit, elle sollicite un crédit de 500.000FCFA afin d’acheter 3 sacs de sucre, 10 sacs de riz, 7 bidons d’huile végétale et 6 cartons de concave.

loans.use: Purchase basic goods merchandise

loans.name: Yao

texts.fr:
Mr. Yao Gossoou was born in 1978. He was forced to abandon his studies in High School because his family lacked the funds to support his education. He learned refrigerator reparation and other similar devices. However, he did not have the funds necessary to purchase the tools he needed to practice this profession. And so, he turned to farming, in particular corn. The father of two children, he is able to support his family because of this enterprise. Currently, he is asking for a loan that will help him to enlarge his field thereby helping to contribute to the improvement of his family's living conditions.

Translated from French to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Monsieur G. Yao est né en 1978. Il a arrêté ses études en classe de seconde par manque de moyen financier et se retrouve en apprentissage. Il a appris la réparation des congélateurs et autres appareils de froid. Mais n’ayant pas les moyens nécessaires pour acheter le matériel nécessaire pour l’exercice de son métier, il est revenu au village pour embrasser la culture du maïs. Père de deux (2) enfants, il arrive à subvenir aux besoins du foyer grâce au revenu de son champ. A présent, il sollicite un crédit qui va lui permettre d’agrandir son champ afin d’augmenter ses revenu et par conséquent contribuer davantage à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To enlarge his field

loans.name: Mchanga's Jitahidini Group

texts.en:
Mchanga is 30 years and married with 3 children aged 2, 4 and 3. She also takes care of 2 other children aged 6 and 8 years old. She became a food seller in 2004. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

In the past, Mchanga has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Mchanga now hopes for a loan to buy more fish for resale and to start a new business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who also have businesses dealing with bicycle spare sales, snacks sales, juice sales, charcoal and firewood sales.

loans.use: To buy more fish for resale and to start new business.

loans.name: Meas

texts.en:
Meas N., 34, a pig farmer who lives with three of her children in Kampong Cham, Cambodia, typically makes $6.50 in revenue per day while her husband, a construction worker who builds houses, earns about $4 each day. 

Despite the rapidly rising cost of pig feed and the loss of the occasional pig to disease, Meas is requesting a loan from Kiva to purchase more feed and more pigs to increase her livestock holdings.

loans.use: To purchase more  pig feed and pigs to add to her livestock.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es: Fernando es propietario de un motocarro, el mismo que maneja y con el que trabajar para una distribuidora de agua de mesa. Se siente muy contento de contar con este oficio. Tiene 47 años de edad y es padre de 3 hijos que estudian y son sus ganas de seguir adelante. Posteriormente quiere dedicarse a esta actividad, pero como un negocio propio, para ello quiere comprar envases y otros materiales necesario, por ello solicita este préstamo, para poder lograr su propósito. Con tu ayuda, harás posible el sueño de este padre empeñoso y trabajador.
texts.en:
Fernando owns a motorcycle and he himself is the driver. He works as distributer of potable water and he feels very happy to have this job. He is 47 years old and he is the father of 3 children, all of whom are attending school. They are his reason to keep going. He wants to keep doing the same activity but he wants to run his own business. To set up he wishes to purchase empty containers and other necessary items. For this he is requesting a loan, so that he can achieve his goal. With your help, you will make the dreams of this hard working father possible.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To acquire the necessary items to set up his own business selling potable water.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario es estudiante de Odontología y esta realizando practicas, por lo cual se decidió abrir un pequeño consultorio dental para que pueda realizar mecánica dental y curaciones y extracciones a los vecinos de la zona de Llojeta-tiwiña y familiares que lo conozcan ya que no cuenta con todo el equipo completo para realizar su actividad.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de un sillón dental; esto le ayudará de gran manera ya que mejorará las condiciones de atención a sus clientes, podrá abarcar a mas clientes y mejoraran sus ingresos.
Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, y la segunda vez que requiere el apoyo de kiva. Su historial lo califica como cliente responsable en el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Mario is a dentistry student who is in his training period and as such, has decided to open a small dental surgery where he can carry out dental procedures, treatments and extractions. He plans to do this for his neighbors in the Llojeta-tiwiña area and his family members who know him well as he doesn't count on having the full equipment for his activities.

He is asking for the loan to purchase a dentist's chair; this will be a great help as it will improve the conditions he offers his clients, enabling him to cope with more clients and improve his revenue.

This is the second time he requests a loan from Impro and the second time he asks for Kiva's help. His loan history qualifies him as a responsible customer who pays his installments.


Translated from Spanish by Ines Teles, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a reclining dentist's chair for his dental surgery

loans.name: Yuseff

texts.es: Yuseff tiene 30 años, es soltero y vive solo. Se dedica al cultivo de café y de plátanos, actividad que realiza desde hace 10 años, siendo la siembra lo que más le agrada dentro de todas sus actividades agrícolas. La venta de café es algo rentable, por la calidad de producto que se produce en la zona, la cual es de mayor demanda en el mercado, auque lo difícil es sembrarlas y secar los granos de café para luego ser comercializados. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP. Yuseff tiene pensado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de abonos para que sus plantaciones puedan producir mayor cantidad y con mejor calidad.
texts.en:
Yuseff is 30 years old, he is single and lives alone. He cultivates coffe and plantains, an activity that he has realized for 10 years, seeding being the the activity that he likes the most among all of his other agricultural actities. The sale of coffee is profitable, because of the quality of product that is produced in the region. It is of the highest demand in the market, although it is difficult to sow coffee plants and dry the beans so that later they can be commercialized. This is his first loan with MFP. Yuseff is thinking of investing the money he is asking for to buy fertilizers so that his plantations will be able to produce greater quantities, of better quality as well.

Translated from Spanish by Matt Capetola, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to increase the size and quality of his crops.

loans.name: Shapoor

texts.en:
Shapoor K. is 33 years old.  He is married and lives with his family, in Ningarhar province .  Shapoor has 2 children, who go to school.  His brother works with him on the agricultural lands that they own. They share a single house. After his father died, Shapoor became the responsible person for the household.

Besides farming, Shapoor is a teacher .  He teaches in a public school in the morning, and in the afternoon he works as a farmer in his village. He grows different kinds of vegetables and sells them in the bazaar.  Along with the farming, he has livestock.  His small son brings grass for the animals.
 
Shapoor is a hardworking man, but there are 14 members in his family and supporting that many people with only 500 Afghanis ($10) a day income is almost impossible.  He therefore has to expand his business.  He thinks that if he buys more livestock and seed for his land, he can increase his income. He has requested AFSG for a 50000(AF) ($1,075) loan.  He has decided to buy a cow and with the remaining loan, purchase seed and pesticide. 

Shapoor K. dreams of the day that he solves all his economic problems and can concentrate on teaching.

loans.use: Purchase livestock of seed

loans.name: Lucio

texts.es:
El señor Lucio C. Aruquipa vive en casa propia, en la zona  de Pasankeri, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz con su esposa, la señora Primitiva Laymeguanca.
El señor Lucio trabaja como albañil en construcciones particulares de nuestra ciudad y su esposa es comerciante ambulante.
Con anteriores créditos construyeron dos habitaciones en obra gruesa, las mismas que quieren concluir para que su esposa pueda poner una tienda de barrio y así poder tener mejores ingresos para su familia.
El crédito es para la construcción en obra fina de dos habitaciones: un dormitorio y una  tienda.
Esta es la quinta vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califican favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Lucio C. Aruquipa lives in his own house in the Pasankeri zone, the western hillside, of La Paz city, with his wife Primitiva Laymeguanca. Lucio works as a construction worker in the city and his wife is a street vendor. With previous loans they built two basic rooms, which they would now like to finish construction on so that his wife can run a neighborhood store and earn more money for their family. The loan will be used to finish construction on the two rooms: one will serve as a bedroom and the other will be the store. This is their fifth loan request and the analysis of their application qualified them to receive this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To finish construction of a bedroom and store in their house.

loans.name: Rahim

texts.ru: Ахмедов Рахим проживает в городе Вахдат. Возраст 46 лет , женат  имеет троих детей. Уже 15 лет занимается бизнесом . Торгует на центральном рынке города. Торгует обувью. Товар поставляет сам из города ДУшанбе. Его  бизнес является основным источником дохода его семьи. Бизнес дает доход , которого хватает для того, чтобы обеспечить свою семью. Теперь он хочет получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Rahim A. lives in the town of Vakhdat. He is 46 years old and is married with three children. He has 15 years of business experience. He brings shoes from Dushanbe and sells them at Vakhdat's central market. His business is his family's main source of income, and it is profitable enough for supporting the whole family. Now Rahim would like get a loan in order to increase cash flow. He would pay off the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase cash flow

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.en:
F. Gulnora is 54 years old. She is married with three children. Gulnora is an economist with the higher education. Together with the help of her son she is providing the computer services: typing and printing of the texts, scanning and editing of the files and other computer services. Today Zaynura requests $ 1000 US Dollars with the purpose to purchase new computer for improving the quality of her business. Also the part of the loan she is planning to spend for purchasing a new printer. She promises to repay the loan within 12 months. Your support will really help her. Be an important part of the growth of Gulnora’s business. 

More about Tajikistan
Tajikistan, a key post on the Silk Road, is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country, with its epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only 7 per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands of people to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

More about IMON International
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase a new computer and printer

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice Y. is 36 years old. She is married with two children. Both are in school; junior high and the basic schools. She is a seamstress by profession. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Mampong, in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Her husband is a farmer.

Beatrice owns a shop in which she works. She procures all kinds of materials from Kumasi and sews many designs for sale. She also sews for clients who come with their own materials. Beatrice has some apprentices who are in training. According to her, a number of the apprentices have graduated and run their own businesses. She has been in the business for twenty years.

She wants a loan to procure more materials and other sewing accessories. She hopes to sponsor her children in school to higher levels.

loans.use: Procure more fabrics and sewing accessories.

loans.name: Wan Word Group

texts.en:
This is Massah M. Z., Fereh Musu C., Mabel S., Adama B. and Isatu B. K.. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs have requested from SMT/Kiva. Each of them is requesting a loan of Le 500,000. With this loan, each will be able to increase the size and quality of their business and consequently make better profit and improve their standard of living.

Massah (second from left) is the leader of this group. Massah is fifty years of age. She was born in Lumpa, twenty miles from Freetown, the capital city of Sierra Leone. She is married to a professional worker and the two of them have one child who is presently in college. Massah sells soap, bottled water and “patched” groundnuts (roasted peanuts). She has been in this business for three years now.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Mujeres Rompiendo Barreras Group

texts.en:
Juana S. C. is the group coordinator for the Bank of Hope group called "Mujeres Rompiendo Barreras," which means "Women Breaking Barriers".  Juana owns a nail salon in her local community, and after hearing about a friend's experience with Esperanza, decided to take out a loan to invest in her business.  With this first loan, Juana plans to buy materials and beauty products to use and sell in her salon - or as it is called here in the Dominican Republic, "Salon D. Uñas."  

Juana is the mother of two young children and hopes that they can grow up to be professionals.  Juana also dreams about growing her business with more customers.  Part of Esperanza's mission is to liberate children from poverty and we believe (and have seen) that giving mothers a loan can really improve the standards of living for the whole family, because most if not all of the profit goes directly into the household.

Juana's portion of this group loan will be about $140 and she plans to pay back about $15 every couple of weeks.  Juana would like to thank Kiva lenders for their support!

On behalf of Juana S. C., Mujeres Rompiendo Barreras, and all of us here at Esperanza International, thank you for your support!

loans.use: To buy materials and beauty products for her nail salon.

loans.name: Hourna

texts.fr: Cette femme est mariée et mère de 2 enfants, elle vit avec sa famille dans le quartier d’atikoumé qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de Lomé. Elle a ouvert depuis 2006, un bar qu’elle a appelé « MAQUIS CLEVER », elle réalise beaucoup de recette les week-ends, elle veut réaménager son local  et acheter des casiers de bière raison pour laquelle elle s’adresse à WAGES pour solliciter son premier crédit pour acheter 15 casiers de bière et des matériaux pour réapprovisionner son bar.
texts.en:
This lady is married and the mother of 2 children. She lives with her family in the Atikoumé neighborhood, an outlying district of the city of Lomé. Since 2006 she has been running a bar that she calls « MAQUIS CLEVER ». She takes in a lot of money on the weekends. She would like to refurbish her bar and buy some crates of beer, which is why she has come to WAGES to ask for her first loan to buy 15 crates of beer and some materials to outfit her bar.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of crates of beer and materials for refurbishing the bar

loans.name: Wédayamana 1(Confiance En Soi-Même) Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Wédayamana 1  est un regroupement de femmes mariées du village de Sirakélé de la ville de Koutiala région de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies avec  en moyenne 35ans et au moins 5 enfants.
Elles excellent uniquement   dans la culture de l’arachide.
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe   Wédayamana 1 ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant cinq ans. Après avoir correctement remboursés  les quatre prêts précédents, elles sont à leur cinquième  prêt de campagne.
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter, des semences d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants pour la culture,  au grand marché de Koutiala ville. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de Koutiala et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe Wédayamana 1 comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 65 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The Wédayamana 1 Group is a group of married women from the village of Sirakélé in the main city of Koutiala in the Sikasso region (Mali's third administrative region). The women live in traditional large, extended families and have an average age of 35 and at least five children each. Their sole business is growing peanuts. Anxious to make their agricultural business profitable, the members of the Wédayamana 1 Group decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program five years ago. Having fully repaid their first four loans, they are now on their fifth farming loan. The current loan will be used to buy peanut seeds and small items of farm equipment and fertilizer at the main market in Koutiala. At the end of the off-season, the harvested crops are placed in storage for a certain period to gain value before being sold at the main market of Koutiala and surrounding markets at retail (and often wholesale) prices. The produce is sold for cash to customers who generally come from the large towns. Once their agricultural produce has been sold, the members of the Wédayamana 1 Group each expect to make a profit of CFA 65,000, which will be used to repay the loan interest and to cover everyday family expenses.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seeds and minor supplies

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary N. is forty-seven years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, two sons and two daughters. All are currently in senior high and junior high schools. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town in the Western region called Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso. She is a hard-working woman.

Mary runs a provisions store. She sells groceries such as Milo (cocoa powder), sugar, rice, candies, bread, etc. in a store on the street. She has been in business for over twenty years now and wants a loan to buy more provisions to expand her business. She is hopeful to improve her standard of living and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy provisions to sell

loans.name: Yawel Group

texts.fr: Nous sommes un groupe de 05 hommes habitant dans  l'écovillage de Palmarin (http://www.sem-fund.org/palmarinfr.php) et nous sommes venus solliciter un prêt à Kiva pour nous adonner à l'activité de commerce et d'élevage. Nous cherchons des financements qui pourront nous aider à créer des activités génératrices de revenu étant donné que notre âge ne nous permet plus de nous adonner à des activités fougueuses. Nous voulons rester sur place et développer notre écovillage. Avec le prêt, nous voudrions acheter des caprins pour faire un peu d’embouche mais aussi y allier les activités de commerce de fourrages et de denrées alimentaires (huile de palme, tamarin, pâte d’arachide).
texts.en:
We are a group of five men who live in the ecological center of Palmarin (http://www.sem-fund.org/palmarinfr.php). We have come to request a loan through Kiva to enable us to move ahead with our business activities and the raising of animals. We are looking for financing to assist us in creating business revenue that would not be overly demanding due to our advanced age. We would like to remain in Palmarin and develop our ecological center. With this loan we would like to buy goats to raise for food along with the business of selling farm products and staple food items such as palm oil, tamarin and peanut butter.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To be used for raising farm animals

loans.name: Khan

texts.en:
Mrs. S. Khan, 33, has been a silk weaver for eight years – a skill she learned from her sister. She sells her finished products to a middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell at the market in Phnom Penh. Her husband, Mr. Chamroeun Chea, 36, has been a mason for about seven years.

S. has requested one previous loan from Kiva through MAXIMA. Now she is asking for a second loan of $1100 US to purchase silk materials to continue her silk weaving business.

S. and her husband live in a small village across the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They married in 1995 and have two children: one son and one daughter. Both children are in school and assist their mother with the silk weaving business when they are not in school.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for a silk weaving business

loans.name: Presentacion

texts.en:
Presentacion J., age 52, is from the village of Lantay, Pangantucan Bukidnon. Presentacion is widowed and has eight grown children. To make a living, Presentacion runs a sari-sari, which is a general store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Presentacion has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Presentacion joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services. Her goal was to help improve her living situation and to increase her ability to engage in business activities. Presentacion has successfully repaid one previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Presentacion is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income and to pay debts.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: du labour et des engrais

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 42 años de edad, vive en pareja con  Estela de 40 años, ambos conviven hace más de 10 años y poseen un hijo de 7 años que va a la escuela primaria. 
 Carlos desde muy pequeño se dedicó a la carpintería, comenzó trabajando como ordenanza, después de varios años de trabajo fue ascendiendo ya como carpintero profesional, trabajó muy duro durante 18 años y con el ahorro que pudo juntar durante esos años  decidió independizare. 
 Tal es así que hoy día cuenta con su propia carpintería, negocio que le va muy bien por que gracias a su esfuerzo constante consiguió muy buena clientela y tiene trabajo durante todo el año. Todos los días empieza su trabajo desde muy temprana horas del día. 
Esta muy conforme con su actividad como carpintero por que es una profesión que siempre le ha gustado y además posee el apoyo de su señora. 
En esta oportunidad solicita el préstamo para la compra de más  materia prima (madera) debido a que tiene una oferta que quiere aprovechar.

loans.use: Compra de madera.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi K. is single and has no educational background.  Esi sells smoked fish at Elmina near Teterem, which she has been doing since the year 1989. Esi uses her income in paying of utility bills.  Esi will use the loan to buy more fish to smoke. With the new profits from her expanded business, Esi plans to save to build.
To smoke her fish, she goes to the sea shore to buy fresh fish form the sea men. She comes home with the fishes cleans or dresses them and drains the water that comes about as a result of washing the fish. She prepares her traditionally make oven with firewood to smoke her fish for sale.

loans.use: Esi will use the loan to buy more fish to smoke.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is a 37-year-old married mother of five children, three of whom are in school. She is a food vendor who sells kenkey. Kenkey is prepared from milled maize grains and is taken with hot pepper or soup. Comfort has many customers since kenkey is enjoyed by many Ghanaians as breakfast, lunch and supper.

Comfort wants to use her loan to buy more raw materials, such as bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She hopes to be able to put aside some savings as an investment for the future.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials, such as maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is 45 years old, divorced, and the mother of two children. All her children are in school through the proceeds from her business. She has been sewing for 15 years and has rich experience in customer service and just in time (JIT) delivery to her customers. She is a specialist in female clothing and sews various styles that give her customers a new look. She sews school uniforms, church attire, kaba and slit (tailored top and long skirt), wedding dresses, funeral clothes, etc.

Comfort wants to use the loan to buy increased supplies of sewing materials like linen, thread, thimbles, etc. to increase her output and efficiency. (She mostly buys her raw materials from Togo.) Through her dedication and hard work, she has eight apprentices whom she is giving quality training for their future occupation. She hopes to increase her savings to provide her children with quality education. She needs the loan within this season so that she can increase her profit as customers order their Christmas dresses from her.

loans.use: To buy increased  of sewing supplies.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is thirty-one years old. She is married and has two children who are currently in school.

Jennifer is a trader who trades in sponges for all purposes. She sells at the big markets in Accra. She is, however, convinced that her business can grow better with increased capital and therefore wants the loan to buy more sponges to increase her stock. She believes your support would help her grow her business.

loans.use: To purchase assorted sponges in bulk

loans.name: María Herminia

texts.es:
María tiene 30 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos y vive desde hace tres años junto a su cuñada en el sector Punto Nueve, distrito de Mochumí, ubicado a media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace 5 años se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores en su domicilio, los corrales donde los cría están construidos de barro, adobe y carrizo. Usualmente cría pavos, patos, chanchos, pollos y chivos los cuales engorda para luego venderlos en el mercado Moshoqueque (mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Chiclayo) o a los negociantes que eventualmente frecuentan la zona. Por otro lado se dedica a la elaboración y venta de chicha (bebida tìpica hecha a base de maíz). Estos ingresos son los únicos con los que cuenta para solventar sus gastos familiares.

Ella se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de alimentos balanceados para sus aves y cerdos.

Su más grande anhelo es poder terminar de construir su casa, que está construída de material rústico, ya que las lluvias que se presentan durante los meses de verano siempre debilitan sus estructuras. Ella es una madre trabajadora, responsable y que ha sabido salir adelante a pesar de su condición de madre soltera.
texts.en:
María is 30 years old, a single mother with 2 children, and has lived for the last 3 years with her sister-in-law in the Punto Nueve sector of Mochumí district, located half an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

For 5 years she has been raising and selling small livestock from her home. The corrals in which she raises them are constructed of clay, adobe and reeds. Usually, she raises turkeys, ducks, pigs, chickens, and goats, which she fattens in order to sell them in Moshoqueque, the wholesale market for Chiclayo, or to the traders who frequent the zone. She also dedicates herself to making and selling chicha (the typical local corn drink). These are the only income sources on which she can count to pay family expenses.

She is soliciting a loan through EDPYME Alternativa for the first time. María needs 1,000 new sols to invest in buying feed for a balanced diet for her birds and pigs.

Her greatest wish is to be able to finish constructing her house, which is made of rustic material, since the rain that comes during the winter months always damages such structures.

She is a hard-working and responsible mother who has been able to advance, despite her condition as a single mother.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY A BALANCED DIET FOR THE BIRDS AND PIGS SHE RAISES AND SELLS

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase embroidery materials & pay for vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Dan

texts.en:
30-year-old Dan is a rice farmer from Agusan Del Sur. He works hard so he can provide, food, clothes and his family’s other needs. One of his motivations is his children’s future. He wants all of them to finish school and be successful someday. In farming, he experiences failures and successes, and accepts both as part of life.

Dan recently joined CEVI to gain access to its financial services. He is now requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which he will use to purchase farming needs like seeds and fertilizers. Receiving this loan will be really helpful to Dan’s farming.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Vanessa

texts.es:
Vanessa es una joven de 22 años es soltera, ella desde niña ayudaba a la madre en la con el cuidado del ganado lechero que tienen, ella desea independizarse y tener sus propio ganado lechero. Actualmente ella trabaja de día en el cuidado de sus 3 cabezas de ganado lechero y también ayudando a la madre y por la noche está estudiando una carrera técnica (CONTABILIDADA GENERAL).

Vanessa vive en la ciudad de Cochabamba en la comunidad de la maica sud, ella vive con sus padres, su actividad principal es la producción de la leche cruda, cuyo producto entregan a una empresa que dedica a la producción de diferentes productos lácteos, actualmente tiene 3 cabezas de ganado lechero.El préstamo será destinado para la compra de una cabeza de ganado lechero, con lo cual incrementara la cantidad de producción de la leche y mejorara sus ingresos.

Entre sus sueños y metas es terminar se estudiar, temer su casa propia y aumentar la cantidad de ganado lechero y finalmente que en futuro cuando termine la carrera pueda trabajar de su profesión.
texts.en:
Vanesa is a single, 22 year old young woman. Since she was a young girl she helped her mother take care of the cattle that she has. She wants to become independent and have her own livestock. She currently works in the daytime taking care of their three head of dairy cows and helping her mother. In the evening she is studying for a technical career (General Accounting). Vanessa lives with her parents in the city of Cochabamba in the Maica Sud community. Her main activity is producing raw milk. She delivers her product to a business that produces different dairy products. She currently has three head of dairy cows. The loan is to buy a dairy cow, which will increase milk production and improve her income. Among her dreams and goals is finishing school, having her own house, and getting more cattle. In the future, when she finishes her studies, she wants to be able to work in her profession .

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Nget's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of five people who will each use the loan for a different purpose. Mrs. Nget M. is the group leader who has been selected by the members who all reside in Prey Robang village in Takeo province.

Mrs. Nget M. is a weaver and her husband, Mr. Roeurng S., is a farmer who owns 1.5 hectares (3.75 acres) of land on which he grows crops to support his family. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Nget M. decided to request a loan to buy silk for weaving.

Mrs. Nget M. is the mother of five children, two of whom are weavers while the others are attending the local public school.

loans.use: To buy silk for weaving

loans.name: Pascalia

texts.en:
Pascalia P. is a local businesswoman who does dairy farming, a business she went into after ditching poultry farming for economic reasons. She started her business in 2009 as an income generator for the family and does it at Namable Center where she also stays with her family

Pascalia gets her dairy stock from the local farmers but she has big dreams. She would like to increase her stock to be able to have sufficient income to build a better housing structure for her chickens. Then she would revive her poultry farming business and be able to run two businesses. That would assure her enough money to support her family. To be able to realize this, she wants a loan for Ksh.20000. She is 38 years old and married with four children. Her dream is to expand and run a big business.

loans.use: To increase her stock and build a better place for her animals

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia M. is currently in the business of selling various foodstuffs at a restaurant. She is requesting a loan to stock more rice and beans in the restaurant. Nadia is 47 years old and widowed. She has six children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children and pay rent for her house.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more rice and beans in the restaurant

loans.name: Lydiah

texts.en: Lydiah W. K. is 36 years old, married and has two children, who are 13 and five years old. For the last six years, she has made a living running a general store where she sells household items, beverages and hair products. Her business is located at a place called Ruiru in Thika town. She has applied for a loan of Kes 80,000 to buy more items to sell to her customers and to open outlets in other parts of the town. She is a very hardworking businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers

loans.name: Jessika Mayra

texts.es:
Jessika, tiene 31 años, es soltera y es natural de Cusco. Ella es profesora egresada de la Universidad Nacional San Antonio Abad del Cusco. Actualmente, Su actividad principal es ser profesora del colegio “Túpac Amaru II” de la ciudad de Sicuani. Su actividad económica complementaria es la producción artesanal de Yogurt y los vende los fines de semana. Ya es un año que se dedica a la venta yogurt y le va muy bien. Jessika es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario salir adelante, ella requiere el préstamo para comprar ollas que sirve para hacer hervir la leche. El anhelo de la socia es abrir una fábrica de producción de mantequilla, queso y yogurt.       

Jessika pertenece al banco comunal “LOS DIAMANTES” de la Asociación Arariwa. El banco comunal tiene 10 ciclos de funcionamiento, la socia manifiesta, que se encuentra contenta y satisfecha con los servicios de crédito, ahorro y capacitación y por el tiempo de permanencia en el banco comunal y también se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Jessika is 31 years old. She is single and is a native of Cusco. She has a degree in teaching from the National University San Antonio Abad of Cusco. Now her main activity is teaching at the Túpac Amaru II school in Sicuani. Her supplemental economic activity is the production of artisanal yogurt, which she sells on weekends. She began selling yogurt a year ago, and it is going very well. Jessika is a hard-working and entrepreneurial woman who always looks for opportunities to advance with her daily efforts.

She needs the loan to buy pots for boiling milk. Her dream is to open a factory to produce butter, cheese, and yogurt.

Jessika belongs to the community bank "Los diamantes" (the diamonds) of the Arariwa Association. The bank has been functioning for 10 loan cycles, and this member declares that she is content and satisfied with the credit services, savings, and training for the time that she has been a bank member. She is also grateful for the opportunity offered through the loan and promises to make her payments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pots

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
Teresa De Jesús  C. es socia del banco Atenas del Ecuador lleva 8 años en el, vive en  la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca  capital de la provincia del Azuay situada en la parte meridional de la Cordillera andina ecuatoriana; es la tercera ciudad de mayor importancia en el Ecuador y se caracteriza por mantener la tranquilidad y hermosura de una ciudad antigua con su  centro histórico que  fue declarado Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad por la UNESCO en el año 1999. 

Nuestra socia es divorciada hace 2 años por  la infidelidad de su pareja, tiene 55 años de edad y tiene cuatro  hijos quienes tienen  37, 28, 22 y 17 años de edad, sus tres primeros hijos son casados y sólo uno de  ellos vive en su casa compartiendo los gastos del hogar y estudios de su hermano de 17 años así como pago del arriendo porque no tienen casa propia.

 Teresa realiza varias  actividades entre  ellas  vende  pinchos hace cuatro meses, también elabora guaipe (Trapos para limpiar) hace un año y realiza la limpieza de oficinas dos veces por semana de 2pm a 6pm, como es una mujer hiperactiva vende peluches sobre todo para fechas especiales.   Con el nuevo crédito va a comprar carne, palillos, papas, salsas  para sus pinchos, y también comprar peluches y algo  para el estudio de su hijo.

Su meta es llegar a tener un negocio grande de venta de comida.
texts.en:
Teresa De Jesús C. has been a member of the bank Atenas del Ecuador for 8 years. She lives in a suburb of Cuenca city, capital of the Azuay province, located in the southern part of the Ecuatorian Andean ranges. This is the third most important city in Ecuador, and is characterised by its tranquility and beauty. It is an historical city and its city centre was declared a world heritage site by UNESCO in 1999. Our member has been divorced for 2 years, because of the infidelity of her partner. She is 55 years old and has 4 children - 37, 28, 22 and 17 years old. The first three children are married and only one lives with her in her house, sharing the household costs and studies, paying the rent because they don't have their own home. Teresa does various activities, including selling snacks for the past 4 months, and has also been making guaipes (cleaning clothes) for a year. She also cleans offices twice a week from 2pm - 6pm. As she is a hyperactive woman she also sells wigs, mainly for special events. With this new loan she will buy meat, toothpicks, potatoes, sauces for her snacks, purchase some wigs, and also help her son's studies. Her goals is to have a large food sale business.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for food, wigs, and assist paying studies

loans.name: Vanny's Group

texts.en: Mr. Vanny H. is 35 years old and lives in Roleang Kaen village in Kandal province. He is the leader of this group loan, and was selected by its 4 members. Each member of this group loan will use the loan to support their different purposes. Mr. Vanny H. and his wife are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice. Aside from farming, Mr. Vanny H. also makes sugar palm so he can earn a small income to support his family. In order to increase his income to improve his family's living conditions, Mr. Vanny H. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. All of the couple's three children attend school.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Sor Dolores

texts.en:
Sor Dolores M. is from the village of District 4. She is 36 years old and single. To make a living, Sor Dolores owns and operates a business that provides photocopying services. She has been engaged in her business for more than 12 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month. To provide additional income, she also manages a general store.

In 2006, Sor Dolores joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from ASKI. That loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide service. Sor Dolores is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP to be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Sor Dolores from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 40 years old. She is married with 4 children who are all adults now. She is a farmer from Nyamira town in Western Kenya where she has been farming for 20 years. She has employed  one person from her community to help with the farm work. Her products are maize, milk, and tea which she sells at the local market. Her major challenge has been the limited availability of animal feed due to dry seasons and also, animal diseases.

She has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo for 60,000 KES to purchase a dairy cow. This loan will enable her to acquire a quality dairy cow that will produce enough milk for sale. The extra income from this loan will enable her to improve the living standard of her family.

Jane intends to purchase another piece of land and buy more dairy cows in future. She says that she is willing to work with Juhudi for as long as it takes.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Hatou

texts.fr: Hatou D. est une femme de 39 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants en charge. elle est membre du Banc Villageois de PAKOUR depuis 30 décembre 2008. Elle a 03 fois de suite reçu de crédit et a toujours remboursé régulièrement sans difficulté. Elle fait un petit commerce et vend de l'arachide, de l'huile de palme et de la pâte d'arachide, ce nouveau prêt lui permettra d'augmenter sa capacité d'approvisionnement en marchandises et accroître son activité. Elle participe à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille en contribuant à la nourriture, la santé et au payement de la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
Hatou D. is 39. She is married with four children, all still at home. She has belonged to the Banc Villageois of Pakour since December 30, 2008. She has had three loans, all repaid without problems. She has a small business selling peanuts, palm oil and peanut butter, Her new loan will allow her to build her inventory and grow her business. She helps improve her family's standard of living by supporting their nutritional and health needs and by paying school fees for the children.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve ability to finance own activities
